review.user_review_title: Rice is incredibly delicious--much sweeter and more sticky; not really quick cooking ‚Äì 4.5 stars
review.user_review:
I never heard of sprouted brown rice before. However, this rice is sweeter than normal rice and is more "sticky" and less chewy that regular brown rice. I used my rice cooker to cook this. First, I washed the rice. Per the instructions, I cooked it on the white rice setting with a 1/3 cup more water. Three cups was done in about one hour which is typical of when I cook white rice. Therefore, it is not quick cooking unless the package means it cooks quicker than standard brown rice. If that is what is meant, then it does cook quicker. I took off 1/2 a star because I felt the words quick cooking are misleading and because the current price of $8.25 is expensive for two pounds.

I had this with olive oil and black garlic powder (see photo). I also added mint in the rice (not shown). I could not stop eating this. It is incredibly delicious!

review.user_review_title: Reminds me of Annie‚Äôs Mac and Cheese; tastes good but very pricey
review.user_review:
Kraft Deluxe is my favorite boxed macaroni¬†and cheese and this is a close second. It reminds me of Annie's mac and cheese.

There are four 6 ounce boxes of tiny elbows with one package of powdered¬†cheese per box. I just cooked the pasta for 9 minutes, drained it, threw it back in the pot, and then added 1/4 cup of milk,¬† 1 tablespoon of butter (optional), and the cheese packet. In order to make this more healthy, I also added in some steamed broccoli and some parsley. I tried it both plain and with the addition and it was very good.

The calories as prepared come to 280 per serving and there are 2.5 servings per container. Note that the butter calories are not included since that is optional.

Overall, I like this. However, the current price of $24.29 comes to $6.07 per box which I consider outrageously expensive. I can purchase an equivalent amount of shells for about $2 and then add Velvita cheese and get a similar result. This is the only reason I rated this 3 stars. Otherwise, based on taste, this is 4 stars to me.

review.user_review_title: Wonderful coffee from a pod; tastes like cold brew; not bitter; smooth & light taste
review.user_review:
Previously, I tried these [[ASIN:B092PJM1YD coffee tea bags]] and was disappointed. I wanted to try another brand, so I ordered these.

There are 30 individually wrapped coffee tea bags in the pouch good enough for 30 cups of coffee. I just removed the "coffee tea bag" from its package and spread its wings over my mug. I then ripped the top seam off so it looked like a drip coffee maker's open filter. Next I slowly poured boiling water over the pouch and let it steep for 5 minutes. The directions say for 3-5 minutes and to use 150 ml of water (5.072 fluid ounces) but I used about 8-10 ounces of water because I prefer a lighter flavored coffee.

It brewed to a beautiful and clear amber color. The taste was smooth and not at all bitter. In fact, it reminded me of a cup of cold brewed coffee but only it was hot.

I absolutely love this invention. There is a lot of packaging waste but if one wants a cup of joe on the go, then these portable pouches answer that call.

The current price of $12 ($24 minus 50% coupon) is a steal for this as it comes to .40 per cup. If it were the regular price it would not be such a bargain.

UPDATE - What I do notice is that sometimes the paper wings over the cup come undone and spring back to the coffee tea bag. I just press down on the rim where the wings are hanging over and that seems to help. This does not happen after the water is poured.

FINAL UPDATE: I had several people try this. One person was disabled with Parkinson's and found this too complicated to use. However, my Postman liked this because he said it was good for travel. He did not find the coffee to be as good tasting as I did but he overall liked this.

review.user_review_title: I purchased both the chicken & beef baby food for my sick cat; the price is right
review.user_review:
I purchase both the chicken and beef baby food for my sick cat because I could no longer find lamb baby food which is really the best to try for cats. However, the price of $10 for each is only twenty cents more than what my local store sells it for. Unfortunately, my sick cat would not eat this but my other two cats ate it. This is also great for starting kittens on solid food but should not be part of a regular diet; only as a treat or to start them eating or to get a sick cat to eat.

Lamb is always the best but I do not believe Gerber has this anymore. The next best is turkey or chicken with beef as a last resort. Usually cats that refuse to eat will eat Gerber meats but, obviously, not always.

review.user_review_title: Excellent Ziplock bag organizer w/cutter to hang on a wall or put in a super large drawer; LARGE
review.user_review:
This is a good five-compartment organizer with one compartment for a roll of foil with a cutter and four other compartments for different types of Ziplock bags (quart, gallon, sandwich, and snack). There is also an extra cutter strip included.

The unit's faceplate is a bit flimsy. That faceplate slides out on the side so that it can be loaded but I find it easier to load through the holes, except for the foil compartment. That compartment can be used for plastic wrap or wax paper but the label reads foil. This can be hung on the wall or be placed in a drawer that is large enough to hold it--the drawer must be large. The underside does NOT have felt circles already affixed to keep this from sliding around or scratching a drawer. There are four screws with plastic mollies provided for hanging. This should be secured to a stud if hanging.

Note that the cutting strip for the foil has to be seated on the bottom of the unit after removing the adhesive backer. The adhesive is very strong. I'm surprised it cuts well.

Note that when this is on the wall, the bags can fall out when loading the foil. As long as a roll does not have to be loaded, I find it is easier to just insert the bags through their holes as long as I am not filling it with too many bags.

Overall, this is an excellent organizer that does away with all those squished and ugly boxes in my cabinets. It is definitely a quality unit. The current price of $19.99 is EXTREMELY reasonable for this. This style is typically much more expensive. Other options that are available for organizers like this are this [[ASIN:B09D5Y63D1 one]] if one is looking for four separate compartments. For a variety of organizers (separate and one unit), then I recommend this [[ASIN:B09KMNHM2J one]] or this [[ASIN:B09VGP1WRL one]]. For one full unit only, then I recommend this [[ASIN:B09RF759BM rustic organizer]]. For a more modern look, I recommend this [[ASIN:B09WN5PZ6Q one]]. For a larger unit that has room for both foil and plastic wrap, then I highly recommend this [[ASIN:B0B1TPD21S one]]. I tried all of these and the style purchased is based on what one desires.

review.user_review_title: Functional but FLAWED Ziplock bag organizer to hang on a wall or put in a drawer; hardware incl
review.user_review:
This would have been a great five-compartment organizer to store different types of Ziplock bags (quart, gallon, sandwich, and snack) and a roll of either foil, plastic wrap, or wax paper. Unfortunately, it has three design flaws.

FLAWS

- First, mine arrived with a crack in the base (see photo).

- Second, the entire unit opens, which means everything falls out when reloading it while on the wall. Bags can be loaded through the holes easily, however.

- Third, because the unit opens for reloading, the roll has to constantly be re-threaded through the dispenser slot on the bottom. There are other units that keep that compartment separate (either via a hole on the side or a separate door) for that reason. Because there is no way to replace the roll without opening this unit, it is subject to the 2nd design flaw above.

This comes with two mounting screws with plastic mollies needed to hang this on a wall. If putting this in a drawer, it has rubberized feet affixed to the bottom to prevent scratches or prevent it from sliding around.

Overall, this is still a functional organizer that does away with all those squished and ugly boxes in my cabinets and perhaps one roll of foil. However, it is less functional when hung and the longevity due to the cracked back and security of the hinges is questionable. The current price of $22.99 is commensurate with the low quality of this unit.

There are many other Ziplock bag organizer options available on the market such as this [[ASIN:B09KMNHM2J one]] or this [[ASIN:B09VGP1WRL one]]. For one full unit only, then I recommend this [[ASIN:B09RF759BM rustic organizer]]. For a more modern look, I recommend this [[ASIN:B09WN5PZ6Q one]] or an individual heavy plastic set like [[ASIN:B09THNTBGX this]]. For a larger unit that has room for foil and plastic wrap, then I highly recommend this [[ASIN:B0B1TPD21S one]]. I tried all of these and the style purchased is based on what one desires. I personally like these other ones a little better than this one.

review.user_review_title: Only the smallest of particles gets through this brew basket
review.user_review:
This review is for the Tiesta stainless steel brew basket.

I love all things tea and I have many brew baskets. This infuser is excellent. It is larger enough to let full leaf teas unfurl and has small enough sieve holes to let only the tiniest of particles (what I call dust) to escape (see photo 4). I also like that the top can be used to hold the basket once the tea is brewed. Overall, this is very well designed---easy to use and clean.

review.user_review_title: I like that these are cheap enough for me to give away and the colors are cool
review.user_review:
I purchased this to load pictures and stories onto them to give away as a memory keepsake for a friend that died. They light up when connected and the top flips to expose the connector. The data transfer rate is fine, nothing spectacular. There is also a little loop in the metal where a lanyard can be affixed in case once wanted to hang this off a key ring, necklace (why would you), etc.

What I do not like is that the cover turns so easily that the connector is rarely covered. So if I were to transport this, the connection end has a high risk of remaining open to the elements or the stuff found in one's purse. Nevertheless, I would order these again if I were going to pass them on. I also love the colors.

review.user_review_title: DO NOT REMOVE home button plastic cover; case is excellent but instructions do not list this issue
review.user_review:
I just ordered this for my 7th generation iPad and the case itself appears to be almost indestructible. In fact it is so well put together that it takes about 30 minutes just to install it with the iPad.

INSTALLATION
- Pull the stand off the case.

- Remove the silicone outer rim from the cover. I found removing the silicone rim hard to figure out until I took my fingernail¬†to peel if off the track that goes around the entire top of the case. It gets peeled off from the outermost edge.

- Unhinge the miniscule snaps (by the arrows) located around the case in order to open it. Once again, my stubby fingernails came in handy. It is only then that the iPad can be inserted.

- Insert the iPad into the open case. Make sure it is facing correctly based on the orientation of the case.

- DO NOT remove the plastic film covering the home button that is on the clear plastic case top. I did not know this and removed it and it damaged the cover with glue (see photos). It removed cleanly on all but one side where tremendous glue residue was left behind. The plastic film was partially up before I even began pulling it off and is typical of the type film I see covering watch faces, etc. so naturally I removed it as there was no mention not to in the manual.

- Re-fasten the top and "snap" it into place.

- Re-attach the silicone rim. Make sure that the rim once again is pulled up and over the top of the case and that the silicone edge is pushed into the track around the case. If it is not seated in the track, the case will not be sealed correctly.

With regard to the large smear of glue residue left behind by the thin plastic film that covered the home button. I contacted support to find out what can be used to remove this residue but there was nothing they could recommend with the iPad inside. They did say possibly hand sanitizer because it had alcohol in it but that should not touch the iPad. A damp rag did not work nor did a rag with water. This is extremely upsetting to me because it mars an otherwise nice looking case. However, they are sending me a replacement case with a possible return label for the "new" damaged case. I will update my review after I receive the new case.

The stand is detachable and has two heights that can be used in four positions. What this means is that the low stand can be used with the iPad in the portrait or landscape postion. The stand can then be reversed for standing up the iPad in¬†the portrait or landscape postion. I personally only like the landscape position for either height as it feels like the iPad is going to fall using in portrait mode.

Also note that the stand is not easy to just snap on and off of the case if one is storing it there. It takes a little bit of effort and time. Although, it can be snapped on the case for portability, I have chosen not to do this because of this difficulty. Instead I just choose to lay the stand on top of the iPad so it is easily put into service.

In summary, this is an excellent case that offers superb protection for the iPad. The case is extremely heavy. It is almost like carrying a laptop around from the olden days. I love the low stand angle with the iPad in the landscape position; in fact, that is the only way I like the stand. This postion is perfect for typing on the iPad as if one is typing on a keyboard.¬† I am, however, very upset about the glue left behind from the plastic circle strip that covered the home button which I should not have removed but which was not mentioned in the manual. Had my cover not been destroyed by this glue, I would have rated this 4 stars. If there was no glue residue and the stand was part of the cover and was not so heavy, I would have rated this 5 stars. I personally prefer a stand that is attached to the case. This requires setup each time as a separate piece.

UPDATE: I updated my review above regarding the home button sticker I pulled off. Otter box said it was not supposed to get removed because it is a fully enclosed system. I asked them to update their documentation to say this so others do not make the same mistake I did. I will post another update after my new case arrives and perhaps update this review to 4 stars if it is satisfactory.

UPDATE 2/29/20 - I finally got my replacement Otter Box and it is working fine. I now know not to remove that plastic film over the Home Button even if it looks like it is falling off or should come off.

review.user_review_title: Once I got past the installation and no documentation nightmare; I fell in love with this tablet
review.user_review:
I purchased this at the end of July 2014 along with:

[[ASIN:B00E5NOXM4 Google Nexus 7 2013 Case - Poetic Google Nexus 7 2013 Case [Slimline Series] - [Lightweight] [Ultra-slim] PU Leather Slim-Fit Trifold Cover Stand Folio Case for Google Nexus 7 2nd Gen 2013 Black (3 Year Manufacturer Warranty From Poetic)]]

[[ASIN:B008MOHLVC Stylus, amPen¬Æ Hybrid Stylus (Black) for Apple iPad Air/iPad 2/iPad Mini, Apple iPhone 6 (4.7)/6 Plus (5.5)/5/5s/5c/4s, Nexus 5/7, Galaxy Tab 4/3/2, Galaxy S5/S4, HTC One M8/M7 (Interchangeable Hybrid Tip Feature)]].

I also ordered the [[ASIN:1937842282 Google Nexus 7 (Android 4.4 KitKat Edition)]] book as a compliment to this purchase.

I waited almost six months to write this review because I wanted to "cool off" from my installation experience that would have caused me to rate this 3 stars. I am also now able to fairly assess this tablet after a few months' use.

I wanted a highly-rated unrestricted (open) tablet that provided great graphics and sufficient screen space. I purchased this to use on a Wi-Fi network only for when I didn't want to boot up my laptop to check mail or see a movie, etc. I also did not want an Apple tablet because my boyfriend has an iPad 3 and the Apple products have restrictions. I also was not impressed with the graphics on his iPad. I was considering a Kindle Fire HD 7" but that tablet was too restrictive as well and was geared to Amazon junkies. I am an Amazon junkie but I also do not like restrictions on products I purchase. During my July 2014 research, I discovered that the Nexus 7 tablet was the highest rated Android next to those more restrictive tablets.

After I received the Nexus, I wondered if I had made the right decision. First, I was surprised that this came with no documentation (other than the business card sized diagram of where all the ports were and a warranty and safety agreement in both English and French). The documentation didn't even say how long I needed to charge the unit. I charged it overnight and then had immense trouble getting this connected.

The router I was connecting to has MAC filtering enabled so I needed the MAC address. However, I couldn't get the MAC address without setting up the device. Also, I couldn't set it up because I couldn't get the MAC address. I could have fussed with the router and turned off MAC filtering/security temporarily but I had to get to work in the morning right after the unit completed charging. I then tried connecting via three other networks (my library for one, my work another, and another Wi-Fi connection). It still would not connect. Because I didn't want to wait until I got home 12 hours later to fuss with my router I wound up asking a tech support person where I work. He connected me via his personal MiFi mobile hotspot.

Apparently, Google Nexus only connects to certain networks if the first time setup has not been done. I tried several open networks. My co-worker's MiFi mobile network connection, although I suspect mine would have connected had I temporarily removed the security on my router, was the only one that would allow me to run the automatic setup so that I could connect. After setup was performed, I was able to get the MAC address from the settings "about" tab. I was also able to connect to the three other networks I tried previously and after inputting the MAC address, I could also connect to my router. It was apparently the initial setup process that prevented the connection.

This Google Nexus would have gotten five stars if they enhanced the user experience by:
1 - Providing a MAC address either on the unit or on a piece of paper for those that have MAC filtering enabled.
2 - Providing a documentation pamphlet with the unit that:
* Tells the user how long they need to charge the unit the first time.
* Explains to the user that setup cannot be run on all networks and sometimes they will get an error message. Therefore, they might say something like "using your own network is advisable" or provide an explanation of why certain networks (including totally open ones that allow all connections) would not work. Perhaps there is some sort of technical protocol that is not available on all networks; I have no idea.

Other than the above, I absolutely love my Google Nexus. I've been using this for almost 6 months and it has met my every expectation. It charges in less than four hours; lasts about 3 hours if I'm constantly using it; lasts about 3-4 days when I'm using it for about 10 minutes daily. I've used this for email, movies, web surfing, pictures, etc. App availability is unending (Kindle, LinkedIn, Battery Doctor, etc., etc.) I tested the screen image next to my co-workers Kindle Fire HD 7" and there is no discernible difference in quality or resolution. Images and movies on this device are superb. If I attach my [[ASIN:B00N4SIIFY APLWL USB 2.0 A to Micro B Cable 6FT-TPE jacket-Blue]] to my laptop, I can both charge the unit and also access files on it from my laptop such as the photos located under Nexus 7\Internal storage\DCIM\Camera directory (that's Computer\Nexus 7\Internal storage\DCIM\Camera in Explorer).

Overall this is a quality tablet that did not disappoint me once I got past the initial installation and lack of documentation headache. In the comments section of my review, I put links to Google documentation I found helpful as well as to the 2014 review I used for my research.

UPDATE Jan 6, 2015 - Right after I wrote this review I had a problem where my Nexus was shutting down automatically and every time I went to use it I had to power it back up. After doing an Internet search I was able to fix this by going to the Play Store app on the Nexus, then selecting "My Apps" and accepting all install updates. There were a few updates that had not installed and this was playing havoc with my system. After I did this, the Nexus remained powered up and has been working fine the last several days.

review.user_review_title: A powerful Bluetooth speaker with great sound, AM/FM radio, lights, and microphone
review.user_review:
I purchased four Bluetooth speakers for my house over a several year period. I have a [[ASIN:B007ZG03DG Bose Wave Bluetooth Music Adapter]], which is not very good and a [[ASIN:B00MPMK3GW Goal Zero 94014 Rock Out 2 Green Solar Rechargeable Speaker]] which does not work when paired with some devices and, when it does pair well, it usually lacks the powerful sound I am looking for.

I also purchased an [[ASIN:B00SNBCBBY ION Audio Block Rocker (iPA76A) | Portable Bluetooth Speaker]] at Costco which I absolutely love. As a result, I wanted another one of these but they were no longer available at Costco and I did not want to pay more for it on Amazon. Therefore, Costco had this speaker for $79.99 plus tax. Although, I love my Block Rocker a tad more (because I do not like the lights on this one), this is an excellent speaker. It pairs well with many devices including my Nexus 7, HP Omen, and iPad Pro. The sound is powerful and seems like surround sound indoors. I purchased both ION speakers for indoors but they are more for an outdoor environment.

When indoors, the AM/FM radio does not work well even with the antenna. I also do not need the microphone feature and do not like the lights for my purposes. If I were running a disco or was just playing music for a party, then I would love the lights. There are many versions of the lights including a star formation, pulsating to music type lights, just a movement of light colors, etc.Every time I turn the unit on, I have to cycle through all the light settings to turn the lights off. I wish it remembered my last setting but it does not. What I do like is that it automatically turns on Bluetooth and is ready for pairing. My other ION always require I wait a few seconds and then press a Bluetooth button to start the pairing. This speaker has the option but it is usually not needed. Also, the battery lasts a long time. I have used it for several hours already and it remains fully charged based on the indicator.

I love this speakers sound. It is extremely powerful and loud. The extra I am free to ignore.

review.user_review_title: As good as the more expensive Leica brand binoculars
review.user_review:
This is my third pair of binoculars. Years ago I purchased a pair of Yamaha bincolars for about $200 of a similar power (8 or 10) and diameter (42 or 50) for wildlife viewing. The lens stopped working after two years so I then purchased a fantastic pair of waterproof 10 x 42 Leica binoculars that have served me well on vacation and when I went on safari.

However, these Endeavor ED 8420 binoculars by Vanguard (at the current list price of $339.88) seem to be almost as good as my $1,000 Leica's with the exception that these are not waterproof and the power is only 8 instead of 10. According to the package, it also comes with a lifetime warranty.

The only trouble I had was putting on the carrying strap. The diopter ring was easily set and locks securely once set. The eye cups are easily adjustable. However, because I wear glasses, I had to leave them in the down position. The objective lens cap is fixed onto the binoculars with rubber rings and the eye cap (cover) is hooked onto the carrying strap. This means there are no pieces to lose, which is nice. The body cover has a nice grip to it so the bincoulars are unlikely to fall out of my hands. The weight is 25.8 ounces.

According to the instructions, there is also a tripod adapter which sits between the lens. I honestly don't know if this would work on all tripods after you screw off the cap because of its position and I did not try this feature. A carrying case and lens cloth also is provided.

Although I am not a bincoluar connoisseur by any means, this pair I received for review have impressed me. Time will tell if they last like the Leica's or fail like the Yamaha I had. However, if they fail there's always that lifetime warranty where all that has to be paid is shipping both ways. That's not too bad a deal.

description: Vanguard's Endeavor ED binoculars provide nature and outdoor enthusiasts high performance features at an incredible value. Premium ED (Extra-low Dispersion) glass with MultiGuard coatings allow for sharp, bright images and high contrast even in low-light conditions. The ED glass aligns the colors to meet at the same focal plane to reduce the chromatic aberration and obtain the highest resolution and image contrast. As a result, the image is sharper.

Endeavor ED features an ergonomic, open-bridge design that's comfortable to use, along with a lightweight magnesium alloy body, large center focus wheel, and 3 stage twist out eyecups, . Nitrogen-charged and O-ring sealed, the Endeavor ED is water and fog proof to take on challenging weather conditions. Emerald Coating is specifically designed to provide the full spectrum of color within the band of green tones. This coating is essential for nature enthusiasts, because it ensures the most vivid and natural shades of green.

P2 Phase Coating was developed for enhanced image clarity and true color reproduction. Vanguard's P2 phase-coated BaK4 prisms creates crystal clear images and high resolution observation. V-Max Silver Coating provides crisper, more vivid images and sharper contrast due to impressive light reflection. Anti-Reflection Coating on all air-to-surface lenses dramatically minimizes light reflection on the lens. Coupled with fully multi-coated treatment, it ensures near perfect light transmission and image recognition, enabling the brightest images possible, even on the sunniest days.

review.user_review_title: Colorful bag with eight separate compartments; it does attract lint since it's cloth
review.user_review:
For years I have been admiring Vera Bradley bags but never purchased one because paisley is not my style. However, after reading Barbara Bradley's book ([[ASIN:1250121914 A Colorful Way of Living: How to Be More, Create More, Do More the Vera Bradley Way]], I decided I had to have a bag of hers (since the company branched out beyond paisley) and purchased this at my local "The Paper Store" for $68.95 plus tax. I love it because it is colorful and has eight separate compartments (pockets), one of which I did not discover until after I was using the bag a few weeks. The design is also attractive.

The only negative is that this attracts a lot of lint and since I have cats, I am forever using the lint roller on the bottom. Other than this, I love it.

review.user_review_title: Great as an outer shirt or undershirt for a woman but it runs a size too small
review.user_review:
There are three shirts in the package I received - black, white, and gray. All the shirts are 100% cotton and they are super soft and somewhat stretchy. I actually wore the black shirt as an outer shirt and plan to wear the gray one as that as well. The white shirt I will wear as an undershirt because it is on the see-through side.

I know this is a man's shirt but I order men's shirts like this for me. If I want a snug fit, I order a medium which I will then use as an undershirt. If I want a loose fit to wear as an outer shirt, then I order a large. However, this large fits almost like a medium on me. They are a bit snug but not super snug. It is actually shapely, form fitting, and looks good on me. The bottom of the shirt falls down to my upper thigh. Since I really like how they look and feel, I rated this 4 stars even though it is slightly snug.

However, these ARE NOT true to size and at $29.95 they are expensive at $10 each. All the shirts I received were sewn correctly and the only thing wrong with these is that they are not cut correctly for the size specified.

I already wore and washed the black shirt and it washes well. I choose, however, to hang dry it as I am afraid it will shrink.

review.user_review_title: Thick, beautiful sweatshirt but runs on the small side
review.user_review:
I usually wear a medium to large in a men's shirt. If I want a snug fit, I go for a medium. If I want a loose fit, I go for a large. Therefore, I expected a loose slouchy fit with this hoodie since I ordered it in a men's XL. However, it fits me like a large. Basically, it fits me perfectly but I was looking for a looser fit.

Nevertheless, this sweatshirt hoodie is hefty and so soft on the inside. The logo on the outside is attractive to me. The current price of $94.97 for this Light Grey Denim Heather hoodie in a men's XL is a bit expensive for what it is but one is paying for the name. I expect a sweatshirt of this caliber to be sold in the $50 or $60 range.

Overall, I am pleased. I just wish the fit were larger.

review.user_review_title: Works reasonably well for espresso and coffee, frothing milk not much...
review.user_review:
Summary: a decent one serving maker for espresso or coffee but for frothing milk however, I'll stick with a microwave and whisk.

This little Gadget does a fairly decent job of making espresso or cafe Americano, which is simply a diluted espresso. There is a plastic water reservoir up top with an insulated glass container at the bottom, the water at the top is forced through a metal filter using a hand plunger to pressurize the water reservoir. The operation is fairly simple, however a few things to note. The plastic reservoir seems to cool down the water fairly quickly, so I'd suggest using water above 200, perhaps 205 F so that once the metal plunger and plastic reservoir come up to temp, you're at the correct water temperature. Another thing to note is that to get a good brew, you need to plunge a few times, then let it sit for at least a minute or two so that you can extract a little bit more. I found that if I simply continued to pressurize the reservoir continually, I tended to extract too little from the coffee. Part of the issue might be that the coffee I had was around a little on the coarse side (although I use the Turkish grind setting, the coffee grinder at Trader Joes often is out of whack.)

I would avoid using this for frothing milk. Well it doesn't okay job, cleaning this afterwards is really a major hassle. I find that frothing the milk by heating it up in the microwave and then using a whisk is about AZ good, and a lot less cleanup. The biggest reason why I'm doing this down to four stars is that the glass container at the bottom is double-walled, but not sealed, so water actually ends up getting between the two layers of glass - rather annoying.

Sample received for evaluation

review.user_review_title: Easy to see why these are a "Top Pick" with Cook's Illustrated...
review.user_review:
Summary: "Budget" knife suitable for professional chefs or cooking fanatics on a budget. Fantastic bang for the buck for heavy duty, commercial grade knives. Highly rated in Cooks Illustrated.

Although I have a set of Trident forged knives. I jumped at the chance to check out these knives since some of the specialty knives in this set (Granton Santoku and the flexible filet) will be a welcome addition to my collection. Some years ago someone told me that Victorinox / Forschner are the most popular knife in culinary schools due to their bang for the buck - considered the best performing knives for the cost.

I am not disappointed. These knives are extremely sharp, right out of the box. The handles are nicely molded and feel solid. The blade thickness varies between the blades, and tapers from the handle down to the tip, clearly indicating that they do a lot to these knives after the stamping process - although the 8" chefs is a stamped blade, it still feels more than stiff and sturdy enough when cutting carrots. The only minus I would make is that the storage block was made in China. It's typical "Nato" or "Rubber tree wood" - the photo here at Amazon is accurate, so zoom in for a good look. although it's a hard solid wood, I don't consider the grain to be that attractive. Unfortunately, I'm sure maple or oak would have driven the cost up considerably. Nato doesn't absorb oil so once the finish gets scratched it tends to look more worn than oak or maple with a mineral oil finish.

"Budget knife?"
This is not a cheap set and there are cheaper knives, but I'm classifying them as budget knives since they are stamped - albeit certainly amonth the best stamped knives out there. If you look around, there's a clear price break between stamped knives and forged knives. This can be a little tricky since even Trident and Henckels now carry stamped blades. Here's an example of a large forged set [[ASIN:B004U8QE44 Wusthof Classic Ikon 22-Piece Block Knife Set]] or [[ASIN:B003MU9F60 Wusthof Classic 20-Piece Knife Set with Block]]. Victorinox also carries forged knives [[ASIN:B0014CHUEC Victorinox Forged 17-Piece Knife Set with Block]] has 5 fewer pieces at twice the price of this set.

Do I really need this many knives?
The set of 22 pieces includes 8 steak knives and a storage block so you're talking about 13 knives. Looking over the list, I can't say there's an obvious overlap, but at the same time the 10-1/4" slicer is not something you're going to use often given the 8" slicer. Similarly a dedicated flexible filet knife will be better but I currently use a 6" slicer as a filet knife. My approach was to slowly build up a collection of higher quality knives. I started with a 6" chefs, then got an 8 piece set (included 2 paring knives, 6" slicer, 8" slicer, bread, 8" chef, tomato knife, shears, block) then a 10" wide chefs and finally a short paring knife. This was a MUCH more expensive way to go, though on the other hand, the cost was spread out over about 20 years. With the online price being about half the list price, I have to say this is an incredible value for high quality knives.

Stamped vs Forged?
If you're less concerned with cost, high end knives are typically hot stamped forged. This gives a thicker, stiffer, heavier blade that feels more solid. With the recommended hand position (thumb and forefinger at the base of the knife) they're also more comfortable since the blade is typically much thicker there (I have a forged Santoku which isn't, and it can get uncomfortable after a while The downside is that they often cost 3-5 times more.
Stamped blades can easily be as good for sharpness. Victorinox- Forschner make their knives in Switzerland, and these are definitely among the best stamped knives I've seen (Chicago Cutlery are another brand with excellent stamped blades -I have several of their walnut handled paring knives. Very good with full tangs.)

WTF is NSF?
In a nutshell, this means they are sanitary and approved for use in restaurants, food service, etc. Originally "National Sanitation Foundation" the NSF sets guidelines for food safety. Wood handles, for example, are not NSF approved since bacteria can linger in the wood pores. Other types of handles which have cracks or gaps where food particles can accumulate are also not approved. Fibrox is a proprietary resin that Victorinox- Forschner use for their handles. They're waterproof and heat resistant, though I haven't tested to see what the temp rating is.

General tips
1) Never let your knives go through the dishwasher - the abrasive/corrosive environment dulls them noticeably even after a single wash.
2)Wipe your knives off by hand and dry them before storing back in the block
3)Get a sharpening steel and use it regularly. If you steel your knives twice a week (~10 passes each side, alternating) you can go some time without sharpening them. I like my knives to be "scary sharp" and use a [[ASIN:B001GKFAOO F. Dick 10" Diamond Coated Sharpening Steel, Oval]] and probably go ~2 years or more without sharpening - note however that diamond steels do provide more of a sharpening effect than traditional steels. If you use a traditional steel you will probably need to use an abrasive sharpener (e.g. whet stone) at least once a year to maintain an optimum edge.
4) An inexpensive option to stone your knives is to use wet and dry sandpaper on a sheet of glass. Start with at least 400 grit and go up to 600, then 1000. If you want to shave with your knives, go to an auto supply store and get some 1500 and 2000 grit paper to finish your knives off. Use a very light touch when drawing the knive across the paper. This is the technique I use to get a razor edge on chisels as well. This technique is colloquially known to woodworkers as "Scary sharp"

If you have any questions or comments, or if you found this review helpful, please let me know!

review.user_review_title: TINY!  Takes longer than the full-size AC pumps, but more than sufficient power
review.user_review:
We live near the Argo Cascades on the Huron River so we often take floaties and tubes there in the summer. We also frequently use an air mattress when travelling so the kids don't complain about who is kicking who while they sleep.
This is SOOOOOOO much smaller than the regular AC pump but it still gets the job done.

review.user_review_title: Excellent smartphone converts into flawed (but free) tablet
review.user_review:
Summary - You might like this if you travel a lot and don't want to worry about having data on two separate devices. It's a decent smartphone that converts into a OK but fairly mediocre tablet - it's a compromise that saves money and eliminates synching content, etc, but doesn't save much space or weight.

This is an impressive smartphone - 5" HD display, wireless charging (Powermat compatible), NFC, quad-core processor, removable MicroSD, 1080P display, etc, but if you compare the Asus PadFone X to the Samsung Galaxy S5,the HTC One M8, or the LG G2, it will come up short. It's a very respectable flagship phone, but strictly as a phone, I'd say it garners at best a 4th place. More on that later.

The tablet docking station is both a plus and a minus. There aren't any other phones that I know of that turn into 9" tablets, which means you only have to install your apps once. You don't have to have your email and other data on two devices, only one. But then, this tablet has several major issues. For comparison, it weighs 1.5 lbs, which is a good quarter pound heavier than the 2 generation old 10.1" Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1. Then the balance is off, given the large hump the phone locks into. That gives the tablet a strange balance which means it's rather tiring to hold. Then the bezel is big. Way too big. So it's as big as the Samsung, heavier but the screen is more than an inch smaller.

The graphics on the tablet are very sharp, but there was some lag when scrolling quickly through large web pages. Visual quality was good for movies though, even with larger file sizes, and sound was also good.

Why is this phone at best 4th place? It's comparitively heavy and thick, even when considering what the wireless charging adds to the back. The screen size is smaller when you consider that while the screen is 5" diagonal but you only get to use that real estate when you're watching a movie - since the phone uses virtual home, back and menu buttons, you end up with a much smaller screen, perhaps 4.7" in most apps and when reading web pages. Native skin and apps are at a minimum, but you still get lots of bloatware from AT&T. It took me a while to figure out that you have to use the Google Play app to listen to music - it's an inteface with few frills when you're playing local content.

Me, I'm sticking with my Galaxy S5,

review.user_review_title: Great size, speed, usability.....Resolution and screen balance off with price...Video performance OK
review.user_review:
Summary: Fast, and functional tablet exceeds expectations for the price....but video performance is only OK

We have a Samsung 10.1" tablet and have used relatives iPads and other tablets. This does not compete with those. This is the sort of tablet you'd put in a jacket so you can watch a movie on a plane or give to your kids so they can play Angry Birds while you're enjoying some after-dinner conversation with the adults.

Physically, it's a bit thicker than the top tier of tablets, and at 9.7 oz it's no lightweight, but the case has a solid feel and the relatively thin bezel means the overall size is still reasonable, fitting in a coat pocket with no issues. Note that the screen does not have a glass cover - it's plastic,as are all the ones at this price point. That does mean you will have to be careful.

Display is IPS which means you can see it well from different angles. This is particularly important where you are looking at something close, like a phone or tablet. Resolution, however is pretty mediocre. Most flagship smartphones have 1920x1024 on a 5" screen, and this has 1024x600 on a 7" screen - however for most web browsing and for watching movies and playing games, it's sufficient.

Performance is solid with no lag when swiping or switching around, surfing the web was very fast. I switched over to Chrome, as the native browser refused to let me change the home page and would crash when I tried to access the more advanced settings.

One weak point is video performance which I would characterize as OK - hard to expect a lot more at this price point. Trying to play a 1280x690 movie gave a sjust noticeable stutter, as did GoPro videos shot at 720p/240 fps, even fast action sequences at lower resolutions weren't great (UsIng VLC) . Although the screen doesn't display the full resolution, the tablet had no issues displaying 720p movies smoothly. It did have a few issues displaying GoPro videos shot at 720P at 240 fps - there's a definite but not using VLC. Even my older desktop would stutter on this.

Performance with the native video player was much better, but then it couldn't figure out the fast frame rate of the GoPro video so the sound was out of sync. Fast action in a 640x272 video with the native player still showed a small amount of stutter.

Sample provided for evaluation

review.user_review_title: Upgrade your event with a professional / high quality name tags!
review.user_review:
Summary: Seriously professional name tags with high quality feel and appearance.

Name tags tend to look rather chintzy, particularly if they don't stick well, wrinkle, or the corners turn up.

If it's a 1 hour meet and greet, this may not be much of an issue, but if you have an all day conference or multi-day seminar, it's definitely noticeable.

Most of your less expensive name tags are thin paper, and the adhesive isn't anything to write home about. These are made from a thick plastic film and have some serious adhesive. Definitely should last multiple applications on most fabrics. Normal cautions apply for leather, etc.

Downloadable template allows you to print from your computer. The plastic material also makes laser and ink jet printing look crisper - kind of like the plastic coating on photo paper. Even magic marker looks nicer on this material. Sharper contrast and brighter colors.

Perforated so you can separate the name tags individually. At about 25 cents each, they cost more than other name tags but still are an inexpensive way to upgrade your next event!!!

If you've found this review helpful or have any questions/comments, please let me know!

review.user_review_title: Decent volume and sound quality in a splash-resistant package....No 5V out, finish could be a touch better...
review.user_review:
I've lost track of the bluetooth speakers I've reviewed over the years. I've had several Altec Lansing computer speakers over the years so I was happy to give these a spin. Overall they performed well, though I'd say that the volume, sound quality and size were about what I expected at this price point.

Pairing was quick and easy, range was about 30-35 feet line-of-sight before the signal started to drop. Outdoors, max volume allows you to hear a decent amount of volume from up to 20 feet or so. Sound quality was good, even with bass-heavy music, they have limited the volume so you have a limited amount of distortion. At moderate sound levels the sound quality was good with an acceptable - but not overwhelming - amount of bass.

Looking at the silicone housing and charge cover, I'd have to say that this has very good splash resistance, but based on my experience with other Bluetooth speakers, I'd be very hesitant to submerge the speaker, particularly while playing.

There's a standard tripod mount on the bottom - very handy for secure mounting to a bicycle or mini tripod for standing on a table, etc.

I probably would have given this 4.5 stars, somewhere between "I like it" and "I love it" except that there's some mold flash on the sides of the silicone cover - not big deal but also not a quality touch. Also, while the picture shows a 5V out, suggesting that you could charge your phone from the internal battery in a pinch, there is in fact no 5V out on the device.

review.user_review_title: Lower capacity and thicker than OEM battery....
review.user_review:
Summary: Three stars - it's OK. Not bad for the price, but capacity is lower than latest GoPro Hero3+, and oversize case makes swapping difficult. Note: free item received for evaluation.

My first GoPro was a Hero3 Silver, and this 1050 mAh is the same capacity as the batteries which came with it. I upgraded last year to a Hero3+ Black, and those now come with 1180 mAh. Ok, so not a huge issue given the price difference, but then I found that this took a bit of effort to push into the camera. Once in, the battery works fine. Unfortunately, now you really have to pull the tab HARD to get the battery out. I carry spare batteries with me when skiing and often swap out batteries while riding on the chair lift. The difficulty in removing the battery means that I will probably have to go back to the lodge...

Overall we both did like it. Give it a try, you may like it too.

review.user_review_title: Nice size, sturdy non-slide base, wide mouth, good latch, easy to drink from
review.user_review:
This is a very classy looking drink bottle. I really appreciate the fact that the wide mouth allows for easier insertion of ice cubes over some of my other brands. The rubber bottom makes is much more "grippier" ( if that is a word ) It doesn't slide around. Coupling the wide base with the rubber pad makes for a very steady bottle.

Let's look at the cap now. If it does not have a lock I don't want it. This one has a good one. There is also a nice rubber seal to keep liquids inside and not leak out. It is easy to drink from. The plastic O shaped carry handle also works well.

I have been using vacuum-sealed double-walled water bottles for a decade or two now and I really like this one.

I really put it to the test yesterday. It was a hot Texas day, 100 degrees. I only put about 30% ice in it and filled it up with water. Leaving any bottle in a sealed up car during a hot sunny day like this is going to really test an insulated bottle. After about 1.5 hours my ice was almost gone. This is just as I had expected. If I was going to leave it in a car with temps inside of 150 or more for very long, I simply would have filled it all the way with ice.

This bottle surprisingly did much better than I expected and I will be replacing my old faithful, beat-up water bottle with my new Takeya bottle!

update, I filled it up with ice and left it in my very hot car for a couple of hours and all the ice was still there.

review.user_review_title: good price for 6 of these, easy to charge
review.user_review:
I collect flashlights and can always use more batteries. This 6 pack will come in very handy. I often gift my flashlights to friends and clients. I don't like to give them a battery that requires its own charger. This solves that problem for me. These batteries can be charged with a USB cable. It uses the better USB C and not the cheap USB micro! Everyone has USB cables. This means that I can give a flashlight away with one of these batteries and they can charge it without having to buy a separate charger.

I love Li-Ion batteries. they make most flashlights much brighter than a normal alkaline battery. Warning, I have blown some lights up by using two batteries. That doubles the output and these are already higher than alkaline. Check with the maker of the light before using Li-Ion. This is a lesson I will remember.

Anyway, I like this set. The plastic battery box that came with mine holds 4 batteries and the other two are just loose. No big deal.

I like these batteries and am happy to have them.

review.user_review_title: Stronger taste than most green teas I've tried....
review.user_review:
Green tea has never been my favorite tea. I typically prefer black tea. My children like having it on occasion, though, so I gave it a try. Plus, I was making an effort to cut back on my black tea at the time and I thought this would help. (I'm a wimp, though, and decided that caffeine withdrawal symptoms aren't for me at this point in my life.) That said, I found the flavor of this tea surprisingly good, at least in comparison to my experience with green teas. It's a bit stronger than green teas I've tried in the past. While I'm not giving up my black tea in the mornings anytime soon, this tea is a great one for me to drink later in the day. There is still caffeine in this tea, but I don't believe it's as much as black tea. (I couldn't find caffeine information on the box, so that's just an assumption, since most green teas have less caffeine than black. Plus, there was the caffeine headaches that leads me to believe there's not as much.) Each tea bag is individually wrapped with paper wrappers. It's similar to most teas I've used, with a flap at the top to open.

Overall, I like it. It's still not my favorite, but I like it better than most green teas.

review.user_review_title: If you want a super firm mattress, this is worth a try. If you prefer less firm mattresses, pass this one up.
review.user_review:
This mattress is super firm! Make sure you know that before ordering. IF you're looking for a firm mattress, you'll probably like this one. If you don't care for super firm mattresses, I'd highly recommend that you keep shopping around.

For me, I had the worst night of sleep since when I was getting up continuously with babies. I was horribly uncomfortable and my achy joints/bones were intensified with this mattress. I was in pain through the night, and I woke up in pain. Obviously, I prefer a less firm mattress. My husband's opinion was the same as mine, though he wasn't quite as repulsed by the thing as me.

Since this is a memory foam mattress, I kept expecting to eventually sink into the mattress, just a bit, but that never happened. It felt like I was laying on a wooden board. (A bit of an exaggeration, as I'm sure a wooden board is a tad less comfortable. Just a tiny bit!) From experience, I know that some of the memory foam items, like pillows, are super hard when they are cold. When they warm up, they get a bit softer. I had hopes that was the issue with this mattress, but it wasn't to be. It remained super firm.

The mattress comes compressed. Once you unroll it, it will spring to life and expand. Obviously, it's much easier to transport before you unroll it, so make sure you have it where you want it before opening the box, and releasing the mattress. (Note: The size of the box, added to the fact that it's 74+ pounds, means you'll want to attempt to have some muscle around, especially if it's going up any amount of steps/stairs. My husband had no issues getting it upstairs, but it was heavy for me trying to get it in the house when it was delivered.)

My personal rating for this thing would be 1 star. I hated it! BUT, IF you're looking for a firm mattress, this one is a really nice choice. It looks high quality. If I wanted a firm mattress, I'm guessing this one would be a 5 star mattress for me. I'm simply going with the middle 3 star, based purely on how uncomfortable it was for me. Everyone is different and prefers different things. I'm actually fond of the Sleep Innovations brand, in general, though!

Overall summary: If you want a super firm mattress, this is worth a try. If you prefer less firm mattresses, pass this one up.

review.user_review:
I like this cardigan. It has a simple, elegant look to it. It's also soft and comfortable. The V-neckline is my favorite with cardigans, too. I think I'd have liked a slightly looser fit with a size large, but this one still fits nicely. (I normally wear a medium to large, but sometimes even go up to XL with cardigans, since I like them to fit on the looser side.) I'd say it's pretty true to size, though.

My only complaint is the fading. I have a few black cardigans in various styles from Daily Ritual/Amazon Essentials and they fade pretty bad. I wish this didn't happen so quickly, but I suppose that's the price to pay with most black colored clothing. It reminds me why I stayed away from most black colored clothing until the past year or two, since I've had that issue with most all brands. I'm guessing that won't be an issue with the lighter colored ones, though. It's still a nice cardigan.

review.user_review: I'm not fond of this sweater. I was actually horribly disappointed when I saw it and most definitely so when I tried it on. The material is on the itchy, irritating side. It fits a bit smaller(overall) than I was expecting, too, considering it is supposed to be off the shoulder. It doesn't look cute on me at all, unfortunately.

We normally purchase Splenda in the bulk pack at our local Sams. I hope that they will offer this product in a bulk size in the near future.

description: Amazon.com
Product Description
From the Manufacturer
SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener, with B Vitamins*
SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener, with B Vitamins* Nutrition Information

The first and only sweetener that helps support a healthy metabolism with a small boost of vitamins B1, B5 and B6 in every packet. SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ with B Vitamins makes it easy to add a small boost of B vitamins to the things you love. Each packet has the same great taste of SPLENDA¬Æ No Calorie Sweetener plus 20% of the Daily Value of B Vitamins B1, B5 and B6 to help support a healthy metabolism. Whether you're stirring it into coffee or tea, sprinkling it on cereal or fresh fruit, or sweetening your smoothie you'll be getting extra nutrients every time. So every day, you're getting more out of what you put in!
What are the SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products?

SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products are a new line of sweeteners from the SPLENDA¬Æ Brand. These products not only help you to reduce added sugar, but also make everything you sweeten a little bit better for you; with a small boost of Fiber, B Vitamins, or Antioxidant Vitamins C and E.
Why did the SPLENDA¬Æ Brand decide to put added nutrients in SPLENDA¬Æ No Calorie Sweetener?

Becoming a healthier you means making small, good-for-you choices each day. With SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products it's never been easier to make everything you sweeten a little bit better for you with a small boost of Fiber, B Vitamins, or Antioxidants. Over time, simple steps can become healthy habits with big benefits.
Do SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products taste different than the original?
No, the SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products have the same great taste as the regular SPLENDA¬Æ No Calorie Sweetener.
How sweet are the SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products?
Each packet of SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener has the sweetness of two teaspoons of sugar, just like our SPLENDA¬Æ No Calorie Sweetener Product.
Can I cook and bake with SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products?

While this product was not specifically developed for cooking and baking, sucralose, the sweetening ingredient in all SPLENDA¬Æ Sweetener Products retains its sweetness in high temperatures. We would expect to see some losses in the potency of the vitamins in the product with the heat exposure involved in cooking and baking. However these vitamin potency losses would not be greater than what you would see normally when cooking or baking foods that contain vitamins.
Do you have any recipes using SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products?

Yes, we have a number of delicious new beverage and oatmeal recipes using SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products. All three products offer the sweet taste you love, and can be used almost anywhere sugar is sprinkled. To get the recipes, visit http://splenda.tastebook.com and search "Essentials".
SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener, with B Vitamins*
How much of the B Vitamins are in SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener with B Vitamins?
Each packet of SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener with B Vitamins contains 20% of the Daily Value of vitamins B1 (thiamin), B5 (pantothenic acid) and B6.
How do vitamins B1 (thiamin), B5 (pantothenic acid) and vitamin B6 (pyridoxine) affect metabolism?

Vitamins B1 (thiamin), B5 (pantothenic acid) and vitamin B6 (pyridoxine) support the metabolism of the macronutrients: fat, carbohydrate, and protein.1 The vitamins themselves are never a source of energy, rather they are involved in facilitating the release of energy from the energy-yielding nutrients. 2 Thiamin supports the metabolism of carbohydrates. Pantothenic Acid and Vitamin B6 support the metabolism of carbohydrates, fats, and proteins.
What does vitamin B6 (pyridoxine) do in the body?

Vitamin B6 performs a wide variety of functions in the body and is essential for good health. This vitamin is needed for more than 100 enzyme reactions involved in protein metabolism. It is also essential for the nervous and immune systems to function efficiently, and for red blood cell metabolism. Hemoglobin within red blood cells carries oxygen to tissues. The body needs vitamin B6 to make hemoglobin and this vitamin also helps to increase the amount of oxygen carried by hemoglobin.
Are SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products suitable for people with diabetes?

Yes. All SPLENDA¬Æ No Calorie Sweetener Products are suitable for people with diabetes. Sucralose, the no-calorie sweetening ingredient in all SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products is not a carbohydrate and has been shown in studies to have no effect on blood glucose control or insulin levels.

Like other no-calorie sweeteners on the market, the SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener with Antioxidants and with B Vitamins Products contain small amounts of carbohydrate (less than 1 gram per serving) that provide needed volume and texture. These common food ingredients, which include maltodextrin and dextrose, add so few calories per serving that both products meet the Food and Drug Administration's criteria for no-calorie foods (less than 5 calories/serving). In a meal plan for people with diabetes, up to 4 packets of SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener with Antioxidants or with B Vitamins Products, are considered a "free food." The American Dietetic Association and the American Diabetes Association consider a free food to be any food or beverage that contains less than 20 calories and 5 grams or less of carbohydrate per serving.

In addition to the sucralose, SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener with Fiber contains soluble fiber which is metabolized by the body and therefore needs to be accounted for in a diet for diabetes. Up to three packets of SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener with Fiber counts as a "free food" in a diet for diabetes. If a person with diabetes chooses to consume more than this in one sitting, they simply need to carbohydrate count for it.
Can SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products be used by children?

Yes, SPLENDA¬Æ Brand Sweetener (sucralose), the sweetening ingredient in SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products can be used by everyone, including children. However the daily dietary fiber, vitamin and caloric needs of children are different than adults. A child's diet should be adjusted to meet his or her individual needs. If you have questions about your child's diet /nutritional needs, please check with his or her doctor.
What is the shelf life of SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products?
SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ Sweetener Products each have a 12 month shelf life.
Are SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products dietary supplements?
No, SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products are regulated by the Food and Drug Administration as foods.
Are SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products kosher?
Yes. All SPLENDA¬Æ ESSENTIALS‚Ñ¢ No Calorie Sweetener Products are certified as kosher parve by the Union of Orthodox Jewish Congregations of America, Kashruth Division.
Reference List Guthrie HA, Picciano MF. Human Nutrition. 1995 Institute of Medicine. National Academy of Sciences, Dietary Reference Intakes. 2001

review.user_review_title: I use them for tobacco storage

review.user_review_title: nice case for a point and shoot
review.user_review: I bought a small Canon point and shoot for trips where I want more than the camera phone, but don't want to carry my DSLR with me.  The case is just the right size for the camera, charger, memory card hold, lens cloth etc..  I keep everything organized in it so I'm ready to go.  Nice padding, would help protect against small drops for sure.  Haven't gotten it wet to see how water resistant it is.

review.user_review:
Whenever I get a new phone, one of the first things I do is get an Otterbox for it. I had the chance to review a COMMUTER series which is a step down from the DEFENDER series that I've used in the past. First thing is the COMMUTER gives the phone a much sleeker look. It is not as bulky as a DEFENDER which adds bulk and weight to the phone.

The fit and installation is a breeze. The case has the otterbox "feel" if not the bulk.

I'm looking forward to trying it going forward. If you are really hard on your phone you can always step up to the DEFENDER line. I might if I have to replace this one in the future

review.user_review:
The G15 is a great compact camera to carry around on a daily basis. It does not have as large of sensor as the G1X version and is now being replaced by the G16.

The one thing that I did NOT like about the G15 compared to the earlier G12 is the lack of a flexible LCD screen on the back. That helps for odd angle shots and also to flip it over to protect from damage.

The G16 will add wi-fi which will be a nice upgrade.

description: Product Description

The PowerShot G15 features a newly developed 5x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle, bright f/1.8(W) ‚Äì f/2.8 (T) lens, Canon's HS SYSTEM, plus upgraded video capture in 1080p Full HD with stereo sound. The PowerShot G12 brings EOS line features like the 12-bit multi aspect RAW+JPEG formatting into a compact camera.What‚Äôs in the box: Canon PowerShot G15 Digital Camera, NB-10L Lithium-Ion Battery Pack for PowerShot SX40 HS, CB-2LC Battery Charger for NB-10L Battery for PowerShot SX40 HS, NS-DC11 Neck Strap, Digital Camera Solution CD and 1-Year Limited Warranty.
From the Manufacturer
Untitled Document
Explore Imaging Excellence

Reaching new heights in speed, agility and creative possibilities, the PowerShot G15 gives photographers plenty of reasons to be delighted over. The excitement starts with the newly developed 5x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle, bright f/1.8(W) ‚Äì f/2.8 (T) lens that performs beautifully across the entire zoom range, even in low light, and can create dramatic soft backgrounds with shallow depth-of-field. Additional great features for the PowerShot G15 include Canon's HS SYSTEM, which combines a High-Sensitivity 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor with the DIGIC 5 Image Processor for ultra-fast performance and phenomenal image quality, a new dual axis electronic level, plus upgraded video capture in 1080p Full HD with stereo sound. The PowerShot G15 is designed to inspire and support your advanced creativity with 12-bit multi aspect RAW+JPEG just like in Canon's EOS line of DSLR cameras, new High Speed AF which dramatically reduces lag time when shooting, and the ability to add optional Speedlite flashes and a Tele-Converter Lens. When you‚Äôre ready to take the next step in your photographic journey, PowerShot G15 is ready to get you there.
A Bright and Powerful New Lens

Newly developed 5x Optical Zoom (28mm‚Äì140mm) and a bright f/1.8 (W) ‚Äì f/2.8 (T) lens allows you to capture more in your frame. It is also ideal for low-light conditions or using shallow depth-of-field for dramatic, soft backgrounds.

Newly engineered specifically for the PowerShot G15, the camera's 28mm Wide-Angle 5x Optical Zoom lens with a focal length of 6.1‚Äì30.5mm (35mm film equivalent: 28‚Äì140mm) achieves f/1.8‚Äìf/2.8, making it one of the camera's most exciting features. The Wide-Angle lens gives your images a distinctive sweep and grandeur, capturing landscapes, cityscapes, tall buildings and wide groups of people with ease. The large f/1.8‚Äì2.8 aperture allows you to achieve shallow depth-of-field for creating portraits with beautiful, soft background blur, and incomparable Canon optical technology delivers a high performance lens enabling incredible images, even in low light.
Beautiful Images and Fast Performance Start Here
12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor

The PowerShot G15 employs a Canon 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers state-of-the-art imaging performance and is optimized for use in compact cameras. Utilizing a sophisticated light-capturing design, it provides high sensitivity for improved high ISO capture with reduced noise. It is also a high-speed design, capable of rapidly capturing and moving image data to the processor, enabling faster continuous shooting and faster autofocus.
Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor

The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor works with the PowerShot G15's image sensor to bring phenomenal increases in processing speed and power, delivering incredible detail in more situations, without the need for artificial light sources. Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds up to ISO 12800. The faster processing speed results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. With the power of the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, the PowerShot G15 can achieve higher ISO sensitivity and even perform advanced functions like lens correction, special scene modes and much more.
Canon HS SYSTEM for exceptional low-light performance up to ISO 12800

The PowerShot G15 gives you the power to create images with spectacular depth, detail and emotional resonance. The 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor works in concert with Canon's own latest-generation DIGIC 5 Image Processor to create the renowned Canon HS SYSTEM. With the Canon HS SYSTEM, you'll experience excellent tracking performance even in low light, and achieve gorgeous still image quality even at high ISO speeds all the way up to ISO 12800; beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur in a variety of situations for incredible photos and videos.
Get the Complete HD Experience

Capture stunning 1080p Full HD video in stereo sound with a dedicated movie button; video functions include fine detail movie processing for lifelike images, zoom while shooting, and convenient playback on an HDTV via the HDMI output.

Simply touch the dedicated movie button, now conveniently embedded in the PowerShot G15's thumb pad, to start recording video in 1080p Full HD. Video captured in 1080p Full HD is breathtakingly vivid and realistic, and Canon's Fine Detail Movie Processing achieves beautiful videos with high resolution processing that records approximately 4x the amount of information during video shooting for even greater image clarity and sharp portrayal of even the most delicate of details. You're free to use the full range of the zoom in movie mode, and sound is recorded in stereo. An HDMI output allows you to view and share your video on an HDTV immediately, simply by connecting the camera to the TV with an optional HDMI cable.
Faster Focus and High-speed Shooting
High Speed AF greatly improves focus speed and High-Speed Burst HQ allows for continuous capture at a maximum of 10 frames* while maintaining superb image quality.

The PowerShot G15 is equipped with Canon's latest advancement in AF technology: High Speed AF. The result of several improved technologies, High Speed AF delivers significantly faster focus speed for a super-responsive shooting experience that lets you capture every great shot as it happens. Thanks to High Speed AF, the PowerShot G15's shooting time lag is dramatically reduced to only 0.22 seconds. The technology also powers the camera's new High-Speed Burst HQ, with continuous capture at a maximum speed of approximately 10 fps. Moreover, images captured in High-Speed Burst HQ maintain the camera's superb image quality.* The continuous shooting speed is approximately 10.0 fps.
Optimal Image Stabilization in Any Situation
Intelligent IS automatically chooses from six different modes to optimize image stabilization for the shooting condition.

It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot G15, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation ‚Äì allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes.
Normal
Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills.
Panning
Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement.
Macro (Hybrid)
Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting.
Dynamic
Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking.
Powered
Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified.
Tripod
When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed.
Set Your Creativity Free
Full range of shooting and recording modes, including 12-bit multi aspect RAW+JPEG as found in Canon EOS DSLR cameras, for the ultimate creative control.

As with many EOS DSLR cameras, the PowerShot G15 uses a 12-bit converter to process the output of the CMOS sensor, resulting in true color, smooth tonal transitions and natural gradations. The PowerShot G15 lets you shoot in RAW mode, which records all the information captured by the sensor, giving you outstanding flexibility and complete creative control when editing your images with Canon's powerful bundled software, and the camera allows you to record in RAW and JPEG formats simultaneously. Now in RAW mode, you can even select among several aspect ratios, including 16:9, 3:2, 4:3, 1:1, and 4:5.
Take Your Creativity Further with Optional Accessories
A host of optional accessories including Speedlite flashes, underwater housing and a Tele-Converter Lens expands imaging possibilities.

The PowerShot G15 lets you expand your creative options with a variety of optional accessories. Newly designed for the PowerShot G15, Tele-Converter TC-DC58E* enlarges the zoom's reach by 1.4x. A lens hood is included to block unnecessary light from outside the angle of view. Several Canon Speedlite flashes are also available for use with the PowerShot G15 to give you advanced options for exposure and illumination*. Macro Ring Lite MR-14EX is perfect for close-up and macro shooting, and the innovative Macro Twin Lite MT-24EX delivers a directional quality to macro illumination. With Underwater Housing WP-DC48, you can use your PowerShot G15 to document your snorkeling and diving adventures all the way to depths of 130 ft. (40m). The case is also great for protecting the camera from rain, ocean spray at the beach and any wet conditions.* Conversion Lens Adapter LA-DC58L is required for Tele-Converter TC-DC58E and Speedlite flashes.
Bright, High Resolution LCD
Bright 3.0-inch LCD with 922,000 dots enables easy viewing, plus an Optical Viewfinder for added versatility.

The camera's big, bright 3.0-inch LCD screen makes framing, shooting and camera adjustments easy with a wide viewing angle, high contrast, and excellent color reproduction. Resolution is excellent at 922,000 dots; you'll see every detail of what you're shooting. For added shooting versatility, the camera is also equipped with a newly developed, real-image type Optical Viewfinder for an easy, familiar alternative to composing shots with an LCD screen. You can ensure a perfectly clear view by making dioptric adjustments within a range of approximately ¬±2 m
(diopter).
Additional Features
Dual Axis Electronic Level

The PowerShot G15 has a Dual Axis Electronic Level, featuring an artificial horizon over the image on the rear LCD screen or in the viewfinder for easy leveling while shooting. The dual axis electronic level shows both horizontal roll and vertical pitch, making it easy to identify when the camera is in a fixed level shooting position and ready to take the shot.
EOS-like Dial Setting

Like EOS Digital SLR cameras, the PowerShot G15 employs a pro-style Front Dial. The Front Dial can be set to control shooting parameters including focus, aperture, shutter speed, ISO, step zoom, exposure compensation, white balance, i-Contrast and aspect ratio.
Appending Copyright Information

The in-camera copyright information feature helps professionals secure control over images by setting copyright data directly into the camera and appending that information to each image file in the EXIF metadata.
Shooting Modes
PowerShot cameras offer shooting modes that make it easy to take perfect photos in a wide range of shooting situations by providing intelligent presets with optimized settings.
Shooting Modes/Special Scene Modes

Custom Define and store your own settings to achieve the effects you prefer. Manual You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually. Aperture-Priority You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-priority You select the shutter speed to stop or blur action, and the camera finds the appropriate aperture. With slow exposure times, Canon's noise reduction system activates to ensure low image noise. Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically. Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Movie Digest Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day‚Äôs worth of clips into a video. Now easily playback and review clips, and delete unwanted scenes. Portrait The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject ‚Äúpop.‚Äù Smooth Skin Removes dullness, wrinkles, and harsh shadows for beautiful faces. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Captures fast-action shots at full sensor resolution, by shooting continuously when the shutter button is held down. Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Underwater Capture underwater images with reduced backscatter effect. Optional Underwater Case required. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Creative Filters This setting provides easy access to special filter effects and scene modes, such as Toy Camera Effect, Poster Effect, Monochrome and more. High Dynamic Range The camera combines three different exposures to get one evenly lit image. Nostalgic Create the look and feel of old photographs using sepia tones and black-and-white. Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills Emphasizes perspectives for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of the image. Soft Focus Creates a hazy ambiance that‚Äôs perfect for portraits and wedding photos. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Movie Record video in stereo sound. Unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. iFrame Movie The Apple¬Æ movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
Direct Connect to Your Printer

It's quick and easy to make beautiful prints from your PowerShot camera with Canon's Direct Print system. Directly connect your PowerShot camera to a Canon PIXMA or SELPHY photo printer with a USB cable and simply press the button to print; turn every favorite moment into an amazing photo.
Available in 30 Languages

There are now a total of 30 display languages from which you can choose: English, German, French, Dutch, Danish, Finnish, Italian, Norwegian, Swedish, Spanish, Simplified/Traditional Chinese, Japanese, Russian, Portuguese, Korean, Greek, Polish, Czech, Hungarian, Turkish, Thai, Arabic, Romanian, Ukrainian, Farsi, Hindi, Malay, Indonesian and Vietnamese.
