review.user_review_title: Ashwaghanda Forever! But suspicious claims to Kosher?
review.user_review:
Sorry about the title, I can't say Ashwaghanda out loud without making a Black Panther reference. As for this product, I like that it seems to be a fine powder that will dissolve easily and not add any detectible smell or consistency change to your drinks or smoothies. I've heard all kinds of claims about this stuff, and I'm not entirely sure if I can confirm or deny any of it concretely, however I will say this: It claims to be "kosher", but there is no symbol of the certifying agency on the package. As someone who keeps a kosher home, I'm well aware that there are different levels of kosher that are acceptable in different households, all depending on who certified it.
I've seen other products from Pomona that were certified, but claiming to be kosher without a certifying symbol on this one is fishy to me. I'm a little bit disappointed about that.

review.user_review_title: Good, but not as good as other flavors
review.user_review:
I'd say these deserve 3.5 starts, but I'm rounding up to 4. They are excellent for keto style diets, full of protein and low carb, just like real cheese... because it IS real cheese! These aren't cheese crackers or cheese puffs, they are actually dehydrated cheese! Real chedder so dehydrated, it no longer needs refrigeration and can actually CRUNCH in your mouth!
Here's the problem- while it has plenty of cheder sensations going down, in this dehydrated state it seems to lack some of the sodium flavor I associate with cheese. This brand also makes a spicy Pepper Jack flavor that has a real KICK, spicy and delicious. I tried that one first and LOVED it, however my kids found it too spicy for their taste. So I tried this next, thinking it would be a step down in kick. But it's almost like it stepped down TOO much, and just feels like it lacks flavor. My kids found it bland. So the first flavor was too much, and this one was too little. I actually opened a bag and poured it into a bowl and added some salt to experiment, and the flavor GREATLY improved! It's like, they were SO close to making a perfect snack, but just skimped a bit on the sodium to make it less flavorful. It's a shame because otherwise I really like this snack. I'll still eat it because it's a healthy diet friendly crunchy snack, but I can't help wishing they just added a tad more salt to bring out the flavors within. I still recommend the pepper jack, if you want bold flavor especially.

review.user_review:

All in all, I want to like these, and they are good for some things I guess, but they are not really kitchen towels.

review.user_review:
I've always wanted one of these for road trips / camping excursions, so I was super excited to try it when it arrived! We've gone through many portable propane grills (so I already have a collection of Coleman small green propane bottles) but the downside to those small grills are that if cooking small fixings like onions and veggies to go with your meats, they tend to fall between the grill grates. They also need a tabletop or something to put them on, and even if I find a local picnic table on the side of the road, the locals aren't usually keen on me placing a fire inches above their park property.
But this... oh man, this is a thing of BEAUTY. It has its own stand that pops up with a mechanism reminiscent of an ironing board, and offers a smooth flat griddle area to saut√© and grill all your meats, sides and anything else you'd like to make on 'em. Use it for dinner, and then again the next morning for eggs. Incredible camping tool. The only thing I didn't realize ahead of time is how much more space this would take up in my vehicle... it's a lot longer than those cheap portable grills, which I should have expected thanks to the mechanism and legs. The wheels are a great touch too, because you can pull this like a wheeled luggage case to your intended cooking spot and fire away.
I love this and would highly recommend it.

review.user_review_title: So comfy and what a cool unboxing!
review.user_review:
[[VIDEOID:f10d909391d1dacdb6df3e6581851edd]] Ok, I've heard a lot about these bed-in-a-box mattresses, and I've had the opportunity to try one from a different brand once before, so I sort of knew what to expect. That being said, watching this thing inflate was still a ton of fun! They come in a box with airtight plastic. Once the plastic is cut (a plastic cutting tool and detailed instructions are included), air rushes in and the bed inflates to it's normal and resting size.
I've included a video because I think it is pretty cool to see. It inflated to the correct height, however you may notice I did NOT open it on my bed frame as the instructions indicate to do. This because all boxed-beds SMELL when you first open them up. There's a chemical / plastic smell from the packaging that sometimes takes a few days to weeks to properly go away. I don't understand why they would recommend you open it on the bed frame as I don't know anyone who would be OK sleeping on it the first day they open it. I'm sensitive to these things so I actually opened it up in our guest room first and let it sit there for a week with windows open before bringing it into the intended room and frame for it. I knew this already from other boxed mattresses, but they really need to do a better job warning people. I'm writing this here to warn you in case you didn't know: IT WILL SMELL AT FIRST. But that's normal! It WILL go away eventually! And you will be left with a wonderfully comfortable mattress. I got this for one of my kid's rooms, but I think I might get one to replace my mattress when the time comes as well! It is more firm than our memory foam mattresses, but much softer than traditional coil ones. It is an excellent blend of the two.

description: Why won‚Äôt you just meet us in the middle ‚Äì on our medium hybrid mattress. It‚Äôs got premium memory foam and a soft comfy cover with Climate CoolTM moisture wicking tech. PLUS, individually wrapped coils toil through the night to enable airflow, support your body and isolate movement. We‚Äôre losing our minds just a little!

review.user_review_title: Instant on-the-spot prints... that are also STICKERS!
review.user_review:
I grew up loving my Polaroid instant prints. This modern version not only gives you the instant gratification of a print (that we all know and love), but it also peels off and actually doubles as a STICKER! How cool is that! Teenage-me would have loved having one of these instead of taping stuff to the wall.
To be fair, the picture quality isn't stellar... in fact, your cell phone might already take better pictures. But the instant gratification of a print is what you are buying here, and that is super cool. That and the fact that the camera itself is also super cool and retro- even the magnetic lens cap, as easy as it is to forget it is on, is very satisfying to "click" back into place. And unlike the Fujifilm instant print cameras, this will also save your pics to a microSD card for later reprints and/or safekeeping in this digital world.

If instant gratification is your thing or you just have a nostalgia for old Polaroid concepts, this camera is for you!

NOTE: Does not come with film/paper. You'll need that, and/or a Micro SD card. The camera can work with either or both, but not with none.

review.user_review:
I've owned many affordable bluetooth speakers, but never one this size! I love this, the sound quality is FAR BETTER than anything I've used in this price range. The woofers deliver solid bass, and the directions really help fill a space with sound. I love that it even has a carrying handle and a place to plop your phone onto (great for Karaoke!). I'm a little confused by the Mic input, I thought perhaps this could work as an alternative to the line in... for example, I can line in for music, but also sometimes I'd like a mic-level input for using with a microphone. But the mic input seems to only get used for some sort of recording to TF card function, which I couldn't get to work anyway. Doesn't matter, I wasn't so interested in that feature, I was more interested in using it as an amp and thought that might be an interesting alternative use.
Using the speaker for both bluetooth audio or wired aux in worked very well. The FM radio is nice too, but I didn't try it much. All in all, the battery life seems pretty solid and this thing is incredibly powerful for a battery operated speaker. We usually don't max out the volume because that's too loud!

review.user_review_title: Great for legacy optical media support!
review.user_review:
This is a really solid solution for adding DVD and CD support to a modern laptop, since it is so hard to find one included these days.
I love that not only does this support both USB A and C ports, the cable is actually embedded into the case so you can wrap it up for easy storage! I admit I don't need optical media often, but I do have some older software installation disks that I still occasionally need to use when I reformat a computer, and being able to rip content from old CDs and DVDs is great to have available. This worked for installing my old Adobe CS6 suite as well as Samplitude on my desktop (which also lacks an optical drive!). Great product!

review.user_review:
I know everything is cloud based these days, but a good USB stick is still indispensable in my opinion. For my job I find myself responsible for presentations in places that often have no reliable internet access, and being able to hand over the finished video on a stick like this is perfect. Just yesterday, I used one of these as a Windows installation media to fix a botched dual boot laptop without a CD/DVD drive. Now that I've fixed it, I might throw a live linux distro onto the stick for future use as a handy recovery system.
They aren't the fastest transfer speed available, but they are perfectly acceptable for daily use.

review.user_review:
I have another similar stand that I have used for my projector and laptop. I wanted a second one so I could both at the same time (projector mounted next to laptop, both on their own stand).
Compared to my other one, I liked that this could fold up smaller thanks to the top being able to fold in half, however I found the whole thing a little less sturdy overall. The center pole would wobble a little, and the top part that folds was actually really annoying to unfold to set up because the screws need to be removed and replaced. Sure, they are thumbscrews and you don't need tools, but I found it annoying as they would fall out as I was trying to hold it in place and decided it was better to just leave it assembled. Which begs the question, why even bother folding it? I also found that if I used it with the laptop and typed, the whole thing would shake with my typing. If you want to use it as only a projector stand where it won't get touched, I think that's fine and it will work well enough. But if you want equipment to not wobble if touched, I'd look for a different one.

review.user_review_title: Does not seem worthy of the price
review.user_review:
Don't get me wrong, its a fine bracelet, but not one that should cost hundreds of dollars. This looks more like something you can find for under fifty in a local department store. The diamonds are not only a low clarity class, but they are also TEENY- you can't tell from the picture, but the individual studs are mostly metal with a tiny hole in the middle for a teensy diamond that seem almost non-existent. Its mostly the metal reflecting that looks shiny in the product photos.
Does it look nice? Sure! My wife will gladly wear it! But it seems like some kind of highway robbery to expect this to be worth the price tag. I was originally going to bring it to a jeweler for the purpose of this review to get an appraised value, but honestly I'm embarrassed to now that I've seen it.

review.user_review_title: Love the steam but very top heavy
review.user_review:
I am a huge ironing fan and own several irons in my house. My favorite feature in an iron is a strong and powerful steam button. This is where this iron really shines. The steam is STRONG and you can also decide how much steam you want. This is the type of iron that really just blasts the steam and I love that. Most wrinkles are released but it‚Äôs not the hottest iron I‚Äôve ever had.
A few cons that are holding me back from being completely in love with this iron. Ive been using it daily for a couple weeks and I still forget/have to look to see where to turn it on and select what level of heat I want. It‚Äôs a little hidden underneath the handle and for some reason it‚Äôs just not in an intuitive place for me. Second, the top/front part of that handle has a little box housing who knows what, but it‚Äôs very heavy on the TOP when standing up or towards the front when the iron is horizontal/ironing. This is unlike any other iron I‚Äôve owned and I really don‚Äôt like that it‚Äôs too heavy and unbalanced in your hand. This is a bit of an exaggerated example but imagine holding a gallon of milk upside down with the weight of the bottle out in front of your hand rather than hanging from underneath. I am assuming these is a reason this iron had to be designed this way and the good folks at Sunbeam would have avoided it if possible but I grumble every time using it. Lastly I just wish this had a retractable cord!
There are several reviews of people unable to locate the light button and that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs located on the black base of the iron (when standing upright). There is a little icon that‚Äôs oops like a light shining and although I didn‚Äôt find the button hard to find, headlights on an iron are a bit unnecessary.

Still like this iron and the robust blast of steam!

review.user_review_title: Easy set up, easy to use
review.user_review:
As others have noted, the Belkin AC 1750 is about the easiest router set up you could possibly imagine. It really is a simple matter of plug and play. I had mine up and running in a minute or two.

As far as performance, I honestly didn't notice that much difference in speed between this router and my existing router, but that could be a issue with my ISP (which is horrendous) and not the router.

It's a very costly router, so money is definitely something to consider. If you can afford it, then it's a perfect upgrade for streaming videos and downloading games.

review.user_review:
I don't know what it is with headphones these days, but the quality seems to have seriously declined over the last few years. Turtle Beach is a name I recognized and after having so many bad experiences with other headphones, I decided to give them a try.

Aesthetically they're great. Love the white/green look. They were very comfortable and my head and ears didn't feel tired afterwards. The sound, too, was fine. The bass was nice and thick and the high end was clear. The sound quality of the mic was nice and clear. No problems plugging them into a Playstation 4 controller.

Unfortunately, they didn't last more than a few months. So, the hunt continues.

review.user_review_title: For me they're a Grand Slam
review.user_review:
If you're in the market for bluetooth speakers, you need look no further.

Before using the Creative T15 Wireless Bluetooth speakers, I had never used wireless speakers. I didn't really know what to expect, so I was eager to try them out.

From the time I opened the box to the time I had them streaming audio from my iPad was about 30 seconds. It was as simple as plugging the speakers in, holding the bluetooth button down and then turning on my iPad bluetooth to "discover" the speakers. It was painless, seamless, and worked like a charm. I couldn't have been happier.

These aren't only functional speakers, they're also very attractive. They have a nice heft to them (you can nudge 'em or knock 'em a bit without knocking them over). The plastic is a little prone to collecting fingerprints, but that's a minor quibble and should be a detractor.

I have a queen sized bed and the speakers reach the length of the headboard. So the cord size was perfect. Since there's no sub-woofer, I wasn't sure how the bass would sound. While you certainly do get some lower frequencies, I don't think they quite match the depth of a sub. But the trade off is that these are much more versatile and portable while still getting a reasonably deep bass sound.

They're also not just for smart devices. You can plug them into a computer with standard jacks, but I found that I needed purchase a digital audio converter since most new LED TVs don't support traditional RCA cable audio-out functionality. Thankfully a TOSlink converter isn't overly cost prohibitive.

In short, I give these my highest recommendation.

review.user_review_title: These have taken a beating, but still work
review.user_review:
My nephew lives in NYC and uses these headphones while walking to and from school. These have a lot of great things going for them. 1) They are very comfortable. They don't hurt your head after long periods of wear. 2) The sound is great. NYC is loud and these do a good job of cancelling out a lot of that noise. 3) The battery lasts forever. That obviously means less charging.

The one drawback is that built-in mic and extra bass only work in Bluetooth mode. As you can see from the photo, they've been well used and well loved. They're basically held together with tape and a dream, but we've been very pleased with them.

review.user_review:
this is my 2nd bloggie camera, the first being the 3D version. that camera was ok, but more of a novelty than a great camera. i was excited to try to the bloggie live to see if sony had made any improvements. the answer? both yes and no.

i'll make this as concise as possible.

what i liked: i was able to quickly get the wi-fi set up, shoot a video, and upload it to youtube in a matter of seconds. it seems that upload speed was much faster on the bloggie live than it was on my ipad.

it has a nice, sleek design. it's also fairly slim, so you could feasibly stash in your back pocket if you needed to.

the menu and interface are much improved over the bloggie 3D. as others have noted, if you have bigger hands/fingers, then you may have some trouble using the touch screen. it's default settings give you the ability to upload to facebook and youtube, so that's a nice feature.

the picture quality seems par for the course. i'm not a high-end camera connoisseur, so most pictures/videos look pretty much the same to me.

what i didn't like: that live streaming/hosting requires yet another new application. i understand there's a free verion of qik (or whatever it's called), but i'm at a point in my life where i just don't need new/more apps. i know they're all the range and everyone's trying to take a piece of that market, but it seems like a lot of extra work.

i also had some issues with the playmemories app, sony's picture hosting site/app (yes, *another* app). i downloaded the app for my ipad because the bloggie live apparently gives the ability to view your videos on your ipad or smart phone. well, i tried and tried and tried to get them to sync, but no dice. not only that, but connecting your ipad to the bloggie live will disconnect you from your normal wi-fi. i'll try again tonight, but i'm not very optimistic. if i am successful, i will update this review.

all in all, an ok camera, but i'm sure you're $250 would be better spent elsewhere.

review.user_review_title: Suit gets an A+ but accessories leave much to be desired
review.user_review: This is the first time purchasing a santa suit and I'm thoroughly impressed! For the price I was expecting something pretty cheap and while I'll admit the quality of fabric is on the more economy side, it actually looks really nice, which is all you could ask for from an outfit that's only going to be used once a year! The pants and jacket have a nice velvet look to them and are a decent thick weight. The fur trim looks nice - I've definitely seen (and expected) a lower more synthetic feeling fur. The fur is soft and plush. The hat has a nice shape and fit generous on my husband's head which is on the bigger size (he usually has trouble with regular sized hats!). My husband wears a 36-38 and the XL suit was just a touch roomy, although I doubt he would have wanted to size down. It looks good on his broad frame even without stuffing in a pillow for a tummy. My husband is 6'1" and the pants run a bit short, I'm assuming because they are meant to "tuck" into the boot covers. You definitely would not want to wear the pants alone because they'd be too short. The suit is the main act and a solid 5. I'll give the accessories a solid 3 stars. The white gloves and bell are great accessories, everything else leaves a bit to be desired.The belt is very plasticy feeling and has lines where it was folded that don't come out easily. The boot covers look fine from a distance and work but are made out of the same cheapy pleathery plastic. The accessories that detract from the overall quality and look of the costume are the wig, beard and glasses. The wig and beard look just like the product photo so I'm not surprised at the quality, but they are very synthetic, shiney and too curly to be remotely believable. The wire glasses definitely give an old timey santa look which I'm just not into. If you swapped out just the wig and beard for something more realistic, this would be a solid 5 star santa look!

review.user_review:
I tried multiple brands of cycling shorts over the years, many of which were a name brand and expensive. They basically preformed all the same by adding a bit of cushion to my rear end while cycling.

I am so happy with these cycling shorts, which are primary meant to be worn during cycling, be it an indoor cycling class or outdoors on your road bike. The padding will feel bulky for the newbie, but will provide so much relief as your rear end adjusts to being on a tiny seat (which can take up to 4 weeks).

The fit is perfect! I have a booty and thicker thighs and ordered my regular size and they fit so well. I love that there is grippy stuff on the interior seam at the bottom of each leg hole. That helps that shorts from riding up. The stitching feels strong and I have a sense these will last! I'm really happy with these and would definitely recommend. Amazon Essentials clothing line has really exceeded my expectations.

review.user_review_title: Great grill, cleaning is kind of hard.
review.user_review:
We have used this grill now for about a month and are very satisfied with it. We've used it for full chicken breasts, pork chops, chicken breasts sliced in half, hamburgers, bacon and much more.

I have to say, that this grill has made cooking a snap for our family. The larger surface area is the key on this, as every meal we've prepared on it has been for a family of four.

However, there are a couple of things that keep this from a 5 star product in my opinion. First is cleaning. It's not very user friendly, and paper towels are hard to get in between the valleys. You can use a sponge, but then your sponge is pretty much dead after a couple of uses. They give you 2 spatulas that we've begun using to scrape the dry matter from the grill. Secondly is that there is no temperature control. Just plug it in, wait 8 minutes for the grill to heat up (I think it heats up a lot faster than that, however, the manual does say to wait 8 minutes) and hope you have the right time set for your meals. The instruction booklet does give recommended cook times which we have found to be way too long. Just tonight we cooked 4 .25lb hamburger patties in 5 minutes and they were well done. Lastly, it does not cook bacon very well. The strips near the top always burn, while the strips near the bottom don't seem to cook very well at all. The bacon itself tends to settle down in between the cooking area so the top doesn't really touch/cook the bacon from the top. It probably cooks it more by radiant heat on the top than direct.

All in all, we are very satisfied with this grill. Just be prepared to make mental notes on cook times for foods you like and use their initial cook times as a guide until you figure out how you like your food cooked.

review.user_review:
[[VIDEOID:ee0d0837756ecee1e916ebfe13f7457]] This camera is simply amazing. I've been looking to upgrade from our original point and shoot to something a little more robust. You know, those dang slim models just didn't seem to have the oomph to produce high quality indoor pictures from any distance other than about 10 feet.

Enter the Canon Powershot SX40 HS. This is your all in one camera. No where will you find a camera short of a full on DSLR that can go 35x optical. I've seen 24, but not 35x. How sweet is being able to zoom in at 35x? Watch my video to see. Did you hear the lens zooming in during the video? Nope. It is whisper quiet.

The battery took just over 1.5 hours to charge and we were off to a Homecoming football game on rather cool, crisp night (45-50 degrees). I was worried, because my other point shoot really seemed to be bothered by the cold weather and would not zoom well and started to lose battery life. The Canon performed beautifully after nearly 100 shots and upwards of 10 minutes of video. I came back home, downloaded the pictures and the camera is still reported 100% battery level.

There are many, many options that I can't even begin to discuss, much less have tried yet. All I can tell you is if you want an upgrade and don't want to go full on DSLR for $600 basic model upwards to $2000, you should not hesitate to purchase this camera.

description: Product Description

The Canon 5251B001 PowerShot SX40 HS 12.1MP Black Compact Digital Camera is a versatile compact point-and-shoot camera that easily captures amazing photos and videos. The HS SYSTEM boosts low-light performance with the DIGIC 5 Image Processor and a high-sensitivity 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor. The 35x Optical Zoom offers incredible reach and range, allowing you to shoot any scene, near or far. The camera also features a 2.7-inch Vari-angle LCD for great shooting flexibility. Packed with an array of powerful technologies, the PowerShot SX40 HS is a convenient digital camera capable of brilliant image capture.Built-in Flash Yes: Auto, Auto/Red-eye Reduction, FE Lock, Flash On, Off, Red-eye Reduction, Slow Sync.Effective Flash Range Wide: 1.6 - 23' (0.49 - 7.01 m),Telephoto: 4.6 - 9.8' (1.40 - 2.99 m).What's in the Box: PowerShot SX40 HS Body, Battery Pack NB-10L, Battery Charger CB-2LC, Lens Cap, Case for Hot Shoe Cap, Neck Strap NS-DC11, Interface Cable IFC-400PCU and Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM.
From the Manufacturer
Canon SX40 HS
Zoom to Infinite Possibilities

The PowerShot SX40 HS is a versatile compact point-and-shoot camera that easily captures amazing photos and videos. The Canon HS SYSTEM boosts low-light performance with the new Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor and a high-sensitivity 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor. This advanced Canon technology delivers stunning image quality with reduced noise and blur. Colors are more vibrant and white balance is true-to-life. The 35x Optical Zoom offers incredible reach and range, allowing you to shoot any scene, near or far. The Optical Image Stabilizer helps images come out steady and clear, and a 24mm ultra Wide-Angle lens makes it easy to take pictures of large groups of people, tall buildings, expansive landscapes and much more. The camera also features a 2.7-inch Vari-angle LCD for great shooting flexibility. Packed with an array of powerful technologies, the PowerShot SX40 HS is a convenient digital camera capable of brilliant image capture.
Extreme 35x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom and 24mm Lens

The PowerShot SX40 HS is equipped with a Genuine Canon 35x Zoom lens that provides the telephoto power to bring your distant subjects incredibly close. It also features a useful zoom range that begins at 24mm wide-angle and extends to 840mm telephoto (35mm equivalent). The 24mm ultra Wide-Angle allows you to create shots with dramatic perspective and makes it easy to shoot sweeping landscapes, large groups of people and tall buildings. This superb lens delivers outstanding optical performance throughout its zoom range. It‚Äôs advanced design employs UD glass, double-sided aspherical glass-molded and ultra-high-refraction-index glass lens elements to effectively suppress chromatic aberration while maintaining a remarkably compact size. The camera uses a VCM (Voice Coil Motor) for high-speed, quiet, energy-efficient lens movement with precise control.
Optical Image Stabilizer

Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon‚Äôs Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct for unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical, providing excellent image quality in many difficult shooting situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.
Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor

The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor brings phenomenal increases in processing speed and power. Improved chip architecture and algorithms deliver greatly expanded functionality with further refinement in image quality.  Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds. Enhanced i-Contrast performance adjusts differences between light and dark areas to achieve even more natural-looking results.  The faster processing speed also results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. The DIGIC 5 Image Processor also makes possible a new, highly advanced automatic white balance system. Whereas conventional white balance makes an overall adjustment based on a single type of light source, the new Canon Multi-Area White Balance analyzes several areas of the image to determine whether different adjustments are needed, for example, for the main subject and the background.  Noise Reduction
Conventional Image Processor
White Balance
With DIGIC 5 Image Processor
Canon HS SYSTEM

The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you take bright, clear photos in an even wider range of shooting situations. Beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The system is the result of two technologies brought together in PowerShot cameras: a high-sensitivity imaging sensor, which is able to capture more light; and the DIGIC Image Processor, which actively reduces noise with high-speed image processing. The 12.1 Megapixel Canon CMOS sensor in the PowerShot SX40 HS incorporates advanced light reception technology that enhances sensitivity. The new DIGIC 5 Image Processor provides a major boost in noise reduction, expanding the usable ISO range to an amazing high of ISO 3200. The Canon HS SYSTEM thus lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur.
Memorable Moments in Spectacular Full HD

In addition to the Canon HS SYSTEM, the combination of the advanced CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor in the PowerShot SX40 HS makes it possible to shoot crisp, clear high definition video. Imagine the fun and excitement of being able to shoot spectacular 1080p Full HD video with stereo sound that you can later watch on your HDTV or download to your computer to share with family and friends. The PowerShot SX40 HS shoots Full HD video at 24* frames per second, ensuring clear lifelike motion images with a beautiful cinematic quality. It also shoots beautifully detailed 720p HD video at 30 fps.** *Actual frame rate is 23.976 fps. **Actual frame rate is 29.97 fps.
Dedicated Movie Button, Wind Filter and Optical Zoom While Shooting

It‚Äôs never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. The PowerShot SX40 HS has a dedicated movie button that lets you start and stop recording instantly. There is no need to go through layers of menus or operate switches or dials to switch to and from video recording mode. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want. The PowerShot SX40 HS also incorporates an electronic wind filter, which suppresses wind noise that can muffle or distort the sound. And unlike less sophisticated point-and-shoot cameras, the PowerShot SX40 HS lets you use the full range of optical zoom when you‚Äôre shooting a video.
HDTV Playback via HDMI with CEC Support

It‚Äôs easy to enjoy and share the videos you shoot with the PowerShot SX40 HS. Simply connect its HDMI terminal to your HDTV using an HDMI cable (not included). And because the PowerShot SX40 HS supports HDMI-CEC technology, you‚Äôll be able to control the playback of your images and videos on any CEC-enabled HDTV using the TV‚Äôs remote control. (CEC ‚Äì Consumer Electronic Control ‚Äì is part of the HDMI specification, enabling components in a system to communicate with one another.)
iFrame Movie Support

With the PowerShot SX40 HS, you can also shoot video in the Apple‚Ñ¢ iFrame format, which is a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, making it more convenient to upload or e-mail high-quality videos. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, making it unnecessary to perform time-consuming and often quality-degrading conversions.
Vari-Angle LCD

The PowerShot SX40 HS features a convenient and highly useful 2.7-inch Vari-Angle LCD screen that swivels out almost a full 180 degrees. It also rotates through approximately 270 degrees, letting you tilt it up or down to shoot at low or high angles. You can compose freely even when shooting from difficult vantage points and use the full range of angle adjustment even when the camera is mounted on a tripod. You can even rotate the LCD facing forward to capture perfectly framed self-portraits and to join group shots. The PureColor System LCD screen has 230,000 dots, giving you a crisp, clear picture to make shooting, playback and using the camera's menu functions especially convenient.
A Steady Image is a Beautiful Image
Intelligent IS

The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image.  Normal
Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills.
Panning
Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement.
Hybrid
Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting.
Dynamic
Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking.
Powered
Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified.
Tripod
When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed.
Modes/Special Scene Modes
Custom
Define and store your own settings to achieve the effects you prefer.
Manual
You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually.
Aperture-Priority
You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed.
Shutter-Priority
You select the shutter speed to stop or blur action, and the camera finds the appropriate aperture. With slow exposure times, Canon's noise reduction system activates to ensure low image noise.
Program
Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
Smart AUTO
The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity.
Movie Digest
Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day‚Äôs worth of clips into a video.
Portrait
The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject ‚Äúpop.‚Äù
Kids & Pets
Reduced focusing time freezes fast-moving subjects, so you won't miss those special shots.
Landscape
Increases depth-of-field for sharp and sweeping landscape shots.
Smart Shutter
The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame.
High-Speed Burst HQ
Capture fast-action shots at full sensor resolution, by shooting continuously when the shutter button is held down.
Handheld Night Scene
Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod.
Beach
Beach Get clear shots of people at a sunny beach without darkened faces.
Underwater
Capture underwater images with reduced backscatter effect. Optional Underwater Case required.
Foliage
Capture brilliant shots of autumn foliage, greenery and blossoms.
Snow
Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint.
Fireworks
Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks.
Stitch Assist
Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos.
Creative Filters
This setting provides easy access to special filter effects and scene modes, such as Toy Camera Effect, Poster Effect, Monochrome and more.
High Dynamic Range
The camera combines three different exposures to get one evenly lit image.
Super Slow Motion Movie
Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
Program
Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
Fisheye Effect
Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
Nostalgic
Create the look and feel of old photographs using sepia tones and black-and-white.
Fisheye Effect
Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills
Emphasizes perspectives for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of the image.
Toy Camera Effect
Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect.
Poster Effect
Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts.
Monochrome
Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue.
Super Vivid
Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors.
Color Accent
Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome.
Color Swap
Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects.
Movie
The camera takes five photos in succession, and then chooses the best one out of the bunch.
Super Slow Motion Movie
Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
iFrame Movie
The Apple¬Æ movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality.

review.user_review_title: Worked perfect.  Just what the doctor ordered.
review.user_review:
I needed this device as the card reader built into my laptop stopped working. It would recognize the card, but was forcing me to format it. When I would try and format it, it would throw an error message. After hours of trying various fixes and downloading/installing drivers I had enough.

Enter this gem.

I can confirm that it works on Windows 7, 64 bit. It read my previously unreadable/must format 16GB Transcent SDHC card with no problem. None. Zilch. Nada.

Files also transferred faster than through my internal reader.

Fantastic buy if you use these cards at all.

description: Product Description

Secure Digital cards are ubiquitous in consumer electronic devices and have become the dominant means of storing several gigabytes of data in a small form factor. This new device is extremely compact but big on compatibility within the SD memory card family. The unit supports the very latest in memory card format, SDXC (Secure Digital Extended Capacity). The SD/MicroSD/MMC Card Reader/Writer is a solution for hi-speed, bi-directional image and data transfer. Images and data can be transferred quickly from Secure Digital Card (SD), MultiMedia Card (MMC), or MicroSD memory cards to PCs or Macs. review.user_review_title: How much is running out of juice worth to you?
review.user_review:
As far as chargers go, there isn't much to them. The unique 90 degree angle of this particular one can come in handy in certain situations, but I've really not been able to find a absolute need to take advantage of that. 4' is a nice length, especially for the car so you can secure it without it rolling around the vehicle.

A little expensive for an extra charger, but by the same token, how much is running out of juice worth to you.

Also of note, with the 90 degree angle, your case may prohibit you from being able to use this. My current Slim Armour case for the 5S is a perfect example of this as the charge port is narrow enough that only a straight in connector works.

review.user_review: There are enough dried peppers in this bag to fill up a quart-sized mason jar, if you press down on them to make room for them all. These peppers are hot and flavorful. As with any pepper, the hottest part is the seeds, which these of course have, so if you don't want them to be majorly hot, split them and remove the seeds; the skins still have a good intensity to them (i.e., they're still pretty darned hot) but also have most of the actual flavor. Unless you are just mad crazy about eating very hot food, one or two of these peppers in a dish should be gracious plenty, so these peppers are going to last me a long time.

review.user_review:
First, the good stuff: It's packed with nutrition.

Now the not-so-good stuff:

A LOT of the product cooks out into the cooking water, leaving a thick soupy mess. If you ran a can of navy beans through the blender for a few minutes, then added a dash of water, that's what you'd get. Now, granted, I used about half the water called for to cook the package (2.5 quarts, not 4), which resulted in a super-thick chickpea-colored soup, but I doubt using more water would have changed the amount of the product that cooked out in the water...if anything, it might have reduced even more.

The flavor is not the worst thing I've ever eaten, but it's not something I'd exactly look forward to eating. We made it with spaghetti sauce and meatballs tonight, and if the sauce had not been so piquant, I don't know if I could have finished it.

If you love wrapping long strings of noodles around your fork, forget it. These noodles break into pieces rather easily, no matter how careful you are. Now, for me, that's actually a good thing because I don't enjoy that aspect of eating spaghetti. But if the only way you can get your kids to eat spaghetti is by letting them get messy with it, that leverage is gone with these noodles.

Maybe this would taste better if cooked, then cut into smaller pieces and chilled for use in a cold salad. I've got five more boxes of it, so I'll certainly try...but it may be my dogs and chicken wind up being the beneficiaries.

review.user_review_title: Manuka honey has its own distinct flavor, not like most honeys
review.user_review: Manuka honey is thick and has medicinal properties (google it). I had negatively reviewed another Manuka honey product that came in little cardboard sleeves, not realizing at the time that the honey can be used for treating wounds. If you're going to be eating the honey, clearly a jar of it will work better than a little smear from a cardboard wrapper, but if you're fond of very sweet honey, you may be disappointed in the flavor of this Manuka honey. Instead of using it on peanut butter sandwiches, I'm reserving this jar for when I have a sore throat or cold to add to tea, or just to down a spoonful as if it were medicine. And just a spoonful of Manuka honey makes the medicine go down...the medicine go down...the medicine go down....

review.user_review_title: Not repositionable...so be sure you put these where you want them!
review.user_review:
I have a small bedroom with a ton of stuff crammed into it: daybed, computer desk, recliner (main desk), TV, dog steps made from storage benches leading to a window-installed cat door my three small dogs fly in and out of, two small chests, and one of those big Costco-purchased 8-cubby shelves with square fabric boxes that I have turned up on its end and angled out into the room as a screen and dresser for my clothes.

Because it can feel kind of cramped and dark in here, I put two of these mirror tiles (I got the 12") along the long side of my cubby shelves, which face the window. Mirrors can do such wonders for expanding the size of a room! Now I get the reflection of the window and drapes instead of the black wood of the cubby shelves. I could easily have used all four, but I wanted to space between the mirror tiles for a farmhouse mirror effect instead of having them all flush against each other. The two mirror tiles I have left over will go near a plant shelf I'm installing, or I may put an additional one on my cubby shelf. Good feng shui....

What really surprises me is that these mirror tiles really look like quality mirrors! Expect they aren't heavy and they aren't breakable. They can go places where heavy regular mirrors cannot go. And there are so many creative ways they can be used. Just be very careful to position them where you want them, because once you stick them down, that's where they are going. I had to pull one corner off, and it left a chunk of the adhesive on the wood; had it been cheap particle board and not actual real wood, I'm sure the particle board would have torn off before the adhesive did. Ditto for sticking on the walls. If you have to move these, you might have to patch (or at least repaint) the wall.

It would be lovely if a choice of less-strong repositionable stickers were included with the set; that way, apartment dwellers could use these too without fear of voiding their leases when they move.

review.user_review:
When I received my Lodge grill/griddle a few days ago, I was stunned with how just plain beautiful it is. It is going to sit on my stove all the time, across the burners on one side, probably with the grilling side up to remind me that I can grill anything any time I want to.

I've never had a double-burner grill before, so I've experimented with turning on one or both burners; setting the burners on different settings; and cooking foods one normally would not cook on a grill on the grill side (eggs this morning, along with the bacon).

There is no better way to get the hang of cast iron cooking than to cook eggs. If you've got the seasoning right and the temperature right, you've got the best non-stick egg-cooking surface in the world. If you don't have it right and the eggs stick, just scour the pan with one of those dark green pot-scrubber pads (no soap!), rinse well, rub in some oil with your fingers or a napkin, and try again. If you don't cook something very acidic like tomato sauce in/on your cast iron, it will get so splendidly non-stick you will think you died and went to heaven.

I used my eggs-on-the-grill experiment to get a feel for the best temperature for the piece with only one burner on. The first time I did it, the eggs hardly stuck at all...so that's a great testament to the pre-seasoning.

What's nice is that, even when using only one burner, the entire piece heats up, so when you've finished cooking something on the side with the hot burner, you can move it over to the other side (the one with the burner off) and the food stays beautifully warm while you cook something else. I haven't tried pancakes on the griddle side yet (because I'm in the early stages of Atkins' diet), but I can tell this would be super for cooking up stacks of nice, warm, perfectly cooked pancakes.

When I first got it, it did smoke a good bit; I think this is because I had the heat too high...or maybe it just needed to smoke a little to settle it down. It's not smoking now.

I know this is a rambling review...I really just wanted to say this is a beautiful piece and I'm very happy to have it in my kitchen.

review.user_review:
This timer is a good size with a very readable LED display and a strong magnet on the clip on the back to hold it to your fridge or whatever a magnet will stick to. The buttons are large and accessible, and it's really no problem to set it up. It beeps loudly when the time is up, so there's little danger you're not going to hear it from an adjoining room.

Strangely, on day one (unlike with some timers I've used), the first three or four times that I held down the hour, minute, or second buttons to speed up the counting and turn off the beeps, it just froze and stopped counting. If I pressed the button over and over to advance the counter by one, it worked—beeping annoyingly loudly each time, of course. I was about to give it a two-star review and throw it away because I couldn't stand it, but I put off doing it and just stuck it to the top of my stove. A week later, after I'd used the stove several times and the timer probably got exposed to some heat, I went back to try it again so I could write this review and the fast-count sans beeps feature worked. Weird. Maybe it was just stressed in shipping and needed time to settle down....

A few things I really do dislike is that it's easy to reset the time by mistake if the grey button on the left gets slid up; the modes are manually set with this button. (That approach to the modes could be good for the technologically challenged, though.) Also, if you overshoot your mark on the time, there is no way to go backward; you have to go forward until you come back around to where you were supposed to have stopped the first time. The clip is a little too sharply angled, so when you stick the timer to a surface with the magnet, the face slants down somewhat, but it's still visible; really not that big of a deal.

Another thing, as I've remarked about another MeasuPro product: the how-to info on the packaging is white letters on light grey, which is practically unreadable for anyone, not just people like me with old eyes. (The company told me they were correcting that with the other product, so I expect they will do the same with this one.)

review.user_review:
UPDATE (11/1/2014): I'm getting complaints from my partner about how deaf I am and how loud I crank up the TV, so I figured I'd better get some headphones to use with my Samsung Smart TV (which is not Bluetooth-capable, so I'll have to get a transmitter). I gave up trying to use Bluetooth such a long time ago that I didn't realize these headphones were Bluetooth! I was hunting all over the place for a pair of wireless headphones with the look and feel of these, and in the process, I rediscovered these are Bluetooth! (Heck, it's been three years since I first got these, so forgive this little old lady for not remembering.) Anyway, I realized there were (were) two problems with me using these as anything other than wired. First is that the signals (the blue or white lights, which flash or breathe depending on what you're doing) can't be seen if they are under your fingertip. So you have to make sure you don't completely cover up the light. Second, it really does depend on what kind of Bluetooth-capable device you use. To test these, I paired them with my new MacBook Pro Retina. My old Mac didn't do very well, kept dropping the sound, couldn't stay paired, etc. I got a new MacBook Pro, now running Yosemite, and I'm sitting here listening to Pandora coming all the way through about 15 feet and a thick wall and it's great! And this is the "discontinued" set that I've had all this time. They charged up in very little time, too. So if you can get 'em, get 'em.

Because of very small ears and ear canals, I cannot successfully wear the in-ear headphones, but most over-ear headphones with decent sound that I've tried have been too unwieldy and uncomfortable to wear. Not these. The ear cups feel like memory foam covered with soft, breathable leather, and they conform to your ears, making for a pleasurable listening experience. They fit snuggly without pinching, and they have little brail-like raised nubs on the left side of the headband so you can tell in the dark how to put them on. (The wired cord fits into the right-side headphone cup, which is where the rest of the controls are.)

The wired sound is fantastic. I can hear all the nuances of the music even when it is turned down quite low, which is the way I prefer to listen to music; otherwise, my ears start hurting even at moderate volume. The wireless sound is also good, unless you walk too far away from your computer. I walked from my bedroom past the bathroom and into the kitchen, and only when I got into the kitchen did the sound start breaking up.

I had a terrible time getting the bluetooth pairing to work, though. (The instructions are terrible, and one should not have to go hunting all over Philips' website for the proper PDF to download just to get the headphones up and running the first time. I gave up looking and asked on the Amazon Vine forum to see if anyone else reviewing these headphones had found the requisite information; fortunately, somebody had.) I first tried pairing them to my MacBook Pro while visiting my sister in Atlanta, in a condo sandwiched between other condos, and could not get them to work at all. I had resigned myself to using them wired, but when I got home to my rural house, I was able to get them to connect and work by first deleting the original pairing and starting over. I don't know if I was experiencing interference or not. I have always found Bluetooth to be quirky, so I don't blame the headphones for what's clearly a Bluetooth issue, but Philips would do well to explain this most maddening aspect of their product a little better in a printed product insert.

Another thing that is badly explained is the setup for both input and output. I have not had the opportunity to test the internal headset/microphone and I'm not even going to try because I'm afraid I'll screw up the output from the headphones. I'm just using my computer's internal mic for any conversations I might have.

review.user_review:
I've been struggling to try to get a workable workstation set up in my bedroom. I work in my recliner on a lap tray, and I'd thought my little iPad Pro was going to work to replace my MacBook Pro for publishing books, which is what I do. It didn't. So I got a Mac Mini and set it up on a table in front of my recliner and do about half of my work on that and half on my iPad...in my recliner. In other words, I have to either get up and down a lot or I have to have a super-efficient setup that allows me to flip between the iPad and the mini without having to deal with a bunch of wires. I thought I was in hog heaven when I got my Loya Ark case and hub (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09N3QFPML), but it sat down too low for me to swipe up to get to my apps. So enter this stand. The little holder/feet/track thingies are spaced widely enough apart that I can sit my iPad in its case into them, and it does not slide at all. This stand is not really made for a tablet this big, but as long as I keep the case itself centered, it is very stable.

Now, I've had a lot of other types of stands. They all slip and slide on my desk, even if they're not supposed to. I have to lift my lap tray to get out of the recliner and swivel around while working. Nothing I've used to date stays put. This MintHouz stand DOES NOT BUDGE! I mean not at all. It behaves like I've glued it to the lapdesk until I deliberately pick it up. That is just priceless.

Another thing great about it is that I can adjust the height very precisely so that my line of sight just clears the Apple pencil top of my iPad, and I can see my entire Mac Mini monitor. Also priceless, because I can now see everything at the best angle for me with my progressive lenses.

I'm just very, very, very happy with this stand. It takes some muscle to move it into the position you want it, but once that's done, it's not going anywhere. Perfect.

review.user_review:
This laptop computer is pretty much as advertised, and I am glad to have it. The screen is sharp and readable in 2240 x 1400 pixels mode. This model does NOT have a touch screen, so if that's important to you, you need to look at other laptops that sport that feature. The system so far is quick to respond to requests and has sufficient RAM and storage space.

One nice feature missing from all the other laptops I‚Äôve owned or used is an automatic power up whenever the computer case is opened. There is also a power button in case you need it.

Beside Windows 11 Pro, this machine comes with significant value added: a year subscription to Microsoft Office 365 (normally $69.99/year) and also a two-year subscription to McAfee LiveSafe security suite (normally $129.99/year).

Most people who use laptops probably don‚Äôt mind that this machine, like most laptops now, does not have an ethernet port. However, WiFi seems to be performing well in its absence. I may not be the typical user, but I prefer the option to connect by ethernet.

I work almost exclusively at a desk with the power supply connected, so I have not tested the battery life of this Dell. My only real complaint is that, owing to the 14‚Äù display size, the keyboard is correspondingly smaller than I like. If I were to do much typing, I‚Äôd probably plug in an external keyboard. If your hands are smaller than mine are, this won't be much of an issue for you.

As has been mentioned in other reviews, this is not a gamer‚Äôs dream machine. It‚Äôs for normal office and business use. Its compact size makes it good for the road.

review.user_review:
I am disappointed with these headphones for only one reason: My ears are small, and because of that, these headphones will not snuggly "hang" over my ears like they should. (Children would have the same problem, I expect.) If the over-ear part of the headphones were a little more moldable, I might be able to make them work for me; the extra ear gels themselves are helpful in getting a good fit into the ear canal, but that doesn't keep them from falling off of me. This is why I'm knocking of a star but, again, the problem is not with the headset but with my own anatomy!

With that caveat aside, I love them! For a gardener who wants to listen to something outside while working, the FM radio works just fine and the yellow rubbery cord keeps them around your neck even if you do knock them off. The U.S. Military-grade protection features (against dust, moisture, and shock) make these headphones stand out from the pack.

The Bluetooth pairing and sustained connection with these is better than any other Bluetooth device I've ever used, although I tend not to use Bluetooth unless I'm up and about in the house doing chores. I also don't make or get a lot of phone calls, so we don't even have a cellphone account and depend on the occasional VoIP to get the job done. Meaning I haven't tested the headset features at all.

But the sound is crisp and clear, without mud, more like monitoring headphones used in the music industry. I feel no pressure when wearing them (holding them to my head with my hands, of course, to keep them from falling off of my teensy ears), and I know they would be very comfortable for me in daily use. Maybe I can come up with something to rig them with so they don't fall off. Because I really do like them.

description: Product Description

Exercise is about freedom, pushing limits and enjoying doing it. Some people like to exercise while listening to music, other want to be able to answer incoming calls while on-the-go. With the Jabra SPORT Bluetooth stereo headset it‚Äôs easy to do both - and without the hassle of headset wires that slow you down. You simply stream music and calls via Bluetooth to it. With the Jabra SPORT you get exceptional music and call sound quality. It has A2DP for streaming music, AM3D Power Bass for audio enhancement, and a wind-shielded microphone. It also has a built-in FM radio so you can tune in to your favorite station while you work out. Jabra SPORT is ultra-light and easy to wear. With a choice of different Eargels and a flexible behind-the-ear fit, it stays firmly and comfortably in place. It‚Äôs also tough - with US Military Grade rain, dust and shock protection it is fit for any challenge, indoors or outdoors.
Amazon.com

Ideal for an active lifestyle, the Jabra SPORT Bluetooth headset allows you to both wirelessly enjoy music and take call during workout. Featuring a built-in FM radio, A2DP streaming audio technology, and powerful bass to help energize workout performance, the Jabra SPORT provides a wider variety of music options when exercising and easy-to-use controls. The stereo headset also features a wind-shielded microphone and is US Military Standard Rain, Dust and Shock Resistant certified, ensuring that you don't need to hold back during your workouts on account of your headphones.
Enjoy wireless music and calls and get more out of your workouts (
view larger

You also get your own on-the-go personal trainer with the free Endomondo sports tracker app. With the Endomondo app, you'll get instant feedback with your workout status read aloud through your headset, and you can pause Endomondo from tracking your workout with the press of a button.
Get More Out of Your Workouts with Wireless Music and Calls

Exercise is about freedom, about pushing limits and enjoying doing it. Some people like to exercise while listening to music, some talk on the phone. With the Jabra SPORT Bluetooth stereo headset it's easy to do both--and without the hassle of headset wires that slow you down. You simply stream music and calls via Bluetooth to it.

With the Jabra SPORT you get exceptional music and call sound quality. It has A2DP, AM3D Power Bass audio enhancement and a wind-shielded microphone and Virtual Surround Sound audio enhancements. It also has a built-in FM radio so you can tune in to your favorite station while you work out.

The ergonomic Jabra SPORT is ultra-light and easy to wear. With a choice of different ear gels and a flexible behind-the-ear fit, it stays firmly and comfortably in place. You'll get up to 4.5 hours of continuous talk time or 3 hours of continuous music playback.

When using indoors, you can place your Bluetooth-enabled mobile device anywhere within up to a 30-foot radius of where you're working out. For optimal reception when wearing outdoors, you should place your mobile device above the waist and on the right side of the body (the recommended placement is on your right arm using an optional arm strap).
Endomondo Sports Tracker App

The free Endomondo Sports Tracker is the highest rated sports tracking app in most app stores, and it can be used for running, cycling, walking and all other distance-based outdoor sports. Using GPS, the app tracks route, distance, duration, split times, calorie consumption, and more, while providing audio feedback on your performance for every mile or km. The app offers a full history with previous workouts and statistics, as well as a route map for each workout. On certain handsets, the app also supports integration with the built-in music player and heart rate monitors.

At Endomondo.com, Endomondo users have a full social community where they can challenge each other, follow friends live and share everything on Facebook and Twitter. Endomondo has more than 2.5 million users and supports almost all GPS-enabled phones--including those powered by iOS, Android, BlackBerry, Windows Phone 7, and Nokia operating systems.
Using the Endomondo Sports Tracker App with Jabra SPORT

If you have downloaded the Endomondo app to your mobile phone you have access to an exclusive feature only provided with Jabra SPORT. With Jabra SPORT connected to your phone and with the Endomondo app open while exercising you can press the Play/Pause button to get a status update of your workout read aloud through the headset.

review.user_review_title: Don't slip on very well with socks, but work perfectly barefoot
review.user_review: I have another pair of slip-on shoes with uppers that are made of this same breathable fabric. When I first put them on, they were too tight, but after a short while I broke them in and they were perfect for me. The same looks like it will be the case with these shoes, except these have the hands-free step-in heels. When I first put them on, they were a little snug, but then they started to feel really comfortable and good. They will be very good walking shoes. It may even be that once they are broken in, they'll slip on hands-free even with socks on, but I'll probably just wear them barefoot. The top of the shoe comes up a little bit higher than I'm used to, but that's the style. I like them. Now, the trick will be not to ruin their appearance in the garden so I'll have some nice shoes to wear out in public.

review.user_review_title: It does have a lot of slots, but they are tucked about
review.user_review:
The window one inside is best for driver's license, I think. The money clip, for those who do not carry bills, won't be much help for that, but it's great for clipping appointment cards, grocery list, receipts until you get them home, or other paper items you need to hang onto temporarily. The back slot with thumb-push cutout is best for your most-used card, whether it be a credit card or ID card or whatever. Little used cards can be tucked up inside the pockets underneath the inside pockets and the top slots reserved for those you use more frequently.

review.user_review: When I ordered this, I didn't notice that it was a "one step latte" that included creamer and sweetener.  The "on step" is an easy way to get your morning cup. My at home coffee is usually plain coffee with sugar free creamer added to it. This one has 100 calories per cup which although not a lot for fancy coffee drink, it's significantly more than what I usually have. I am liking this k-cup latte. The caramel taste is pretty good. It reminds me of burnt sugar. There is an aftertaste, but it's not off putting. I received 6 boxes of these and there are 10 k-cups in each box. My 19 year old daughter is happy to be taking a couple of boxes with her to college this fall.

review.user_review: I personally am not a fan of beef (or other meat) jerky, but my son and husband love it. I did have a taste of this and I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor. I think one of the issues that I have with jerky in general is that texture and consistency. I find it hard on my teeth. This one was actually easy to chew and I didn't feel any concern that I was going to lose a crown! The flavor is a nice balance of sweet and smokey. The price is reasonable and comparable to what I usually spend on jerky for my guys. Between my husband and son, all of the packages were gone within a few days. While I don't think I will start eating jerky, I will definitely consider this brand and flavor when purchasing jerky for my family.

I would say that the taste is pretty comparable to other fruit snack products out there. I wouldn't say they were healthy snacks by any means, but they are a quality fruit gummy snack that's made a little better than some of the other fruit snacks out there.

The barrel of the brush is on the small side. I think I would prefer a larger barrel so any curls I get are looser and more natural. Overall, it does a good job. review.user_review: My 23 year old son was in need of a new mattress. He has difficulty sleeping and we were hoping a new mattress would help. He's a big guy. His previous mattress was a pillow top mattress. It was very squishy. This one is not too squishy - and I mean that in a good way. You do sink into it a little bit, but it's easy to get up out of it. You can feel support even though you've sunken down a little bit whereas the pillow top mattress did not feel supportive. The cooling effect is pretty mild. It may be that it's hard to go through the mattress protector and the sheets. It was noticeable before those pieces were put on it. He's been using it for a couple of nights now and so far, it doesn't seem to make any difference with his sleep. However, he does find it to be comfortable. He has an appointment with a sleep doctor soon, so hopefully that will help. The mattress arrived compressed and rolled up. It didn't take too long to fully expand - maybe a day. It didn't have any strong chemical smell like some memory foam products have.

review.user_review_title: Good Coffee for Those Who Like it Medium
review.user_review:
Based on Coffee Review's 2/6/15 review of K-cups, I purchased this variety pack to get their Fifth Avenue Medium coffee, tied for the second highest rating. I have already tried the equally high rated Green Mountain's Sumatran Reserve, one of my favorites, and their top rated Giv Coffee Yirgacheffe Konga Natural Dark, which I liked but not as much as my favorite, Marley Lively Up! Expresso.

While the men in my family will surely love this coffee, it is too weak for me.

- I made Donut Truck full strength (6 oz), whitened with a little pure cream and found it too weak.
- Then I made Stock Exchange at 6 oz and tried it black. It was amazingly smooth but still too weak for me.
- Then I cleaned my pot before making Fifth Ave., made it at 6 oz, and tried it black. Again smooth and mild.

I do have to mention, however, that the Marley coffee cost $.63/cup and the Giv coffee was over $1/cup. So Hiline was the best buy at $.50/cup.

Addendum: Even the men are fairly blase about this coffee. They said it's fine but not exceptional. They prefer Marley Light.

description: Enjoy premium freshly-roasted coffee pods for Keurig. Each HiLine pod contains award-winning beans roasted within days before shipping to deliver a delightfully fresh brew.
Stock Exchange Dark
(Origin: Brazil) On the palate, this coffee is bold and seductive. Notes of raspberry and almond are balanced with a slight hint of chocolate to provide a strong finish.
Donut Truck Medium
(Origin: Colombia) This coffee is beautifully roasted to create a perfectly balanced cup. Notes of citrus and chocolate produce a smooth, sweet finish.
Fifth Ave Medium
(Origin: El Salvador) This is not a simple coffee by any measure. Notes of honey and peach are complemented by a wide spectrum of spicy undertones. The finish is radiant and flavorful.

review.user_review: Assembly was easy and the quality is good. My problem with this bin is the size.  For most people, the size is probably perfect for what they need to put in it. We bought a large gathering basket at the flea market for $15 but you don't really to pile your vegetable on top of each other.  The vegtables are beautiful so it's nice to have them on display and necessary for them to have air around them.

review.user_review_title: Good, Affordable Mattress for Kids' Beds
review.user_review:
This is a very comfortable mattress. We put in the top of a trundle bed specifically because it is heavy enough that the kids can't take it off the bed or shift the mattress around if they are cutting up. However, it's not so heavy that I can't move it when I make the bed.

The inability to bounce on it is a definite plus with kids. My grandson broke a platform bed by jumping on it so they are only getting these unbouncy gel mattresses from now on.

This mattress is firmer than the more expensive innerspring mattress that is on the bottom trundle bed but not so firm as to be uncomfortable. I prefer the softer mattress but the kids like both of them equally.

No one complained about any odor.

review.user_review:
As a grandmother of five I have plenty of opportunity to make fruit juice icees for the kids and this machine really knows how to pulverize ice. This is definitely a high-powered machine.

It's easy to disassemble, clean, and put back together. It uses 500 more watts and more than twice the horsepower of the [[ASIN:B000VWLWUE Breville 800BLXL Die-Cast Hemisphere 2-Speed Blender with 67-Ounce Polycarbonate Jar]]

It is heavy but so are all well-made kitchen appliances. If it takes up too much space on your counter, buy a smaller model. My beloved Breville 88BLXL is slightly smaller and lighter.

While I wish it also had one speed lower, I can always use an older blender for slower speeds. Don't buy this unless you can handle this kind of power.

review.user_review:
Lightweight, compact, easy to use toaster. My brother and I have used it a half dozen times over the past week with no problems. Toasted my healthy, whole grain toast as easily as his throw away white bread. I think the big test will be if it is still working in three month. The toaster I use at my house is 30 years old.

14 month review: Good as new. No problems at all.

review.user_review:
11 Month Update: Just set up my fifth Micca. I used another Silicon Power 1 TB Hard Drive but I bought a discounted out-of-box Micca. Again flawless performance from both.

10 Month Update: I just set up my fourth Micca. I put the movies on a brand new Silicon Power 1 TB Hard Drive. I would have preferred using a high capacity USB drive but they are still cost prohibitive. I noticed that the Silicon Power was formatted in FAT32 but didn't think that would make a difference.

When I hooked the drive to the Micca, it read the drive fine but displayed all the movies twice and wouldn't play them. I erased the Silicon Power, reformatted in NTFS, reloaded the movies, and it played fine.

9 Month Update: Addendum: I thought my unit quit working (I was wrong) so I contacted Micca and they had a replacement to me in two days. Awesome!

Original Review: I've got two brothers with no internet, computer, or cable TV. Their only access to movies is via an antenna and an old DVD player. I was going to start burning shows to dvds for them (which I haven't done in a decade) when I came upon this device. Sounded too good to be true.

Took me three minutes to hook it up (new Smart TV) and less than a minute to find a movie on the attached hard drive. I had watched a video on how it worked before I ordered it so I basically knew what to look for.

Then I hooked it up to a 10 year old Samsung (took about a minute) and it played perfectly.

I already had an old 2TB hard drive to use for the movies so my only cost was for this device.

I spent another 10 minutes making a set of instructions for them that were easier to use than those that came with the device.

I put this one in the mail for them but am ordering a second one for myself. I currently hook my computer to my TV to watch movies and TV shows (no cable for me either) but it's a bit of a hassle and the HDMI cable doesn't connect well to my Lenova Yoga. This device is much more convenient and I can leave it hooked up all the time.

I never thought they could make something this small and this cheap and this easy to use at this quality. I highly recommend.

Addendum: My grandson quickly laid claim to the second one so now I have to order a third one.

I was laid up after medical treatment yesterday so I used this to watch multiple shows. I found the remote to be imprecise when making selections and repeatedly ended up in the wrong place so it is not as easy to use as your TV remote. I can get to shows fine but can't easily move within shows.

review.user_review_title: A Lot of Functionality for a Small Price
review.user_review: I bought the Anker Power Strip with 2 Outlets and 2 USB Ports and the Mifaso USB Extension Cord with 3 Outlets and 3 USB Ports, both with 5 ft Extension Cord and both around $15. I velcroed them to the top bunk in two different rooms so that the kids would have easy access to power for their technology. review.user_review_title: Great sound! Easy Set-up! But does cause interference.
review.user_review:
The sound is fantastic. It is very clear and the set-up was super-easy. It took only seconds. There is no difference in the sound quality from wireless to wired connection. (There is usb wired connection cable with mini-usb connector for headset for charging.) The headset itself is lighter and more comfortable than I thought it would be. The headset itself adjusts very easy and does not slip or slide.

The microphone is sensitive and very clear. It adjusts very easy both veritically and horizonally.

The only negative I can speak of does not relate to the actual headset. The wireless headset interfere with my wireless Panasonic surround sound in another room. It (wireless surround sound)crackles with static when the headset is being used in wireless mode.
