The Vengeance 2000 wireless gaming headset gives you realistic multi-channel gaming audio and play-for-hours comfort. Renowned Corsair sound quality not only makes your gaming audio more enjoyable -- it gives you a tactical advantage, too.
The wireless headset for gamers who care about audio.
Attach the wireless adapter directly to an available USB port. Or, use the included USB extension cable for easier access.
Free Yourself
Enjoy high-performance gaming audio without worrying about wires. With a battery life of up to 10 hours and a range of up to 40 feet, you won‚Äôt miss out on any of the action.
Large, meticulously-tuned 50mm drivers and circumaural earcup design give you renowned Corsair audio quality with excellent sound isolation.
Know your enemy

Corsair‚Äôs optimized HRTF positional audio technology gives you the tactical advantage you need for victory. Accurate reproduction of multi-channel 5.1/7.1 surround sound gaming audio helps you locate your opponents even if you can't see them, for an immersive, realistic gaming environment.
Hear it all

Large 50mm drivers deliver audio with more detail and more realism for maximum enjoyment and a competitive edge. The tight bass response lets you experience deep, satisfying lows without distortion or overload, and voices are crisp and clear.
Take Command

Whether you're calling out DPS targets or just chatting between matches over VOIP, the unidirectional, noise cancelling condenser microphone ensures that you're heard loud and clear. The adjustable, rotating boom flips out of the way when you don't need it.
Play for Hours

The microfiber-covered memory foam earpads and padded headband let you play in comfort for hours. And if you manage to run the 10-hour battery all the way to zero, you can use the Vengeance 2000 even while it's charging.
Corsair audio: a sound philosophy
Comfort, fidelity, and playing to win

At Corsair, we believe that you need more than just dramatic audio. You need the comfort that allows you to play or talk for hours without thinking about what's on your head. You need fidelity that gives you a listening experience that's not just immersive ‚Äî it must also be true to the source material. And, of course, you need the detailed positioning and situational awareness that lets you play your best.
The Corsair Advantage

With a long history of building enthusiast-grade memory and components, we've earned a reputation for quality, compatibility, and performance. Need help? We're available by phone call, email or web forum.

review.user_review_title: Narrow Sole Makes Walking Unbalanced and Uncomfortable
review.user_review:
The shoe is attractive and fits my foot like a glove (I wear an 8 and ordered a large). If I didn't have to walk in them, they'd be wonderful.

But there is something wrong with the sole. It's like walking on a roll of thick foam about the size of an empty toilet paper cardboard - you feel unbalanced and your feet hang over the edge of the hard sole.

I compared the sole with another pair of slippers and found the hard sole on the Leg Resource slippers to be a good 3/4" narrower than the other pair.

I can't recommend these slippers.

review.user_review_title: Yummy Vegan Gluten-Free crackers - super duper crispy! : )
review.user_review:
These crackers are delicious and crunchy. I LOVE that they are Vegan and Gluten-free as that is all me. I got the variety pack so that I could try all three flavors. The cheese ones are cheesy and tasty enough without trying to hit you over the head with fake flavor like other brands do. Plus, they are not salty or sweet ‚Äì again, a lot of other crackers add salt or sugar to make up for flavor that is otherwise lacking. The herb ones are REALLY lovely as well. The plain salt ones are nice too ‚Äì although I usually prefer the other flavors. For simple snacking I prefer the cheese and herb ‚Äì for dipping or spreading I prefer the plain salt ones - although they are also good plain. They are just crispy loveliness - with far better ingredients.

These crackers are super crunchy and crispy. They are a bit on the dry side ‚Äì but that makes them very snappy crispy. Great to eat as a snack alone, with a dip or cheese, or even as a side for soup or salad ‚Äì I have eaten them all this way. : ) They really are so crispy and crunchy ‚Äì I love them.
If you found my review helpful, why not click the ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù button. Thanks! Enjoy your day! : )

review.user_review_title: Easy enough to make with BAD directions - Mine were oily, though
review.user_review:
The direction on this box are wacko. You will get confused in using one or two eggs ‚Äì believe me, definitely go for the two. One egg will not cut it and your brownies will simply crumble away. They really need to fix the directions. I got another one of their products and the direction were bad there as well. Not sure who is in charge of this at the company but it needs attention as it can ruin a recipe.

Anyway ‚Äì in using two eggs ‚Äì or in my case, the substitute for two eggs ‚Äì as I like to keep these not only gluten-free but also Vegan, it was easy enough to make. : ) They come out REALY good tasting, though. Although a bit oily... like a lot oilier than I would have liked. : (

So nice mix ‚Äì but BAD directions. Also, there is no way this will make 20 brownies unless you use the largest sheet pan and spread them super thin ‚Äì just nope.
I hope that you have found my review ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù. : ) Enjoy your day! : )

description: Get baking with the Wholefort Quinoa Brownie Mix for an all natural, gluten free, dairy free dessert that the whole family will enjoy. Our brownie baking mix has a rich chocolate flavor and is made with quinoa flour - a nutrient dense, gluten free alternative to wheat flour that lends a moist, tender texture to our delicious chocolate brownies.

Our chocolate brownie mix is made with just six wholesome, natural ingredients and contains no artificial colors, flavors, or preservatives. The mix itself is completely plant based and can be used as a vegan dessert mix with a few simple substitutions outlined in the baking instructions.

review.user_review_title: Not an instant beverage apparently - still Very Nice!
review.user_review:
Silly me, based on the ingredients, I just assumed this was an "instant" beverage. It is not. You are supposed to brew it like coffee. I don't brew coffee - but no problem, I just used my steepstir tea diffuser and it worked wonderfully. I mean some of the really fine bits ended up at the bottom of my mug - but it really wasn't an issue.

It doesn't taste like fig and it doesn't taste like chickpea. It just tastes Very Nice. Not sure I would categorize it as a coffee taste - but I am not a big coffee drinker anyway. I actually really liked it, though. It is not bitter at all. And it barely needed anything added to it - just a small dash of nut milk and a light VERY light dash of coconut sugar - and it was perfect.

I was also able to use the diffuser twice easily - for a second mug-full- in my big giant mug. I liked that! Really LOVE that it is Organic and is clearly marked Vegan (even though it only has two ingredients and by default is vegan - still like those that advertise it as such!)

If you found my review helpful, why not click the "Helpful" button. Thanks! : )

review.user_review_title: Generally Nice - but only single sided...
review.user_review:
These are generally nice little felt banner flags but I am a bit disappointed as I was thinking they would be double sided. They are not - the pattern is only on one side. I was hoping to hang these in my bay window but now will not as they will not look as good inside as they will from outside. With that being said - they are still cute - but need to be hung against something solid. Although they are just a bit see through so I suppose if hung in a sunny window you could see the pattern through them - although much lighter in color...

The polka dots, the stripes, and the flag patterns are all printed on the banners themselves while the letters and the stars are sperate pieces of felt that are glued on. Not a problem - but just good to know. They seem well cut and well attached - so no issue. The ribbons they are strung with are also very nice and sturdy - I prefer that to just a string - makes it look fancier. : )

review.user_review_title: Cute : ) but NOT a 20 inch wreath
review.user_review:

Taking it out of the box it is more like a 15-inch wreath. (That is a 15.5 inch ruler I used in all the pictures.) It looks way stragglier then the stock photos but once you kind of work the leaves a bit and spread it open and out more (and flip some leaves over) it definitely looks better - but still only maybe a 15 inch wreath. review.user_review_title: LOADS of narrow heads ‚Äì NEAT ‚Äì the heads make this awesome!!!
review.user_review:
I got this as they included so many heads ‚Äì many of which looked pretty narrow. I have other electronic dusters but they all have rather large nozzle heads. I really wanted something that would do better in replacing the canned air with that narrow straw. Now nothing is going to do that ‚Äì but this thing comes super close! Seriously ‚Äì the variety of nozzle attachments as well as the variety of included brushes truly make this thing pretty awesome. They include a little spatula with the brush - not sure what I am supposed to do with the spatula ‚Äì but whatever. The two narrowest heads are my favorite ‚Äì and I really like the narrow head that is closed on the bottom but open on the two sides ‚Äì SUPER neat for some things.

As for the machine. It came charged at 100% but is easy enough to plug in and charge. It is a long press to turn the machine on ‚Äì but it is just powered ‚Äì not really on. All the lights light up in the wheel and it will say 0 ‚Äì as well as show what your battery is at. A short press turns it to the lowest setting of 1 and then more short presses get you to 2 and then 3. It is already super powerful at the 1 setting ‚Äì 3 blows stuff all around the room. I am pretty sure you could go outside with 3 and blow leaves‚Ä¶ That is where I wish things were a little different. I wish 1 was much more gentle and that 3 wasn‚Äôt an insane hurricane. Some things need more of a delicate touch and because of the power behind this I can not use it for everything that I wanted. This is most notably art projects. I also wish I did not have to cycle through all the settings to get back to one ‚Äì but it isn‚Äôt bad as a long press turns the whole thing off and then another turns it on at 0.

Again ‚Äì the included heads are what truly make this a good machine to have ‚Äì although too much power for more delicate things. I am still very happy to have it.
I hope that you have found my review ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù. : ) Enjoy your day! : )

review.user_review_title: CD works ‚Äì but too loud ‚Äì and radio is an issue
review.user_review:
I thought I would be happier with this thing. I love my CD‚Äôs and have quite a collection that I am unwilling to give up. Of course, then, I need a way to play them. I got this to play them on the go or in my house. It is easy enough to use for CD playing and it does not skip or anything. The sound quality is nice and the ear buds, although a style I am not used to, are very nice and have good sound quality as well. I also am able to plug in a speaker for around the house ‚Äì no issues there either.

I got this particular machine as it also has a radio function and I also like to listen to the radio. And that is where it terribly falls flat. : ( First ‚Äì each time you turn it on ‚Äì even if the last thing you were doing was listening to the radio and there is no CD in the machine ‚Äì it will automatically try to play a CD. You have to hit the Radio button each time. Annoying‚Ä¶ Then the radio dials are not intuitive at all and make me crazy and are VERY hard to tune and set as well. The only saving grace is that whatever radio station it was set to last ‚Äì automatically gets put on so I do not need to fumble to get my favorite station. Seriously, though ‚Äì the radio station selecting and stuff is a nightmare on this thing. VERY difficult and annoying.

Also ‚Äì you can not use the radio if you plug the headphones into the headphone jack 1 ‚Äì you can ONLY plug it into headphone jack 2 ‚Äì as that jack uses your headphones as an antenna for reception. You get NO reception plugged into 1.

Lastly, regarding the radio ‚Äì even at the lowest volume setting of ‚Äú1‚Äù (lower is ‚Äú0‚Äù) it is way too loud for me when listening to the radio with the ear buds. It is ridiculous. For CD‚Äôs as most of them are older from my childhood ‚Äì they are lower naturally ‚Äì so the volume at ‚Äú1‚Äù is low for them and I have no issue. Newer CD‚Äôs though are louder and I wish I could adjust the volume down more. Plus, the volume is a flick switch ‚Äì not a dial ‚Äì so you have to flick it up or down for each ‚Äúdegree‚Äù of volume you want to adjust. Would have much preferred a dial for actually being able to set a volume I can use. Sadly ‚Äì this will mostly be used with a plug-in speaker around my house now as my speaker also has its own volume adjust. BUT that defeats the entire purpose of being able to use this with ear buds on the go. I am disappointed. : (
If you found my review helpful, why not click the ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù button. Thanks! Enjoy your day! : )

review.user_review:
Wow - I should have gotten this bag years ago ago to make my life better. What a difference. It is not bulky at all - super streamlined. It is all I need to tote around my small laptop, my netbook, or my Surface - along with cables and the like. GREAT! Plus you can use it like a backpack or just use the handle instead.

The jean-like color and material is very cool. I LOVE that the backpack straps are easily attachable and detachable with a clip - and otherwise tuck away completely. This is super handy when maybe you are just running to and from the car with the bag - I just use the handle then - and the backpack straps are tucked away like they do not even exist - perfect.

PLUS the padding is AMAZING. Super plush where I feel my equipment is very well protected. It is actually the most plush and thick padding I have had in any laptop bag - even with the bags I might borrow from the IT department. They all pale in comparison. For the two front zipper pockets - the zippers tuck away as well - so super streamlined!

Finally I decided to unzip more zippers to "expand" the bag to see what that function was all about. WOW! It expands to like a nice little carry-on luggage bag! I was surprised it was so much like a tiny suitcase. Have not used that part yet functionally - but it would make a great overnight or weekend bag.

The only cons I could possibly see - depending on your lifestyle - is that you have to "expand" the bag to have access to the charging port (inside and outside the bag) - and you have to either have your laptop or tablet or battery in the suitcase part (NOT the plush protective part) in order to plug it in on the inside. Plus the inside cable pretty much hangs free in there otherwise - a little mesh pocket or something would help to tuck that away and make it all neat when not in use. Personally for me this is a total non-issue as I don't travel overseas or anything anymore in my current job - so personally I can not even see myself using the cabling/charging feature at all - or even expanding the bag really. Nice that it is there, though, as an option.

Unfortunately, it's not always possible to hop on the next flight home. Sometimes, all you need is a little pick-me-up when you're missing the island life. What better way to lift your spirits than with a delicious traditional snack? Luckily, we‚Äôve got the perfect one for you.
Immerse yourself in a treat that will take you back to the pristine shores of Hawaii with the Snack Hawaii Pickled Mangoes.

If you grew up in Hawaii or have spent some time there, you'll know that it's very easy to miss when you leave. Our little island community is tightly-knit and filled with people that embody the sunshine and waves. But more than that, it's easy to miss the delectable flavors of Hawaiian staples. We're bringing home a little bit closer to you with a classic favorite. Our pickled mangoes are a staple healthy snack for anyone who loves Hawaii. Fills me up and keeps away the hunger pains until lunch (1130 -so 7 hours later!).  The amount is perfect for me and I really can't say enough good about this drink.  I do HIGHLY recommend drinking these cold as they are not as tasty (I think) at room temps.  I have tried other Carnation drinks but these are by far the best flavor of any of them.

review.user_review: This is a nice fan.  3 speed setting and a sleep setting really make this one a winner.  Remote works from across the room.  Fan motor is a bit noisy (kind of a steady drone no matter what the speed setting or oscillation on or off)  this is tall which is nice for a bedroom or living room to actually reach you (no mlre propping up a fan on a box or crate)  cord is decent length (8 foot or so).  Assembly is quick easy and toolless.  Fan has an attractive woodgrain finish around the vents.  Also love the push button controls on the face. No more turning knobs the wrong way.  Fan base is pretty stable but I would use caution (as you should with any fan) especially around young children and or pets

The replacment lights work great and i now have a bunch of extras.  Our porch looks amazing at night.

review.user_review: THis is a great case for the Samsung Galaxy Tab2 7.0.  The tablet fits perfectly and is nice and secure.  all the ports line up perfectly and are easy enough to get at.  The back flip down stand is cool and functional.  The wireless keyboard charged right up and links with the tablet instantly.  Also the keyboard is attached to the case via MAGNETS!!!! how freakin awesome is that?  I was so overly impressed with that feature (one that I either missed in the discription, or it was never mentioned).  The keyboard lines up perfectly everytime you want to put it away, and takes just enough pressure to remove that your confidient that it is going to stay put when docked.  The keyboard is nice and light and seems solid and well built.  It is small, but is a lot easier to use the the on screen keyboard.  Ut is super easy to switch between keyboards and the entire process is smooth and seamless.  The case can be folded back around (basicall flipping the keyboard side all the way around to the back) so you can prop it up on your knees while in bed.  it is super easy to use in either mode (lanscape or portrait) and has a good closing flap.  About the only compliant is that the clasp tucks into a belt loop and can be a bit awkward to close up (especially if your in a hurry).  It is so very minor that it does not warrent the removal of a star (I guess it does make the case more secure when closed).  All in all if your thinking of a keyboard case for you galaxy tab2 7.0 you can really look no further.  This one is the bee's knees!

review.user_review_title: Cool head unit but some minor issues
review.user_review: This is a cool head unit.  We did a temp install (using several jumper wires and what not) just to test it out.  Once we decide which car it goes into we will do a permanent install.  Sound was great as was the touch screen.  We had a little trouble with bluetooth pairing and sometimes it cut out on music or calls (could easily be our temp install job).  We couldn't get our camera to work with it no matter what we tried, but we had a prewired camera we were trying to tap into so that may be the issue.  Usb and aux worked great and we plugged an Ipod nano in with no issues at all and had no cut out or issues with shuffling.  We didnt even try the included camera but it looks to be a decent quality and is real compact but again a wired camera that requires some time to route the wires and tap into power.  Radio seems to lock on channels well enough and we had no problems tuning in our local stations.  Remote worked well enough from both the front and back set.  No dead spots on the screen and nothing misspelled or missing.  We also didnt try out the sd card slot as we didnt have anything downloaded on an sd card.  Not a bad head unit

Will not chop up rosemary.
Also use these for other spices I grow.
The holes are very tiny, does not let spice come out.
There is the chain I could use to let it hang in the pot, but I just put in the whole infuser.
The lid screws on tight.

This is actually for loose tea the holes are tiny.
For tea these come with tiny saucer to put this on when you take it out of your tea cup.

I think it‚Äôs pricey for a tea infuser!

review.user_review_title: Like it, seems made well, would buy this again.
review.user_review:
If I read all the negative reviews I would not have got this.
That said, I like this, and there are always going to be Negative people crabbing they want to pay
a low price, but expect something for a heck of allot more money..Doesn‚Äôt work that way folks.

As I said, I do like this. Its is sturdier then what I expected, and a good size.
The sides are pretty thick, as is the bottom and stiff . It will hold what you want it for.
For now I put it next to my bed to hold books and magazines.
Its also useful if your a knitter, to hold you yarn, and supplies, crafts etc.
Can use this in the closet or where every, for shoes, slippers, purses, socks. Sweaters, gym wear, the kids balls, and Fold up some summer clothes,
and put them in this. etc.

When I drive to my daughters home a few hours away to stay a few of days, instead of stuffing my luggage
with my PJ‚Äôs, underwear, socks etc, or I can fold my jeans to put inside this with shoes at the bottom.
This is perfect, and easy to put in my room there.
The heavy braided handles seem sturdy, and go into silver grommets that are knotted on the side .
Once I start to wear the clothes in this when traveling, I can also use this for my hamper when traveling. Although I personally like to use a pillow case for dirty laundry.

So many uses for the basket. Good for the kids toys, or if your short on storage etc.
The color gary stripe is not too dark, ((love it) and has the off white stripe.Perfect, goes with anything.
I noticed someone complained about the color, cause its not White, and gave this low stars!. Gee, its a off white.

To me ,this does not look like a type of paper, but a type of burlap with a plastic coating over it!
I hope this holds up,it looks like it would. If it doesn‚Äôt I will up-date this review.

review.user_review_title: VERY comfortable, Good Bass and Clarity.  5 Star
review.user_review:
These are probably the most comfortable headsets i have ever used. I listen to a lot of music and do a lot of gaming. So far I have a lot of pros, and really no cons to speak of.

I am already thinking of getting these for some friends for birthdays/holidays!

Pros:
-Super comfortable and mostly noise canceling with the pads.
-Good bass and sound clarity
-Very easy setup
-The option for the headphone cable is awesome because there a handful of devices that I use these with and the cable makes it very easy to switch between yet keep the bluetooth linked to the primary device
-The case is also a great addition. It is compact, has all the needed cables yet can still fit in a backpack or clip onto a strap with the carabiner

Cons:
-The headphone cable needs to be plugged in with the right side in the headphones or it does not work properly at all.

These really are an incredible headset from someone that enjoys HD audio and headsets that I can wear for 6-8 hours without any discomfort!

review.user_review_title: Probably the best sprat deal out there.
review.user_review:
This is the most cost effective way to get sprats that I know of. Sprats are also knows as "brisling sardines" and can be had at about two dollars fifty cents a tin if purchased in bulk, but that for four ounces or less. Here we've got well over five ounces of tightly packed sprats in two layers.

To me the smokey flavor is right on. Not too smokey, but it's there. My only issue, which is minor, is that these sprats seem a little on the mushy side. I would prefer them a bit firmer, but then they spend who-knows-how-much time soaked in oil, which doesn't exactly make things crunchy.

My only issue is whether or not to continue buying these or spend a bit more to get the sprats packed in olive oil (which these aren't), but the bang for the buck is here.

review.user_review_title: Awesome Sauce, but don't be a chump to get it.
review.user_review:
So my son woke up one day and decided that his lifetime addiction to chicken dinosaurs had ended. My ex wife gives me the huge Costco bag of Jurassic chicken nuggets, which I would never buy for myself but am determined not to waste.

So, I needed a dipping sauce for my chicken like nuggets and I wished I could get some of that sweet and sour goopy sauce that I remember from all the wonderful cheap Chinese restaurant and buffet memories I have in my head. I found a jar of this sauce at the supermarket for two dollars and gave it a try (yes, the 10 oz size) and it was the sweet and sour sauce of my dreams and memories. I almost want to buy more foods to dump it on. La Choy once made Chinese food swing American, and now it made American chicken dinosaurs swing Asian. Way to go La Choy!

But watch the price. Like I wrote, my jar cost me two bucks.

review.user_review_title: It's better than just a fan that blows air around, and definitely better than nothing.
review.user_review:
First of all, and it says this in the instructions, this is not an air conditioner. Now that I've tried it, I'm sure of that. What it is is a tall, oscillating fan with the added feature that it can evaporate water and blow air slightly cooler than the air in the room.

I discovered this by running an experiment. I waited for the weather to warm up a bit and for my living room to get slightly uncomfortably warm. I set this air cooler up about three feed from me near my desk, and filled the water tank with cold water and added a frozen ice pack. The room air temperature was 73 degrees, and once this air cooler was warmed up...ere...cooled down...it blew air with a temperature of about 69 degrees.

This isn't going to cool a room, but it might make me cooler during the hottest weather of the summer if it is close to me. Right now I'm running it on low, and it doesn't bother me at all even though it is about three feet away. I could run it on a faster speed and have it further away.

I also noticed that the humidity in my living room has increased from 27% to 30% over the past hour or so. My living room is about 400 square feet.

It's a good thing this air cooler has a handle making it easy to move. Now I just need to get it an extension cord.

review.user_review_title: Light weight vacuum that really sucks up stuff.
review.user_review:
[[VIDEOID:edf6321ba672d9b2a86e608bea2e67f6]] This vacuum weighs about ten pounds, and the battery weighs about another two pounds (I weighed them separately.) This might be good for people who need very light vacuum cleaner, and that along with the cordless feature means it's about the most maneuverable vacuum, that's not a toy, that I've ever used.

I put it to the test in the attached video with a lot of various dirt on the floor and it sucked everything up. Very impressive. Between the light weight and the roller, this vacuum propels itself. It wanted to go forward, and I had to hold it back.

I left it on to see how long a fully charged battery would last, and it lasted an impressive 40 minutes. I would think that would be enough time to vacuum the floors of a normal sized house. When I first got the vacuum, the battery seemed to charge in about an hour. It didn't seem like a long time; no longer than a phone.

That said, it is all plastic except for the quaint wooden-looking roller and the motor (I assume.) I have no idea how long it will last long-term. Months? Years? I don't think I'll get rid of my 1962 Hoover "beats as it sweeps as it cleans" vacuum just yet.

review.user_review_title: It made me fall in love with my Marantz 2275 all over again.
review.user_review:
I'll give Onkyo credit for getting anything halfway decent sounding and simple to operate out there for $200 or less. And, I'll even say that the sound coming out of this little thing was clear and detailed, but something was just missing.

I couldn't figure it out, so I decided to have a "battle of the stereos" between this unit and my old 36lb 1973 Marantz 2275 that I bought used for about $180 about ten years ago. Well, that was quite an eye, or should I say ear, opener.

I even discovered that I could play an MP3 player through the Marantz unit simply by attaching it to the Aux input with a 3.5mm to RCA splitter adapter cable. I just had to turn the volume up more to compensate for the lower level input from the MP3 player. That discovery was made while doing the MP3 player comparison.

I still can't find the exact vocabulary to describe the difference, but all the detail I heard on the Onkyo unit was there on the Marantz, but the Marantz seems to have a "soul" -- for lack of a better word -- that this little Onkyo doesn't, even though this Onkyo unit is rated at 40W per channel and should have had more than enough power to drive the little speakers in my office. And, I can't even give myself credit for the "soul" analogy because I got that idea from someone who reviewd a low-end Sony two channel receiver. At least now I get what a "zombie receiver" sounds like. Everything is there but something ain't quite right. It's missing a personality.

So, Onkyo is going back right after I listen to it one more time and try to put words around what I'm hearing, or not hearing.

OK, so as best as I can describe, the unit sounded like it was heavy on the bass and treble and missing something in the midrange. Perhaps it is optimized to produce the kind of music popular today, that thumping bass and techno stuff at the high end. Who knows, I just know I didn't want a long term relationship with this, but the bang for the buck certainly is there, and it's a step up from the boom box if you invest in some nice speakers.

description: From the Manufacturer
From the Manufacturer
Onkyo's TX-8255 A/V Stereo Receiver: Getting Back to the Basics for the Sake of Audio Quality

While new technologies come and go, the fundamentals of competent receiver design remain constant. It is best to think of it in simple terms: a power supply, an input stage, a driver stage, and an output stage that all combine to amplify signals without any loss in quality. The current that actually drives the loudspeakers comes from a power source via the receiver's power supply. You can never underestimate the importance of the power supply, and all other audio processing functions cannot rule over good solid amplification. This is the direction Onkyo has taken with the TX-8255. Built for those people who value the benefits of time-proven amplification design, the TX-8255 takes core Onkyo technology--and an array of features you'll actually use--to bring you a no-nonsense stereo receiver that will deliver audio and radio signals with agreeable quality.
Superb Design
The TX-8255 includes Onkyo's exclusive Wide Range Amplifier Technology

With its continued excellence in sound reproduction, Onkyo has once again created a versatile stereo receiver for the music lover in you. The TX-8255 stereo receiver offers superb functionality and dual-room capability that will be hard to match. Onkyo exclusives like Wide Range Amplifier Technology (WRAT), discrete output stage circuitry, massive power transformer, and heavy-duty extruded heat sink offer the cleanest signal on the market. Most of the receiver's audio processing is handled automatically, with little intervention on your part. However, it is so advanced; its discrete output reproduces music with unmatched sonic clarity and dynamic power.  This receiver features a high-end design approach encompassing everything from its massive power transformer design and high-current, low-impedance drive to discrete output circuitry and minimal use of negative feedback. This enables the receiver to combine tighter bass, superb transient response and enhanced presence at any volume level. Remote Interactive (RI) capability enables you to simply connect your iPod to your receiver through Onkyo's RI Dock option for the iPod (DS-A2). Your iPod effectively becomes another Onkyo component flowing through the TX-8255.
In a Nutshell

The TX-8255 is a 2 x 50W (@ 8 ohms) stereo receiver capable of delivering breathtaking stereo sound. It features 5-sets of audio inputs, 2-sets of audio outputs, individual treble, bass, and balance controls, Remote Interactive (RI) port, A/B speaker switching, banana plug speaker posts, and an AM/FM tuner. Because of the high efficiency of its design, this powerful receiver produces exceptional sound quality, and clarity in every audible detail. With speaker A/B selectors and dedicated speaker terminals, this receiver offers the capability to send audio to a second room. In addition, the built-in IR port enables multi-room distribution with optional control systems.

review.user_review_title: It's an OK Monocular.  Attachment to phone is either too lose or too tight.
review.user_review:
[[VIDEOID:63180a019abc5532e616da23ee4e999c]] As a monocular this one works fine. But it comes with a phone attachment, and that's where to me it fall short a bit. The piece of the phone adapter that fits over the eyepiece is hard to get on tight enough to not move or fall off when I start shooting pictures or video on my phone, and if I put it on very tight, then it is hard to get off the monocular without feeling like I'm about to break the eyepiece of the monocular.

The phone adapter does have a place to screw it to a tripod, and I think that's the best use, a stationary phone attached to a stationary monocular either shooting pictures or videos of something at a distance.

Also, I have an LG V20 phone, and it requires the absolute limit of the width of the phone adapter to attach my phone to the monocular. My phone is 3 and 1/8 inches wide, protective case included. Getting my phone out of the adapter was difficult.

All in all, using a phone with the monocular using the included phone adapter was a hassle, but with trial and error I got better and better at it.

I tried this monocular outside at night, and I didn't notice anything special about it's night time low light capability. I just saw the same things at night only bigger. This is not some sort of night vision device like the military uses or one sees in the movies. There is no internal power supply to amplify light at night. It just reproduces what you see at night only closer, like I imagine any binocular or monocular would.

review.user_review_title: Spend a little more and hear a lot more!!
review.user_review:
Why oh why didn't I buy these a long time ago? These are by far the best headphones I've ever listened to, and what's really great is that they don't cost a whole lot more than a typical set of headphones that you'd wear while doing computer work. On just about every one of my CDs I hear something that I simply was unable to hear on cheaper headphones. And, no long term listening fatigue.

The only downside is that I'm continually tempted to crank up the volume because they sound so good, but that isn't the best for one's hearing in the long run, and besides, I can hear a lot of detail at low volume so cranking it up isn't necessary.

So, skip a latte or two, pay a little extra, and get twice as much out of every CD you've got!

review.user_review_title: Very nice to my monitor, and doesn't degrade display quality.
review.user_review:
Boy am I glad I bought this! You see, I've got two computers on my desk, and two monitors: one for the desk and one for the treadmill. So, I bought this so I could run two monitors into one cable that goes to an amplified VGA splitter that powers both monitors. I wanted to be able to switch both monitors simultaneously between both computers.

Well, I purchased this switch based on the reviews and it works great. My desk monitor is an old really big CRT, and when it switches between computers it doesn't go through the painful sounding "switch off and back on" click that used to happen with an older KVM switch. With this thing, the CRT just blinks from one computer to the other. This is an excellent product and to me certainly worth paying extra for, and just may extend the life of my old monitor too.

review.user_review:
[[VIDEOID:59f2fe2f220904eb7ec0ca207ea3938c]] I love cheap watches. I probably have about ten of them. Most are CASIO watches because they are inexpensive, practical, easy to read and easy to use.

But this watch flat out amazed me. I hope it lasts a long time. I prefer the small watch look to the large "wear a cookie on your wrist" look, but I am sure I'll be wearing this watch proudly in the future.

It is thin, thankfully, but it feels heaver than I expected. It has a real quality feel to it.

The setting buttons are large and clearly labeled, and the instructions are clear. I had this watch set to the correct date and time very quickly.

At first I was disappointed that the display was so much dimmer than the pictures used to market the watch, but the I walked out into the sun and the watch display numbers and letters became reflective, and actually very easy to read, and they looked like the pictures. Simply brilliant.

So, I still love my CASIO collection, but this will be my first choice going forward when I just want to give the CASIO look a rest and wear something different. I suspect there are many "golden hours" in my future.

review.user_review:
First of all you have to be OK with shelf storable tortillas. If you prefer refrigerator case, or breaking the lard out and making your own, you are not going to like these edible bowls. As it is, I am often surprised by how good something built for longevity can be, so it isn't too bad. In fact, I served my kids lamb tacos in these tonight and while they hated the meat, they had nothing bad to say about the delivery mechanism.

So once you get past the tortillas, you get to the shape, and it does an excellent job of keeping taco drippings from dribbling onto your shirt or floor. I've never been a good burrito wrapper, and this takes all the skill out. Somebody ought to make a press that makes these from fresh tortillas.

So, if you need something to keep in your pantry for Taco Tuesday, you could do worse, and messier than this product.

review.user_review:
For many years, we‚Äôve used a Panasonic rice cooker, which served us well until the latch failed, and it being so old I couldn‚Äôt find a replacement part. So, I was happy to take delivery of this cooker.

I‚Äôm also happy there is no latch to fail, the lid is a separate piece, and the whole device seems sturdy in general.

My wife likes to cook rice outdoors to avoid steaming up the house, so even in the recent wintery weather, she will take this outdoors to make rice. And, even in those extreme conditions of cold and dry ambient air, it makes nice fluffy rice.

Controls are simple, as they should be.

I‚Äôm not sure what the nonstick surface is, we have parakeets in the house and overheated Teflon and birds are a bad mix, still a well designed rice cooker should never overheat, and as I said, my wife usually uses it in the open air.

review.user_review:
There's a lot more in a Lightning cable that stretches of soldered copper wiring. The little microchips in one of these require both certification from Apple to guarantee it'll continue to work after every OS update, and add to the cost. So it is good Amazon took the trouble to certify cables in different lengths for the case when an Apple original cable isn't quite right. So yes, if you have a need for a small cable (maybe to keep in your computer case for emergencies), then this will work fine with caveats.

The Lightning end of this cable has a bulky head. It just barely snaps into my Belkin iPhone 5 case and does not fit through the opening of my wife's iPhone 5s case. Presumably this bulk was needed for Amazon to fit their chipset into the cable, but an Apple charging cable has a much narrower end.

Also, 4 inches is really really short for a cable; be sure this is the size you want.

Finally, and this might seem overly picky but it was too hard getting the plastic wrappers off the ends of this thing. They don't have the typical quick release covering I'd expect with an expensive cable.

review.user_review_title: Beautiful Clarity, Don't Get it for Bluetooth
review.user_review:
I have gone through many speakers and speaker systems over the last few years, but this little bookshelf stereo system stands out in terms of lovely transparency of sound; it deserves the label high fidelity. For many, a standalone CD system might seem archaic, but the old fashioned CD is a good match in terms of sound quality in contrast to the over compressed junk we often keep on our portable devices.

I'm also pleased to get a nice connection for my iOS devices via the front face USB port. With my iPhone 5's Lightning charging cable, the system showed up as a dock connector and I was able to play music, with excellent quality, while charging. FM reception is surprisingly good using only the included indoor antenna wire, better than I've ever gotten in my home.

What wasn't excellent, in fact was atrocious, was connecting via Bluetooth. Lots of pops and drop outs even when only 8 feet away, nothing comparable to the direct wired connection or an Airplay WiFi connection on another device. Of course, this may well be a problem with Apple's Bluetooth implementation and you may have better luck with another vendor. [Update: the sound is fine with a Kindle Fire HD over Bluetooth, although I'm hearing or imagining a slight loss of quality due to the necessary data compression. So it might be an Apple only problem.]

Setup was quick, although I'd have preferred another foot of stereo cable. The remote is overly complicated, with many small hard to distinguish buttons, not something usable in the dark. It seems like the speakers have to be brought away from the wall for the best sound, a half foot or so of air makes a noticeable difference. One issue is needing an outgas period; when I first installed this stereo, there was a noticeable odor from outgassing when the components warmed up, especially when I was charging my iPad; this went away after a few weeks of occasional use, but it was mildly unpleasant, and I almost dropped the system's rating by a star because of it. Still you should plan to run the stereo unattended in a well ventilated room for a while to let it sort out.

In general, an auditory delight. Highly recommended if it fits your budget.

description: Product Description

For a stylish and modern personal audio solution, take a closer look at our CS-355. This mini system looks and sounds great, and boasts some handy technology to cue your tunes with the minimum of fuss. Built-in Bluetooth allows wireless streaming from smart phone, tablet, or personal computer. Plug in an iPod, iPhone, or iPad to the front-panel USB port and use the system remote for track selection and playback. Cutting no corners, the system includes a front-loading drawer-type CD player - no more scratched discs - and an FM/AM tuner with 30-station preset memory. Now that there's no shortage of music to play, you need a system that can handle it. Two big 3 15/16-Inch (10 cm) cone woofers drive a deep, clear mid-range, while a pair of balanced-dome tweeters pick out and enhance the details. The rounded cabinets have subtly angled sides to pr event internal standing waves and the boomy sound that can result. Much of the Colibrino's appeal lies in its understated design and tasteful finish. Available in black, white, or red, the system will enhance the ambience of your living space and help y ou to discover the hidden depths in your music collection.

Stylish Hi-Fi System Lets You Play It Your Way

For a stylish and modern personal audio solution, take a closer look at our CS-355 Colibrino. This mini system looks and sounds great, and boasts some handy technology to cue your tunes with the minimum of fuss.
Built-in Bluetooth allows wireless streaming from smart phone, tablet, or personal computer

. Plug in an iPod, iPhone, or iPad to the front-panel USB port and use the system remote for track selection and playback. Cutting no corners, the system includes a front-loading drawer-type CD player- no more scratched discs- and an FM tuner with 30-station preset memory. Now that there's no shortage of music to play, you need a system that can handle it. And this small, stylish system is it.   Much of the Colibrino's appeal lies in its understated design and tasteful finish. Available in black, red or white, the system will enhance the ambience of your living space and inspire you to discover the hidden depths in your music collection.
Bluetooth Streaming at the Touch of a Button

Whether you're an iPhone or iPad user, an Android fan, or an owner of a compatible mobile device with Bluetooth capability, streaming music through your CS-355 couldn't be easier. Just pair the devices and select the track, playlist, or album of your choice. With aptX
¬Æ
codec and the improved data transfer capabilities of Bluetooth 2.1 +EDR, you'll be delighted with remarkably clear and faithful sound reproduction.
Front Panel USB Port for iPod/iPhone/iPad and Flash Memory Devices

The cleanest your iPod music can sound! The CS-355's front-panel USB port lets you play MP3 and AAC stored in an iPod/iPhone, and MP3, WMA, AAC, and FLAC audio files stored on a flash-memory device, using the system's own remote for track selection and playback. Your music will also sound much cleaner and clearer, as the audio signal is transported in digital rather than analog form through the direct digital connection. Digital Music Files Sound GREAT.
Digital Music, Digital Amp: Bold, Big Sound

The CS-355 employs digital amplifier circuitry to extract a noise-free signal from digital audio sources. Whether it's on a standard CD or in a compressed MP3 file stored on CD or USB, or music streamed from your mobile device, your music will sound clearer than ever. Because digital amplifiers can convert power with very high levels of efficiency, much less energy is wasted as heat, and the amplifier design can be smaller and lighter. Hence, the CS-355 can provide room-filling power that belies its modest size.
Optimal Speakers & Active Bass Control

Two big 10 cm cone woofers drive a deep, clear mid-range, while a pair of balanced-dome tweeters pick out and enhance the details. The rounded cabinets have subtly angled sides to prevent internal standing waves and the boomy sound that can result.   At quiet volume levels, human hearing becomes less sensitive to sounds at the upper and lower ends of the audible spectrum. To compensate for the perceived loss of bass sounds at lower volumes, the CS-355 incorporates Onkyo's proprietary Active Bass Control. This function maintains an optimal balance of low-frequency sounds by making automatic, real-time adjustments in line with the playback volume. You enjoy smooth and natural-sounding bass at any volume level.

review.user_review:
My aging Thunderbolt Display started making an annoying chirping sound while connected to a computer. And then it stopped working entirely. I diagnosed this as a dead power supply because of the chirp, and ordered this power supply as well as the requisite iFixit suction cups. Even though the Display is well passed being obsolete, it's still my favorite monitor, and it seemed a reasonable cost to bring it back to life. I also took the opportunity to replace the charging/Thunderbolt cable as that had failed too. Obviously, the charging portion isn't useful for my 2018 MacBook Pro, and the Thunderbolt connector needs an adaptor. Maybe somebody should make a USB-C replacement cable...

Anyway, despite some accidental rough handling of the cable connecting the motherboard to the LCD panel, everything worked well. The new power supply is quiet. It was capable of both powering the display, and also a 2011 MacBook Air, I connected to the MagSafe. I'd recommend it to anyone trying to get a few more years out of this excellent monitor.

review.user_review_title: Make Sure You Get the Right POE Switch
review.user_review:
First make sure your device uses the correct POE standard. I've a little camera in my office that has a POE adaptor, but it didn't work when I plugged the other end of the Ethernet cable to this device. Wrong standard. Not anybody's fault; just make sure your device is compatible.

When used as a normal Ethernet switch; it works fine. I put it in the AV stack in the guest room, and it does a capable job streaming video. All metal construction and plenty of capacity for heat dissipation make me feel friendly to it.

description: Product Description
Verso Prologue Red Cover for Kindle, Kindle Touch and Kindle Paperwhite
By LightWedge

It‚Äôs rare for a book to become a classic overnight. Just ask Henry David Thoreau. He only managed to publish two books during his lifetime, both of which were regarded as strange and weird. He even paid for the printing of one out of his own pocket, a 1,000-volume run of
A Week on the Concord and Merrimack Rivers
. Fewer than 300 sold before his death.
Not until the 1920s did Thoreau earn his due, and today, it‚Äôs difficult to find a high school graduate that wasn‚Äôt required pick up his ode to natural living,
Walden

Like the literary palate of the reading public, the Verso Prologue e-reader might also require a short breaking-in period. But that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs hand constructed of super-durable, high-quality materials. Namely, animal-friendly ‚Äúleather‚Äù on the outside. Don‚Äôt worry; you won‚Äôt miss the cow. You will quite pleased with the classy look, supple feel, and impressive durability of the Prologue. A hand distressed finish, carefully embossed embellishments, and antique foil stampings add sophistication.

On the inside, advanced microfiber engineered for maximum softness cradles your device when closed while patent-pending silicone-enhanced corner elastic straps hold it in place‚Äîa grip guaranteed for the lifetime of your device.

description: Product Description

The Yamaha YDS-12 Universal iPod Dock: "Works With iPhone"- Certified Convenience. There are several iPod docking stations on the market, but few are as convenient as the YDS-12, which is both "Made for iPod" and is now "Works with iPhone"-certified, unlike previous dock models. Connection is easy--simply plug the dock into a compatible Yamaha receiver's rear-panel port. Once connected, the dock not only charges your iPod and plays your favorite playlists through the receiver's stereo or surround speakers, but it also shows iPod images and movies through an attached monitor or HDTV. It's the perfect solution for people who regularly download TV shows from iTunes but want to watch them on a big TV or display. The rest of the time, you can rock out to all your favorite songs with style. And it works seamlessly with your existing Yamaha home theater system--the YDS-12 lets you operate your iPod from across the room using the receiver's remote control and onscreen display, so you don't need to rise off the sofa each time you want to change selections. Connecting your iPod to a home theater system has never been easier or sounded so good.
From the Manufacturer
The YDS-12 is "Works with iPhone" certified
The Yamaha YDS-12 Universal iPod Dock: "Works With iPhone"-Certified Convenience

There are several iPod docking stations on the market, but few are as convenient as the YDS-12, which is both "Made for iPod" and is now "Works with iPhone"-certified, unlike previous dock models. Connection is easy--simply plug the dock into a compatible Yamaha receiver's rear-panel port.  Once connected, the dock not only charges your iPod and plays your favorite playlists through the receiver's stereo or surround speakers, but it also shows iPod images and movies through an attached monitor or HDTV. It's the perfect solution for people who regularly download TV shows from iTunes but want to watch them on a big TV or display. The rest of the time, you can rock out to all your favorite songs with style. And it works seamlessly with your existing Yamaha home theater system--the YDS-12 lets you operate your iPod from across the room using the receiver's remote control and onscreen display, so you don't need to rise off the sofa each time you want to change selections. Connecting your iPod to a home theater system has never been easier or sounded so good.   The YDS-12 has two modes - "A Mode" is "Works with iPhone" certified and works with the receivers listed here: RX-A3010/3000, RX-A2010/2000, RX-A1010/1000, RX-A810/800, RX-A710/700, RX-V871/867, RX-V671/667, RX-V571/567, RX-V471/467, RX-V371/367.   The second mode on the YDS-12, "Mode B," works with older line of the RX-V series. While in "Mode B," the YDS-12 works with: iPod touch, iPod nano, iPod Click Wheel (including iPod classic), and iPod mini.

description: Product Description

Mouth-watering coffee squares made of ground bean, a dash of sugar, cocoa butter and the caffeine of a single espresso. 100% organic and free trade, il Morso coffee confections scintillate your taste buds while providing a little bump when you want it most. Coffee anywhere and anytime? Yeah, It's time to break up with your barista.
From the Manufacturer
SMARTER THAN THE AVERAGE PICK-ME-UP.

Each il Morso square is organic and fair trade, has 25 calories or less, and delivers up to 18mg of caffeine to get through whatever's holding you back. With only 1.5g fat and 1g of sugar, it beats most any other snack that didn't grow on a tree. You'll feel satisfied, alert, smart, and never sorry.

Healthy

Satisfying
Read our reviews--people love them! Mouth-watering and yet not sinful, il Morso will become a moment to look forward to each day. Rest, indulge and refresh:you'll never leave home without some.
Effective
Whether you're looking for pick-me-up, a sweet treat, or both, il Morso delivers a palatable jolt of caffeine in a delectable bite-sized square. What you see is what you want, and then some!

About the Startup
Describe your product in 3 words.
The Coffee Shortcut
How did you come up with the idea for this product?
A pleasure-seeking trip to Italy led to a magical moment of inspiration.
What makes your product special?
Organic and energy-boosting anything tasting this good without all the sugar is some kind of magic.
What has been the best part of your startup experience?
Tasting the dozens of test batches has been a blast! And working with great people.

review.user_review_title: Perfect family mac and cheese or rice pot.
review.user_review:
This has become our go-to grain pot. It's perfect for a family's serving of rice - up to 2.5 or 3 dry cups are comfortable in this pot. It's also the perfect size for morning oatmeal, a box of mac & cheese, or cook-and-serve sides like rice in a box or a pasta salad.
The non-stick bottom is really strong and we've tried to be really careful about only using wooden spoons in here not forks or spoons which kill the non-stick surface normally.
I recommend this size pot for every kitchen and it has worked out beautifully for us over the last few months with few scratches.

review.user_review_title: No bells and whistles can opener. Perfect!
review.user_review: I'm almost embarrassed to say that I've used a swiss army knife in my kitchen drawer as my can opener for year. It's just so reliable and easy to use for me. This can opener is a basic opener, with no bells or whistles - perfect for my kitchen. The only thing I find that I really do not like about it, is the smooth plastic it has everywhere. Most of the OXO stuff I have in the kitchen has some sort of grip or rubberized handle to it to help prevent slipping. When I'm cooking or needing a can opened, invariably I have greasy or wet hands, and this handle isn't the best for it. Other than the one issue, I really love this guy and he might end up kicking the swiss army knife out of the 'tool' drawer and into the 'junk' drawer.

review.user_review_title: Great for classrooms and dad jokes
review.user_review:
I am using these in our homeschooling for grouping and counting activities for my younger kiddo and they are so much fun. She really loves interacting and pretending with these and they're more fun than regular, square counting blocks.
Beyond the classroom, my husband actually grabbed a handful of these to take to work for office jokes. I'm not really sure what that is about, but he reports to having great fun at work leaving these on people's desks and joking about working for peanuts.
Overall, these are exactly as advertised. There's a few things you could do with them, but they're mostly novel items that are a fun way to have a laugh or add some fun to a boring lesson.

review.user_review:
I use this in the back of my computer to allow me to plug in more than one USB C peripheral device at a time. I was using adapters to plug in individual things, but this allows me to just have them all plugged into the same port, more or less, and saves my other USB slots for thumb drives and the like.
This has worked really well, it just hangs out back there and I dust it when I clean my computer tower. I haven't had any connectivity issues and it hasn't fallen out, even when loaded with devices.
This could also be a good item for traveling, if you have limited ports on your computer or you and a travel buddy want to share charging docks, etc.
Overall, a great item to have in your hardware box and good to have for consolidating plugins to your computer.

review.user_review_title: Good Alarm Clock, Bad User Interface
review.user_review:
If you can tame this beast of an alarm clock, you'll have a good one. The owner's manual is crap-tastic, and does not tell you about all of the features, so it does take some figuring out on your own. It should not be complicated to set up an alarm clock, and that is exactly what this product has done.

The docking port is great, and has a hinged door that pops up and allows you to wedge your device between it and the docking port.

The clock will auto-set when you plug it in. It may have the wrong time zone, or it may be on daylight savings time. There is a "DST" (daylight savings) button on the left pad that will flip you an hour forward or backwards. Push it and your time may be right. If not, to set the time and date, simply hold down the "SET" button until the hour blinks, and use the "FORWARD" and "NEXT" buttons on the right pad to scroll through the options. You can push the "SNOOZE" button to quickly exit this mode.

Above the "SNOOZE" button there are 4 smaller buttons. Two of these are for the different alarm clock settings, and the other two are for an optional mood light (?) and the other for the nature sounds. To use the nature sounds, the radio has to be on and then you press the small leaf button to scroll through the sounds.

The alarms can be set by holding the button until the time blinks, you can select the days of the week and time, as well as the sound to wake to, radio, aux, or nature sound.

The "SNOOZE" button acts as a dimmer for the display, which can be bright. It can be totally turned off by this method. Great if you're a clock watcher.

There's a neat switch located on the bottom that allows the clock to be set on a one time basis only. Meaning that each time the alarm goes off, you have to reset it each time by indicating the time and day of week all over again. It's the 'hotel' switch.

The nature sounds are a bit cheesy, as is the mood lighting. For the price, they could have gotten better nature sounds and speakers - no reason not to. This, the lousy controls, and the sloppy manual contributes to three stars for the product.

review.user_review_title: Quit working 3 days in - Warranty requires YOU to pay to send it in for repair.
review.user_review:
I really want to like this product, but I just can't bring myself to that.

When I received this, things worked perfectly fine. Everything worked right out of the box, it was amazing.

Then about three days in, it just wouldn't turn on.

A call to customer service resulted in me receiving half of a power cable. I was told my options were only to mail it in. AT MY COST. I asked if they would provide me with a new power cable so I can rule that out before I spend nearly $120 mailing it back to them. They agreed and somehow I failed to realize that the power cable is only the part of the cable that goes from the wall to that box. The part that goes from the box to the computer is the adaptor. So I had to call back for that. And wait for that.

Spoiler alert: It didn't fix the problem.

So now I'm not able to mail it back in at this time, so I'm sitting with a computer that I really want to work, but doesn't. And I'm stuck paying to ship it to them to fix. I can't really be upset about this because I did receive this to try out for free, but I can't imagine how livid I would be if I had just shelled out $700 to then look at another $100 bill, at least, to ship it back to them to fix.

Giving this three stars because while my husband likes it, he's not thrilled with it by any means. "Too many seams" is what I was told. I can see that. The shirt is just a plain black, lightweight athletic shirt - it feels a bit polyester-ish, but is nice for working out. The details of the seams are how the shirt is styled and it does seem over-the-top for a workout shirt.
Fits fine, close to the body without being tight - just what you want for being active outside.

review.user_review:
This brand is a bit on the thicker side when it comes to pants/leggings for kids. My daughter LIVES in this kind of pants - under dresses, under shorts, with shirts, you name it!
I love these pants because they are just slightly thicker than some other brands and will last through a few scuffs of the knees before I have to start adding patches or sewing up holes. They wash well, but do tend to fade in the knees if you have a kid, like mine, who always sits on their legs and is just super active on the ground doing stuff all the time.
Overall, we love these pants for the design, the style, and the overall wearability and longevity of them!

review.user_review_title: Good summer shorts, relaxed fit, good construction
review.user_review:
These are great board shorts that fit true to size. The shorts are plaid but aren't over the top which is what my husband likes - something above plain, but not a crowd standout. These seemed to be constructed well, but the fabric did not match as well as the model's shorts do. Just something to consider. The nice thing about these is that they do not turn transparent in the water or get overly clingy like some shorts do. The fabric is thick and helps prevent that, and there is sufficient lining to help prevent things from getting transparent as it gets wet.
Overall, these are a great price point for summer shorts that could last a few years if you wanted. The design is laid back and construction is sturdy.

review.user_review:
I was really scared to try this even though many people seem to like it. I love meat, but my wife is a pescatarian (someone who chooses to eat a vegetarian diet, but who also eats fish) hasn't touched meat for over 20 years now, and is grossed out by real meat. Having tried all the old type veggie burgers on the market, while i am trying to lessen eating red meat, decided to try it.

Taking it out of the package a bit of a weird smell but it was very fresh so i cooked it. The more I fried it, the more it started resembling a real beef burger. At the end, all dressed up and ready to eat, it was amazing! You must actually try one to believe it. Just put all your fears aside, and judge for your self.

I am most definitely sold. Will buy again. Just a bit difficult to find them in stores or online.

description: At Beyond Meat we believe there is a better way to feed our future and that the positive choices we all make, no matter how small, can have a great impact on our personal health and the health of our planet. By shifting from animal to plant-based meat, we can positively impact four growing global issues: human health, climate change, constraints on natural resources, and animal welfare.Our process is simple. We source the building blocks of meat directly from plants. Using heating, cooling and pressure, we create the fibrous texture of meat from plant-based proteins. Then, we mix in fats, minerals, fruit and vegetable-based colors, natural flavors, and carbohydrates to replicate the appearance, juiciness, and flavor of meat. The result? Uncompromisingly delicious plant-based burgers, sausage, and beef, no sacrifice required.Beyond Meat products offer greater or equal protein levels than their animal counterparts, no cholesterol, less saturated fat, and no antibiotics or hormones.

description: Our story begins in 1919. That‚Äôs when the world was introduced to what you now know as the Hostess CupCake. It‚Äôs perhaps the first and most significant moment in the history of snack cakes. Just ask your great grandpappy. He was there. Six years later, Continental Baking wanted to add a line of cakes to sell alongside a hot little item they were making called Wonder bread. This new line of sweet treats became known as Hostess. And a brand was born. Continental hit the sponge cake gold mine in 1930 when Jimmy Dewar invented Twinkies. At two for a nickel, popularity skyrocketed and it soon became Hostess‚Äô best-selling snack cake. Twinkies have since become an American icon. Half a billion are made each year. That‚Äôs a lot of creme filling! In the summer of 1995, Interstate Bakeries Corporation acquired Continental Baking Company. This made Interstate the largest wholesale baker of fresh delivered bread and cake in the United States. In 2009, Interstate changed its name to Hostess Brands, Inc., to better reflect our beloved brands. Fast forward to present day, and we‚Äôre continuing to turn everyday moments into small celebrations with a variety of new and classic treats like Ding Dongs, Ho Hos and Donettes, just to name a few. You can visit our products page to learn more about our delectable line of snack cake deliciousness. But please don‚Äôt ask us to pick a favorite.

description: The Timex Men's T5K086 1440 Sports Digital Black/Blue Resin Strap Watch offers a crisp, digital dial with a 24-hour chronograph and a daily alarm. The light-weight and durable resin construction make it ideal for your daily running, swimming, or jogging routine. Plus, it offers a two time zone setting that makes traveling easy. An Indiglo night-light features allows you to tell time even in low-light conditions while a strong acrylic window offers protection from scratches and nicks. The watch is equipped with a reliable quartz movement and is water-resistant to 165 feet (50 meters).

Push yourself to victory with this sporty Timex watch. Its 14-millimeter-wide water-proof resin band joins to a 41-millimeter-in-diameter resin case. The athletic resin bezel frames an acrylic dial window. Indiglo technology lights up the dial's digital display at the push of a button. This watch is full of handy features such as day and date display, stopwatch and alarm. Water resistant to 165 feet, this watch was made for your active lifestyle.
Casio

With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.

Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.

review.user_review_title: Interesting tart guava flavor infused applesauce.
review.user_review:
This was more tart than most granny smith apples I've had. My wife didn't like the cup I gave her because she doesn't like sour things. Dijon mustard, pickles, things with an acidic bite she just doesn't go for. But me on the other hand I rather enjoyed the sharp tartness of the applesauce.

The texture is the same as any applesauce and the guava does stand out against the granny smith apple base and the acidity. But I don't think I could have more than 2 cups of it at a time. It's really strong in flavor and like sour candy you love the sour kick but you can keep eating it. I finished my cup and what was left of my wife's and that was enough.

Overall a nice product if you enjoy sour/tart sweets or if your kids do. I've been a fan of guava and keep some nectar and candies around so if you're a fan like I am you shouldn't be disappointed with the apple/guava pairing.

review.user_review_title: Not high end sweet drinking Matcha, but definitely a good blending/baking Matcha.
review.user_review:
A lot of the Matchas I've been trying on Amazon are the basic ground green tea powder you get. This is a smooth powder that mixes and blends well, but it is still a rather bitter tea if you are drinking it and eating it in baked goods or in blended drinks it will be bitter unless you are either accustomed to the flavor or add some syrup or sugar to balance the slight dry bitterness.

This is also not a green as pictured which I hate marketing teams keep touching up the photos on Matcha. This is a dull green tea powder so your green tea ice cream, shakes or cookies won't be a vibrant green.

review.user_review_title: Tasty kinchi flavor with a mild to medium heat.
review.user_review:
The instructions are pretty simple and easy to follow. Just open the lid and pour the contents of the soup packet over the noodles and pour boiling water up to the indented fill line then recover with the lid and wait 3-4 minutes.

The noodles are like the rice vermicelli you'd get in an order of meifun at your Chinese take out. So very thin and they cook really fast, but they don't go super mushy if you wait too long after adding the water. One thing I really like is that they cut the noodles so there aren't any super long strands and you can eat with chopsticks pretty easily without making a mess and splattering all over yourself.

The scent smells like kimchi. Like when I open my jar of kimchi. The flavor though isn't as sour as straight kimchi and it has some heat but it's milder than the kimchi I buy. So it's enough to notice and maybe even get your nose going but not enough to interfere with the flavor or enjoyment of the soup.

The only major detractors for me are the salt level and the price. The portion is good for a meal and is only 322 calories. So it is not bad at all for calorie conscious diets. But it is 83% of your daily sodium which I think they could probably do with less since the flavor does have a pretty strong salt level so they could probably get away with reducing that. Though I've had instant noodles that were 200%+ of daily sodium for udon. So it's better than some options and about 200 calories less then many ramen and instant noodle offerings. But at $3 a piece it is rather high by comparison and where I can't give it 5 stars. Even premium noodles options like Paldo's BulJjajang with retort pouch sauce is still about $2.32 a pack. Now the difference may come from the fact you are not providing a container or vessel to cook your noodles in and you just need hot water you can get from most break rooms, so the convenience factor may increase the price. But that isn't an issue if you work from home so convenience isn't a priority for me when it comes to noodles.

So I definitely do enjoy these noodles and love the fact that they are a decent lunch option that is rather filling while not being some 900+ calorie fast food combo meal. All while offering a pretty decent flavor profile and heat that shouldn't be offensive to most eaters and letting you be hungry in time for a more reasonably sized dinner in the evening. I would say try to get them on subscribe or any sale or discount you can find because $18 for 6 is pricier than what would make my go to rotation I pick up from the asian markets.

review.user_review_title: Arrived freeze dried and packaged as listed.
review.user_review:
It's really going to come down to preparation so mileage is going to vary a lot for those that don't cook with this ingredient much. You can use hot water to reconstitute the slug, but hot water or boiling effects cooking and will put a scent int he air that some may not like. Personally I don't mind it but I'm also someone who finds it weird when people complain about cooking frozen dumplings in a microwave.

So I would recommend soaking them at least overnight, but as another reviewer tried, doing it the day before you wish to cook and giving them 2up 4 hours to soak and then cook helps keep the scent factor for cooking to a minimum and the slugs will be softer. But if you are going to marinade adjust and give them 2-8 hours in that soaking time not on top of it.

They are extremely light but fibrous like wood when dried. Best cooking approach I found once you are ready is low and slow. Usually you can go hot and fast and get tender with fresh proteins like this, conch, octopus and not get a chewy toughness or you keep going and stew it until it becomes soft again.

review.user_review_title: They work and last several days on end easily on the battery packs.
review.user_review:
The light are ok, the coloring is definitely a pastel Eastery vibe for the colored LEDs. They do work for Christmas and Holiday decor as well and the batteries last several days on end (a week strong so far and still going).

The big issues out of the box are the strings are just copper that is coated in a thing insulation and wound in a way that if you don't want to tangle the wires you have a lot of work ahead of you unwinding carefully, but the wires want to twist and kink themselves. I would recommend save your sanity and just pull them and kink them. It's not worth the headache of unwinding and trying to fight the almost suicidal nature of these wires. Kinking them didn't break any of my lights and spending 15 minutes to unwind one while battling a cat thinking I wanted to play and 10 seconds just gripping and pulling became a no brainer.

I wrapped some into mosaics to fill windows, took one outside and wrapped a small plum bush and took another and wrapped up my door wreath and the effect was quite nice for a holiday decor. Now another drawback though is only 2 have any variety in patterns and not 1 of them is that randomized fairy light twinkle. It's pretty much variations of either flashing or 2 colors on and 2 colors off and transitions between. There are no times one LED of the same color will be on while another is off. So no real twinkle in the colored sets.

The remote strings have a more rugged gasket battery pack and rubber button which works better for outside where they could get wet. They aren't bad for the price, but they are pretty basic in features and programming and if you want a random twinkling effect I'd look at something else.

review.user_review_title: Great single room humidifier, super quiet operation.
review.user_review:
This is very quiet. It's quieter than the humidifier I had that boiled off the water and used steam. This creates some kind of vortex in the water when the top cover and spout is off so the everything moving is under the water keeping it really quiet in use. The level of noise is the water of trickling water like a small pet fountain that has no motor noise. So very quiet but what you hear is gentle and maybe even an enjoyable white noise to sleep by depending on your subjective taste.

It is a cooling mist that comes out since there is no heat used to create steam. So winter use this will likely keep a bedroom cooler so adjust the vents for heating to compensate. I enjoyed my steam unit because it kept my bedroom a little warmer, but it didn't last 2 years so I'm hoping to get more out of this unit. So far I'd say it's definitely recommended for the $38.99 price point.

review.user_review_title: Good for small jobs like a car floor, but does get messy and needs to be cleaned.
review.user_review:
I remember the original dust buster we had when I was a kid and it worked well for small jobs and wasn't messy that I remembered. So I wanted to give this a try for cleaning my car floor mats and the bathroom places under the sink and corners.

The suction is decent, but it goes pretty fast as the filter clogs with whatever you are vacuuming up. You need to dump out the major stuff and shake out the filter to keep going. But I find with my cat's litter getting tracked all over and in corners and places I don't normally vacuum, this gets dirty and gritty super fast with the litter. The big drawback is putting it back together with the granules of litter still there is crunches and leaks a little. So I have to rinse out the plastic housing and dry it with a paper towel and it's good to go. Just more work than I was expecting for what essentially is the amount of time to vacuum off the central air intake plates.

Comes with additional cleaning attachments and an extra filter.

So for small quick jobs this does great and the battery is still at 50% after several days of minor jobs here and there vacuuming entry mats, car mats and bathroom mats. So battery seems to be more than enough for any job and way better than the dust buster. Just wish there was a neater way to clean it.
