review.user_review_title: Works ok, but needs multiple applications or a timer setup on hold.
review.user_review:
Ozone generators are a good way to eliminate odors and they are fine to use, but you don't want to be in the area they are being used and the area needs to be sealed off from people and pets. Ozone can cause respiratory issues and major health problems. This product does come with a lot of warning and does tell you not to breath the ozone or be in the same room. But it didn't cover the results and health effects. So I recommend do research on how to use these before buying and plugging one in.

So when I was looking up how to use them I found many recommended 8-10 hours of use to eliminate odors in one go which this unit only has a 2 hour timer or a hold on position. Since you don't want to enter a room before the ozone dissipates resetting the 2 hour timer 4-5 times doesn't sound good. But I have timers for my grow lights so setting one for 8 hours in the afternoon and off for 16 hours so when I got up in the morning I could go to the basement and shutoff the generator while it wasn't getting power and it had several hours to dissipate. I just had to keep the doors to the basement closed so the cat couldn't go down to where the generator was.

Overall it wasn't hard to use and after reading up on how to use it and best practices it was pretty straight forward and I had a couple outlet timers so repurposing one wasn't hard. Now these can be used to remove odors from vehicles, appliances, bathrooms, utility rooms, you name it. The only stipulation is you can't be there after it is on and you have to wait after it's off to let the ozone break back down so you aren't breathing any in so you don't risk exposure. Extension cord, outlet timer and the ozone generator and you're set to run it for as long as you like up to 10 hours and then give it several hours before opening and retrieving the unit and using that space again.

review.user_review_title: Decent 128gb SD card for the price. Never gone wrong with PNY.
review.user_review:
PNY has been a brand in computing hardware and accessories I've used from RAM, Graphics cards to SD and SSD. It's always been reliable. It may not be the fastest, but it does it's job for a decent price and has a low failure rate in every product line I've tried.

I tried to do a basic real world data dump to get what an average write speed would be and it came out just under 26MB/s write speed which isn't super fast, but better than most of my current SD cards. So not bad.

review.user_review_title: It works, but it takes effort and it's not much better than the 802.11n adapter it was replacing.
review.user_review:
I have a 13 inch mid-2011 Macbook Air that I wanted to give better wifi to since my 500mbsp network is basically capped around 200mbps with the native 802.11n wifi in the laptop. So I gave this AC1200 usb adapter a try. It was bigger than I expected as it takes up almost as much space as half the laptop screen. So nothing low-profile here.

First the adapter is not plug an play and installing the drivers is doable for anyone tech savvy enough that they had to find a device driver online before. But for my Macbook I had to find the driver online and download it from what appeared to be the manufacturer's public google drive folder with other drivers. It took several minutes longer than the installation progressive bar indicated and made me think it locked up. So setup wasn't very straightforward or smooth.

There is a separate wifi icon for this adapter once installed and I needed to manually turn off the old adapter's connection and connect to my network with the new adapter. This was pretty straightforward and nothing surprising as far as connecting.

I ran some tests on speedtest dot net to compare the new usb adapter and the existing internal wifi and the internal bested out at just under 215mbps on my network which my other AC1200 laptops and AppleTV were testing around 570mbps on. The NETVIP AC1200 adapter averaged around 240mbps. It was always about 10-15% faster than the internal wifi adapter, so there was a consistent improvement. But it was still under half of what I was expecting.

So it works for wifi, it has a dock/usb dongle to connect to instead of carrying around a massive protrusion out of the side. But, it's not a quick install and setup and it just doesn't perform to the level expected of AC1200 speed capabilities and very very large. So right now at the time of review it's listing at $22.99 and has a 18% off coupon it's not an expensive usb option under $20 for a desktop that could use a stationary wifi adapter. But I would probably recommed spending the extra $10-20 for a more name brand option like netgear or belkin usb adapter without the antenna and large profile that would perform better.

review.user_review_title: Windows doesn't get it right with drivers, would be nice if they had a link to download.
review.user_review:
First couple attempts Windows 11 was just detecting it as a USB composite device and nothing would register it as a video capture card. Tried looking online but didn't find a driver for it it directly so just kept rolling the dice on uninstalling the device in Device Manager and unplugging and plugging it back in and swapping around USB 3.0 ports until it actually got the right drivers from Windows Update.

After that OBS detected it and it streamed pretty well, but you can't hot swap it as OBS loses track of the capture device and you have to update the settings and point to the "new" device it detected. That's an OBS thing not this device. I tried using it with VLC and it's options and setup for video capture were nowhere near as straight forward and I didn't feel like dealing with it since I don't actually use VLC for anything other than obscure video formats.

The manual does list minimum hardware requirements for desktop as i5-3400 + a NVidia GT630 ( I think they meant GTX630) but this worked for my AMD Phenom II 1090t x6 setup at 1080p just fine. I think that is for 4K requirements but AMD setups from a decade back seem to work. It is just limited to the resolutions of what your system can handle.

Overall a decent card does what it should and for a decent price. It's built fairly well and it so far it works with any HDMI source for streaming from games to other PCs so not bad for what it's going to be doing.

review.user_review_title: Pretty nice chain, but not quite as nice as the pictures.
review.user_review:
The chain looks nice and it doesn't leave any discoloration wearing it for long wears and overnight. It's much lighter than I expected it to be and the ends are crimped to attach to the chain which is different from the product photos so it is not as high of a quality chain as I was expecting.

There is a slight high pitch to the chain as it moves around that my 14k chains do not have so it lends to another giveaway that it is a plated material. It's not strongly pulled by my Neodymium magnets so not sure on the composition, but I would definitely recommend removing this for any MRI scans since it does attract slightly.

Overall easily a 3.5-4 star chain for the price point that looks good while wearing it.

review.user_review:
Lightweight and Non Teflon

I wanted to test this product because of the non-Teflon design and no PFOA, lead or cadmium. I also wanted to replace my older heavy duty Teflon Farberware pans and they have lasted about 7 years and still in good condition.

These pieces are kind of a unique pewter color, and the lightweight design is attractive. They are stated to be dishwasher safe. When cooking, you need to keep in mind that when using in an oven do not heat at temperatures above 350 digress. The bottom surface seems to be smooth but using on a glass top range the company recommends not sliding the pans. The company also says they are not responsible for scratched glass top ranges. We have a glass stove top so will have to be careful. I am not impressed with the lifetime warranty as it only covers defects in the product but not even normal wear. These pans are not a heavy gauge construction but instead lightweight.

Testing using medium heat on a glass stove top the heat was distributed quickly and evenly throughout the pan. Nice! After cooling, cleanup was easy just by hand washing.

Overall, I am not convinced this set will last a long time and the lifetime warranty doesn't satisfy me. However I do like the set for its even cooking.

review.user_review:
The set up on this camera is quick and simple. You need to get a mini SD card but you can still set the system up and later put one in. I downloaded the Cloudedge app and turned the camera on to set up. Cloudedge is an easy to set up application. Once it paired to my WiFi base, I let the camera just use my mobile data, but having your WiFi router connected gives better video and faster if you‚Äôre at home. I was hoping the Cloudedge motion detection settings worked better. It has 3 settings for the camera - high, med, and low. I couldn't find any difference in the low and med settings. If you like using the alert settings on your phone, the motion detection is always sending messages because motion is too sensitive even on the low setting.
The video quality is good on both infrared and color. I have mine connected at least 100ft from the WiFi and no dropouts. Overall the only issue is with motion detection and otherwise this is a recommended item in my view. Not having to deal with batteries in my opinion is also nice.

review.user_review:
Canon has 4 models in this class and the XA45 is the middle. One thing I like about this camera is the joystick is ocated on the right side under your thumb while holding the strap. This in my opinion makes menu surfing much faster than on the left side of the camera as some other brands. The output sound on this camera is of good quality using the built in stereo microphones located in the camera front of the XA45. Something to be careful of when connecting the camera to the HDMI out to a monitor with speakers is making sure you record far enough away so as not to get microphone feedback. If you‚Äôre using external input channel 1/2 XLR mics located on the handle you can adjust the recording levels and input sensitivity. If you use the 2ch 3.5mm stereo mic terminal you can adjust the recording levels for each channel but not the input sensitivity. Another nice feature built in this model is the 3G-SDI terminal to quickly transmit uncompressed video with timecode and audio for professionals that have mobile workstations and such. I should also mention you can‚Äôt you both the SDI terminal and HDMI at the same time. The slow and fast motion recording is fully adjustable in the menu for constant or variable speeds.

The camera has 2 card slots. I purchased 2 SDXC cards here on Amazon and wanted to test the dual recording feature built into the camera. You can record video separately on each card using the relay recording mode or you can set up in the menu and the camera will make a direct copy of each video take on each card in dual recording. Both features work flawlessly. SDHC cards are also compatible as long as you purchase class 10 with a
UHS speed of 3. I have not had one dropout or error using either of the cards even recording slow and fast motion with a 4k resolution 3840x2160. SD cards are also compatible as long as they have a class 6 and a UHS speed of 1. I did not test with SD cards and I wouldn‚Äôt advise using them because of their nature of slow speeds. Battery life on the XA45 battery that comes with the camera is just under 3 hours.

Overall I think this is a good camera if you plan to use if for filming weddings and your family/kids events and with a lot of fast motion. Colors are bright and crisp and faces with auto focus and/or face detection and tracking look okay. You can attach a field monitor for better viewing outdoors. I really like this camera and will be getting some accessories for it.

review.user_review_title: Good sized and very warm scarf

review.user_review_title: Pretty but has sharp protruding metal wire
review.user_review: At first glance these are pretty beaded bangle bracelets.  There are 2 matching beaded bracelets, each about 3/8‚Äù (1cm) in width.  The inner base band is some type of gold color alloy metal, and the beads are all affixed with gold color wire. While some of the beads feel like they could come loose, the little ball tips on the wires appear to hold them on.  These bracelets look nice on and is also nice that they fit my small 6-inch wrists.  BUT‚Ä¶ I cannot in good conscious give these bracelets good ratings because of the unsafe sharp wire edge that protrude from each of the two bracelets (see photo with arrow).  It is a sharp edge from twisted wire which I think is the start of the whole beading pattern.  This sharp pointed edge could cause a very bad cut if it rubbed against your or anyone else‚Äôs skin.  It could also easily damage a long sleeve knit top but the human safety factor is my biggest concern.  I might be able to cut and/or sand these edges down but don‚Äôt know if they would still be safe enough to wear, and should never have to do this with brand new jewelry.

description: Product Description

NurturMeals organic dry meal pouches are rich in nutrients and super versatile for feeding both infants and toddlers. Simply mix them with breast milk, formula or water to create a puree for babies, or into toddler favorites like pastas, baked goods or yogurts for an added boost in protein and nutrients.
From the Manufacturer
Backed by Experienced Investors.
Flavor Profile
NurturMeal Blends are available in four scrumptious flavors - Squash, Bananas and Green Kale, Sweet Potatoes, Oatmeal and Bananas; Peas, Quiona and Apples; and Carrots, Raisins and Sweet Potatoes.
Certifications
NurturMeals dry organic baby food is certified-organic, gluten-free, non-GMO and kosher, with no added salts, sugars, artificial flavors or preservatives.
Dried baby food locks in nutrients.
Add breast milk, formula or water.
Mix into toddler meals (yogurt, oatmeal, pasta)
Feeding Accessory

For parents who need to feed their kids on the fly, NurturMe‚Äôs reusable Eco-Pouch ‚Äì a friendly alternative to single-use plastic squeeze containers ‚Äì makes it easy to prepare healthy and nutritious NurturMeals on the go. Mix directly in the pouch with liquid of choice, hand to baby and toss in the dishwasher when finished ‚Äì no fuss, no muss, no spills, and best of all, parents control what goes in it. Additionally, each box of NurturMe Eco-pouches keeps more than 45 squeeze tubes of baby food out of our landfills.
About the Startup
Describe your product in 3 words.
Nutritious. Convenient. Innovative.
Where did you get the inspiration for your product?
From our families. Becoming moms was what inspired us to create NurturMe - so that we could offer healthier, more nutritious alternatives to what was in the baby & kids aisle.
What differentiates your product from similar products out there?

We offer quinoa-based alternatives to popular foods in the baby/kid aisle. Rice cereal has no nutritional value, for example, so we created a quinoa infant cereal that is naturally protein-rich, easily digestible for little ones, and hypoallergenic. We also are bringing to market alternatives to popular rice- and wheat-based snacks that the competition offers ‚Äî our quinoa squares will be the first quinoa-based snacks for kids!
Tell us about the best and most challenging parts of the creation process.

The best part about the creation process is seeing your ideas come to life ‚Äî it‚Äôs humbling to have a team of people that dedicate themselves to creating & supporting this product line, which was only an idea of ours a few brief years ago. The challenging part staying open to customer criticism and feedback ‚Äî it‚Äôs important that we continually improve our products based on what customers are saying. It keeps us on our toes, but fortunately, as a small company we can be nimble and flexible to meet our customers' needs.

review.user_review:
This product was a little disappointing. My son loves the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and he loves waffles, so I thought this would be great. unfortunately, it was not as good as I thought.

First the waffles came out super thin. They were literally half the size of the others from my normal waffle maker. One child actually thought they were pancakes instead of waffles they were so small. They had no room to become fluffy.

The image of the turtle was not super great. Yes, you could tell it was that, but it was not very clear.

It didn't have a timer, so it was hard to guess when it was done. It took longer than with my other one.

Overall, I have to say I'm a bit disappointed. It is fun for a TMNT fan, but I think the convenience and the fact that the regular ones make it so much better outweigh the one advantage of the TMNT image.

review.user_review:
This Grind Worthy medium roast coffee is a smooth coffee with a light flavor. Getting the whole bean bag, the coffee beans had a nice aroma to them when ground. Nothing too dark or bitter but not light either. A nice medium roast.

Being made in a french press, the coffee brewed at a nice darker color, but wasn't as full bodied flavorwise as the color would make you think. That being said, it was still a smooth, nice roast. If you're someone who prefers a dark and bitter coffee, I wouldn't get this medium roast, but if you like medium roast, or just like coffee, then I highly recommend it!

This package came with two bags and if you enjoy a cup or two each day, it‚Äôs a great option. If you drink coffee all day (like my parents), it may not be the most affordable option for you.

review.user_review: I‚Äôve never bought organic Hershey‚Äôs before and didn‚Äôt even realize it existed. I‚Äôm not one that really eats organic, unless that‚Äôs the only one available. I didn‚Äôt expect the organic version to taste different than the regular version but I was wrong. I like Hershey‚Äôs chocolate, I know not everyone does. I was surprised that the organic version taste better than regular. It was fresher tasting and seemed a little thicker than a regular Hershey‚Äôs but not as wide. Breaking a piece off was a little harder but was crisper sounding. I really liked the flavor of this organic version. They came 12 to a box which will last me a while. The packaging was a little crazy but the one bar I tried was in good shape. The Hershey‚Äôs box came inside a box that was a little bigger, not a surprise. I‚Äôve had many air fryers similar to this but I think this is probably the best one I‚Äôve had. The first thing I always use a new air fryer for is toast. It‚Äôs something simple but not all air fryer ovens actually toast. This one did a great job, though it did only brown one side of the bread. You can toast up to six pieces of bread and it offers three different levels. I also used it to reheat wings, to air fry hot dogs and hot dog buns.

This air fryer heats to 450 degrees which is hotter than my other one. And it cooks quickly! It only took 8 minutes to reheat my wings and they were perfect. The hot dogs took 5 minutes and the buns took 2 minutes. This air fryer is versatile and can also be used to roast a whole chicken, bake a 12‚Äù pizza , fry french fries, etc.

This has quite a few preset selections and it‚Äôs fairly easy to use. The one thing I don‚Äôt like about the preset selections is you have to push the function button to switch to the one you want. It was easy to select the function or time I want and then select preheat. Then when it‚Äôs preheated, the display pops up with a message telling you to Add Food.

This comes with a booklet that tells you how to use and it I found it useful. It did instruct to run it for 18 minutes at the highest temperature to get rid of the smell. And that actually worked, I haven‚Äôt smelled it since that first time. The booklet also has some recipes which I also appreciated.

So far this seems like a really quality option and I‚Äôve used quite a few. It‚Äôs versatile and cooks well. It‚Äôs a good size, though a little larger than my previous one, but it also holds more.

review.user_review: I've been using these off and on for a couple weeks as a back-up to a pair of other headphones.  I really wanted to like them.  The sound quality is an issue.  I listen to audiobooks, and when one set of headphones needs charged, I like to have another set to switch to.  These two ear buds do not always work in conjunction with each other.  I'll hear the audio in one ear and then a second later that audio will repeat in the other ear.  It's really annoying, but it's not consistent.  It will play for a while and be fine, and I'm really liking the earbuds and then they start echoing each other.  I'm not sure what the standard battery life should be, but after charging for 24 hours, I was shocked when the battery had lost half it's charge within 20 minutes of use.  As for the size, I have small ear canals and have struggled with finding buds that will fit comfortably.  These came with a small bud cover, but I couldn't get it to stay on the bud so I had to stick with the standard size.  This left them less stable in my ear so when I leaned over, the buds fell out.

review.user_review_title: Must-have for Power Outages, Hurricanes, Fires and all Displaced Coffee Addicts
review.user_review:
This grinder is a modest affair, but when your caffeine headache strikes with the force of an F5 tornado, the mirage of your super duper automatic coffee machine (we have two, one for backup) will be a tantalizing nightmare.

If you use an automated coffee machine with an integrated grinder, you've stocked your shelves with whole beans -- because they taste much better. But once the power is out, you'll be in a desperate need of a manual grinder that can be used, for instance, in a french press to make fresh coffee.

This grinder is relatively small (won't take up a lot of shelf space when you do have power, and won't take up much room in your suitcase when the fire marshal tells you to evacuate your California mansion). We like the see-through plastic elements that let you see whether you've done enough grinding. Apart from cleaning the coffee dust, the thing is pretty low maintenance.

You'll be sharing your grounds with the rest of your refugee cohorts in the high school gym. By now you'll know that the Red Cross didn't bring enough coffee for everyone.

description: Roasted coffee beans are little flavor pods, protecting the tasty oils and solubles that provide all the great flavor and richness we coffee lovers crave. Lightweight and portable, this coffee grinder features a manual hand crank that eliminates the loud noise that electric grinders produce. You'll be able to grind your favorite roast quietly in an office cubicle or in your kitchen when your loved ones are fast asleep. A built-in, adjustable grind selector with 5 settings ensures you have precision control over the coarseness of your grinds which ideal for crafting your favorite coffee for pour over, drip, chemex, cold brew, French press, percolator, AeroPress, Turkish, espresso, reusable K-Cups and more. The bottom portion of the grinder is built to catch the grinds within the canister - simply twist the bottom of the grinder to detach the cup to expose the grinds. review.user_review_title: A Classic AmazonBasics Shelf Design, but Proceed with Caution: Sturdiness is Secondary.
review.user_review:
Low cost and straightforward to assemble, this shelf system follows the "technology" of other Amazon Basics shelves. I have purchased several sets of the latter, e.g., [[ASIN:B00NUS53CY AmazonBasics 4-Shelf Shelving Unit - Chrome]] and [[ASIN:B01BZDZI8Y DuraSteel 24 Pairs/6 Packs Wire Shelving Shelf Lock Clips for 1" Post, Shelving Sleeves, Plastic, Black, Fits Alera, Metro, Thunder Group, Eagle, Regency, Advanced Tabco, John Boos, Winco, Focus]]. The design used allows for moderate stresses (not a garment rack full of winter suits), though installers may find that the plastic fasteners used to secure the shelves to poles are subject to breakage.

One improvement on the packaging to note: the poles are labelled. Not really essential, but it's a no-brainer that adds a bit to the assembly process and is totally worth it for users.

On the other hand, the fasteners were delivered in separate packaging, which created the impression that they're separate parts, which they aren't.

Once you have the hang of the fastener design, assembly is easy. Well, mostly. Thing is, it's hard to line it up properly without breaking the plastic fasteners. Even when set on its side as recommended, the airborne legs will buckle and bend the frame.

Basically, you need another person or a sawhorse to do this easily. Yes, one person can do it with various supports and ingenuity. But it shouldn't be this difficult.

After assembly, I found the wheels, while serviceable on a hard surface, didn't work smoothly. Low cost is everything here. Once a load of clothes is on it, movement will need to be more coaxing the rolling.

Another factor to consider: with a load of clothes on board, it's a bit of an eyesore. Not blaming the rack for that, but something to consider.

CONCLUSION In sum, I like this overall design, but with only two shelves to steady it, the outcome may dismay when operating under load. For t-shirts and bras you will have it made. For winter coats, proceed with caution. Either way, hide your fashion-unfriendly love away.

review.user_review_title: OK for small room, but air exchanger installs may be challenging.
review.user_review:
Oddly, it isn't hot yet where we live, so this unit hasn't received a full test yet, except for its humidity removal function.

I think the 8000 btu unit is a bit undersized for our basement, where it's been deployed, but even a small improvement will prevent me from having to relocate to another part of the house when the heat arrives for good.

For our installation, the air exchanger had to be directed out a window that is relatively high compared to the basement floor. The tube was a stretch; I think some similar installations may face this problem.

You'll also need to improvise a cover for the air exchanger. We get mice and squirrels in the basement because our pantry is there; no need to add to the temptations. Also, for this reason, expect to use this as a temporary, not a permanent installation. (Animals are very motivated in cold weather.)

Check out the dimensions; it's not a problem, but I was surprised at how tall this unit is. About upper thigh on me.

The 650ml water reservoir is not large. It's about 0.17 gallon. On a humid day, it needs to be emptied at least once. For sleeping, you'll want to empty it before going to bed. I can work with this limitation, but we have a dehumidifier which integrates a water pump to remove water - this would be a better solution that frequent emptying (though it adds to the cost.) We have a drain in the floor of the basement, but it's nowhere near the location of this unit. A long drainage tube is tempting but would be inconveniently in the way.

Nice remote.

Overall, this is pretty good if you can cut down the space to be heated and minimize cooling loss through windows (or ceiling for attic installations).

If you have nonstandard window sizes, it may be a challenge to install the air exchanger to your satisfaction. And there's the water disposal problem.

review.user_review_title: Handled 5 Concurrent Devices, Powered. But no USB-C
review.user_review:
Unclear why it should be true, but the USB hubs I own that don't have separate power supplies, can't seem to handle the aggregate bandwidth. This one was OK, happily, so far.

Most folks won't use all ten of these ports, but I found six to be not uncommon, with five of them needed concurrently.

In some ways, the hubs that work *some* of the time are worse.

TIP
Power adapter aspect, positive with the Atolla, negative with products lacking a PSU, may be coincidental, but consider the evidence.

Symptoms of OTHER devices when they fail (this one didn't in testing):
1. Can't recognize the device; e.g., a USB headset wasn't recognized
2. Drops typed characters on a USB keyboard

ATOLLA CON
-What if you need a USB-C port?
-Not great for traveling

review.user_review_title: Escalating Storage Thirst,  meet Engineering Tradeoffs
review.user_review:
The 128GB version gives you a taste of what's possible with this storage technology: Lexar offers 256, 512, and 1TB (yes, 1TB) versions of this Class 10 storage card.

Apart from the specialized Switch application, this storage card design highlights some of the engineering tradeoffs that can be made. This card trades off write vs. read speeds. That works OK for routine audio files -- not live mixing, but finished tracks copied in bulk -- which results in fast access for, e.g., a FLAC file of Ralph Vaughn Williams "Variations on a Theme of Thomas Tallis," of 85MB. Compare to a MOV or MP4 file which can be 0.5 to 10GB. I found read speeds to be acceptable for this use.

The speeds advertised come with caveats from Lexar. A2 performance (which might not matter, for instance, for cameras) is achieved with the higher density 512 and 1TB versions. Benchmarks at Lexar might use their native reader hardware.

That said, you get a lot for the $ here. I wouldn't hesitate to use it for backup of content on a more expensive, faster card -- because the backup could proceed unattended.

At the end of the day, you'll wish you had the 1TB version, but that esclating thirst is nothing new. Remember 32MB cards?

review.user_review_title: Economical and useful for phones with smaller phone/case footprint
review.user_review:
These are an economical solution to a problem you didn't know you had. If you enable "lock" notifications on your phone, you may not be able to see them unless you pick up your phone. This makes those notifications not much more convenient than on a desktop or laptop. Put the phone on a stand and you can treat it like the auxiliary screen it is.

These are plastic, have an adjustable angle -- they're simply designed and easy to use.

There's a "but." Works fine with an iPhone 6 in a typical case. Not so great with a Pixel 4 XL in a Zizo case. Even tilted pretty far back, it's not a good fit. Stick to a smaller phone/case combination and you'll be OK.

Postscript: Additional CON - I forgot to mention that this design prevents you from charging the phone while it's on the stand.

review.user_review_title: Bend, but Won't Break: You'll Only Love if After Other Brands Fail
review.user_review:
You'll like this cable if you've been through a few of the cheaper alternatives and had them fail.

While other reviews have focused on the diameter of the cable (including insulation), in my experience the failure point is usually the connector(s), which eventually fail to make solid contact due to bending of repeated connecting and disconnecting -- not to mention being folded up in all sorts of positions and configurations never envisioned by the maker.

Rejoice in the absence: This cable doesn't result in warnings from connected devices.

Every IoS user needs at least 2-3 of these, including one in your carry-on luggage.

I'm rating this high because of repeated failures of other cables, but let's not get carried away. It's just a cable. Go back to worrying about your backups, anti-theft, and Starbucks wi-fi intrusions instead.

review.user_review_title: Very affordable vest with dramatic flair
review.user_review:
PRO
-At the current price, this is a steal for what you get.
-Dramatic pattern (not fully original; it's similar to a vest pattern I already own)

CON
-As with almost all vests that don't use snaps, the vest stresses the buttons / buttonholes. Not enough extra buttons are supplied for this eventuality.
-Once soiled, it will probably need dry cleaning, though most vests need this infrequently.
-A little big in the shoulder as it doesn't "lay flat." Common for these poly vests; fit tends to hug the body less than all-cotton.
-When packed, folds can persist. This can lead to accidental "iron burn," also a poly vest problem. Need to iron from the inside at the lowest temp possible.

NEUTRAL
-Very shiny look. This doesn't always work with your outfit.

OVERALL
-Great buy at this price.

review.user_review_title: Lives up to brand pedigree, though not "Xtreme" : Expect Crisp, Professional Pocketless Look
review.user_review:
The Arrow brand, if I'm not mistaken, goes back a ways, so there was cause for skepticism. The legacy brands, for reasons unknown, tend to focus on loose-fitting clothing. So the designation "Xtreme Slim Fit" seemed unlikely -- but worth a try.

I can happily report that the "Slim Fit" designation does apply here. The shirt has a very professional sheen, appropriately thicker cuffs and collar, and an unusual X style stitch over the buttons that might secure them a bit more than a typical shirt. After wearing it a day, the back of the shirt was not as wrinkled as some dress shirts are after a day at the white collar [sic] chain gang.

In sum, a high quality shirt that lives up to its billing and pedigree perhaps exceeded only by more expensive shirts with Italian design influences.

Nits:
(1) Could not find a spare button, and these are somewhat unusual buttons;
(2) there is no pocket (and no pocket to sag of course);
(3) the label "Xtreme" doesn't apply; the shirt is surely Slim Fit, but would probably not look very slim on my early teen nephew;
(4) my preference would be for a slightly longer tail, perhaps an inch or two;
(5) no collar stiffener channels (unclear if the shirt will eventually need them.

Still, overall good quality, with no hanging threads "off the rack" shipped in old school pin-paper-plastic packaging (probably not necessary).

This shirt was worn with this spring suit by Nick Graham [[ASIN:B07B58HY16 Nick Graham Men's Finished Bottom Suit, Blue Small Windowpane, 40R]]: an obvious and conventional choice, but the right pairing for a less than conventional suit.

And you are going to need a collar protector. Recommend something like this (tho it is overpriced): [[ASIN:B002IGHKXE White Collar Grime: Disposable Collar Protector, White, 10 Ft.]]

review.user_review:
The Leapsee heated vest is an ambitious attempt to solve the problem of warming the human body by staying close to the body, rather pointlessly heating up the entire environment around that body. A similar objective has been set out by others for cooling; in an electric car, you could save energy by just cooling the people, not the entire cabin.

AS APPAREL
But there are problems. The vest wasn't small; it was in fact large, and fit my husband better than me (he's got about 9 inches of height on me). And bulky. (Fit him like a "classic fit," rather than his preferred slim.)

It was lightweight, though.

HEATING
The heating function just wouldn't materialize. We were able to charge the battery (according to the charge lights on the battery pack), but once charged, the heat resulting from the "long press" startup instructions was either undetectable or the switch was defective.

THE ENDEAVOR
We're not sure how much heat could be provided by a modest sized battery pack like this one, but it seems like a worthy endeavor. Our test unit didn't deliver the desired results. Hope yours produces a better result.

review.user_review:
I'm not a coffee drinker, but I saw another reviewer recommend this syrup for oatmeal, and I am an oatmeal eater and a caramel lover. This syrup does go well with oatmeal.

I'll not use it every time I eat oatmeal, but it is good for an occasional treat. The pump bottle is easy to use and to store away and the three pumps per tablespoon makes it easy to measure. I put in 4 pumps for my usual bowl of oatmeal and that was about right.

Trouble is, while the taste is good, the aftertaste is not. I couldn't take the aftertaste anymore, and have stopped using this.

review.user_review_title: Only one complaint -- loud is not very loud
review.user_review:
These travel headphones sound stunning. I'm used to listening to music through a lot of noise. Having a backdrop of silence, and pure music on top of it, makes a world of difference. While I've mainly used the wire connection, I've tried the Bluetooth wireless connection as well, and did not notice any difference in the sound quality. Both sound superb.

The headphones come with a travel case and a battery charger. It all fits together compactly, yet the headphones are easy to pop out and put on, and can be worn in comfort for several hours.

My only complaint is that loud is not very loud. Maybe I'm doing something wrong--the headphones are not pure plug-and-play, and I misplaced the manual and have been too lazy to track down instructions online. Even with the sound being a little softer than I would like, these headphones make music a lot better.

review.user_review:
Nice mouse. Pretty color. Easy to use. Plugs right in and goes to work. Not for gaming or complicated manipulation, but fine for anything I do. I like the fit in my hand and the fact that I can grip it and move it around without accidentally pressing any buttons. And I like not having a wire that goes to my laptop.

Two things I really like: The dongle that pairs the mouse and the laptop fits in the bottom of the mouse, with a magnet to keep it secure between uses. And the scroll wheel has two speeds, fast and slow, that you can switch between using a button with an LED indicator that shows when you are in fast scrolling.

The only thing I don't like is that the mouse is bigger than I had hoped -- I like a more compact design.

review.user_review_title: Works well, with a few nice extras
review.user_review:
We don't expect too much from a router. If we can set it up, and it works for a few years without any maintenance, we're happy.

Since we have not been using this one too long, it's hard to say how it will do. But we had a Netgear router before that worked fine for us. So far, we have had no problems. So we are keeping our fingers crossed.

A router is a router, so it's hard to add any useful features to distinguish it from its competition. But this one has one feature we like. It has a USB port so that you can hook up an external hard drive accessible to any computer on the network. That is handy for us.

review.user_review_title: Seems to work well, but hard to tell
review.user_review:
This memory certainly looks different from any memory I've had before. The big heat sinks and gaudy lights do not do much for function, but they do add to the look. If you have a glass-sided case and room to look at it, you may like this. If you don't have a glass-sided case, or if the glass side is out of view, this may be overkill for you. For me, the 12 LED lights on each memory stick are something I could do without. I don't bother with them.

At heart, though, this memory is top of the line. Corsair's Dominator memory is the best, although there appear to be faster choices than Dominator Platinum. Each memory module is, reportedly, hand picked to ensure you get the best combination. The PCB layout and heatsinking allow for overclocking, though if you want the best performance you should add your own cooling.

This memory has been out for a couple of years and those with more experience with it than me still seem satisfied. Seems a good choice.

review.user_review: These training pants say they are "gravity" training pants, which is (apparently) supposed to mean that they offer more resistance to leg movements than normal pants. Thus by working against that extra "gravity" you get a better workout than you would get otherwise. I'm not so sure about that whole theory, but the pants are comfortable and work very well as workout pants. They do fit snugly around the calves and ankles so if you don't like a tight fit there you won't like these. But if you like a snug but stretchy feel, and an overall soft and comfortable feel, you will like these. I do, and I do.

review.user_review_title: I have only one place for this......
review.user_review: under my kitchen sink is where I want it. I spent a half-hour just cleaning out that mess. I've got too big of a waste basket under there, it's going to lead to a revamp of that area. I got rid of some of the cleaning products that I forgot were under there. The last plumber that worked under that sink made a mess when he moved around the water pipes--I don't know what he did but he wasn't my favorite person back then and now I can't believe how hard it is to find the room to keep some things down there. Oh well!! I do like the idea of a lazy susan for those products I'm keeping and knowing how I can put my fingertips on them without having to dig around to find them--just turn the lazy susan and pull that section to me to see all! Going to be easy to keep clean too.

review.user_review: I think these are a decent pair of earbuds for the price. They pair easily with an iPhone. The sound is good, but not great. To be fair I'm comparing the sound quality to Bose earbuds so the bar is set high. I am not a huge fan of this style of earbuds. I prefer to have them clipped or hooked over my ear rather then wedged in my ear. These did fit in my ear and felt fairly secure. On/off is easy. Really these are very user friendly. One drawback is it's easy to push the on/off switch just fitting them in your ears. I like the case that also charges them. The manual says they turn off when you put them in the case, but I always turn them off myself since it is so easy and I read a review that says that function doesn't work. For $30 it would have been nice for clips to have been included. Despite my minor complaints I would recommend.

review.user_review_title: I thought my Republic of Tea matcha was good
review.user_review:
...but this is better! Less bitterness and a much smoother flavor. It mixes well without clumping (I mix with tiny bit water first into a more pasty substance, then mix all the way to dissolve into a latte.

I've been using this for the Bulletproof matcha latte as per Dave Asprey's website, and for the Glow 15 brew suggested in the book of that name. I have to watch how much I use and keep it minimal so as not to get overly wired. But after reading in Anti Cancer about the benefits of EGCGs on fighting cancer and inflammation, I am sold that this is of great benefit instead of a different caffeinated beverage in the morning.

And this stuff is a LOT nicer than the bitter brew I bought from another brand I was not familiar with, and even a bit smoother than Republic of Tea, as noted.

description: Don't be intimidated by this earthy green tea that's been at the center of Japanese tea ceremonies for centuries. With a little whisk and a little preparation, you'll be pleasantly surprised by its rich, full-bodied herbal flavor. Altogether bold, bitter, and grassy, our Ceremonial Matcha balances out its biting bitterness with a smooth texture hidden beneath a frothy, thick foam. You're sure to feel heavily meditated afterwards.

review.user_review_title: Nice cocoa latte, but prefer their beet latte flavor
review.user_review:
I really like this simple cocoa latte as a base, but it need something in order to be palatable. I initially experimented with it plain, and found the darkness of the mushroom overwhelmed the cocoa flavor to where it wasn't all that tasty. Even with foamed milk on top, it really needed something.

The next time I tried it I used a little bit of powdered monk fruit at the bottom of the cup to sweeten it up, and that helped, but wasn't everything that was necessary.

The third time I tested, I added some vanilla as well as the monk fruit, and that helped get it where it needed to go. I think that they probably could've added the vanilla or some other natural ingredient to help flavor this more interestingly to balance out the mushroom flavor.

In order to make this, I put some in the bottom of a cup along with the vanilla and monk fruit, pour boiling water over and let it steep, then use my little inexpensive milk foamer to foam some warm almond milk and pour it on top. It's a nice low-calorie treat on a cold day.

review.user_review:
So many paleo granolas are way over sweetened, to where I wonder where they get their definition of paleo. This one, is just sweet enough to allow the other flavors in the granola to shine.

It's got a wonderful dark chocolate and salt flavor that goes really nicely with the mild flavor of the sabo bananas and coconut clusters in the mix, and I really like how it goes with either a plain unsweetened almond milk or kite hill dairy free yogurt.

Some of the clusters are big enough to pick out and put in a little snack cup for my kids, while probably the larger proportion of clusters small enough that they are better suited for pouring over yogurt or having with milk.

This very much feels like a grown-up version of cereal. The dark chocolate and the sea salt combine really well to make this feel like a decadent treat.

There's just a tiny bit of powdery oats in here, mixed with a few indistinct crumbles of date log and miscellaneous dried fruit we've added it to yogurt and to milk, and in either case, it was only moderately tasty and was barely enough even for a snack, much less for a meal. description: Product Description

Super muesli is here to rescue you from typical empty-calorie cereals. It‚Äôs loaded with nature‚Äôs finest ingredients. The almonds, hemp seeds, and chia seeds provide protein and healthy omega fatty acids. We add just enough gently dehydrated cranberries so it tastes great but isn‚Äôt loaded with sugar. Whole grain oats and quinoa make this mix even more nutritious and add plenty of fiber. INGREDIENTS: organic rolled oats, organic cranberries (organic cranberries, organic evaporated cane juice, organic sunflower oil), almonds, coconut, chia seeds, hemp seeds, quinoa flakes.
From the Manufacturer
Win Your Breakfast. Win Your Day.

I have never been a morning person, but I learned that starting strong with an early win sets the pace for my whole day. I found that win was easy when I started eating muesli- it‚Äôs healthy, quick, and delicious. A small bowl helps keep me full and energized throughout the day. I wanted to share my recipes with everyone, so evoke was born. From your health to the health of our environment, I want to make a positive impact with every bowl of muesli.
Eat Nutrients, Not Sugar

Packed with protein, not sugar. Our muesli cereals are made from high quality real food and nothing else. Made from organic whole grains, dried fruits, nuts, and seeds, our products are well rounded in nutrition. Our muesli pairs great with Greek yogurt or almond milk or can simply be cooked hot with water.
Nutritious, Sustainable, Unprocessed
Environmental Working Group's Food Scores App rates products for Nutrition, Sustainability, and Processing concerns. Out of 372 Cereals-Granola, Evoke has the top 3.
Quick and Convenient
Mix a bag right in your yogurt, pack it for kids' lunches, keep them at the office or in your gym bag.
Clean Ingredients
Our Super Muesli is non-GMO project verified, vegan, and kosher, with no refined sugar, added salts, artificial flavorings or preservatives.
Ready for Adventure
You wake up every morning determined to conquer your day. You need something healthy and convenient to keep you fueled. We've made the perfect muesli just for you.
About the Startup
Describe your product in 3 words.
Truly Healthy Cereal
How did you come up with the idea for this product?

I discovered muesli when I was at a snowboarding competition in Switzerland in high school. It was quick, delicious, and healthy. It became the staple of my breakfast. I would soak it overnight and just grab it on my out the door, a small bowl would keep me full and energized through the day. I started making it myself in college and had friends try it and love it. I started selling at farmers markets and local stores.
What makes your product special?

We focus on high quality ingredients like thick rolled organic oats and almonds directly from a small fram in California. All of our products are 5g of sugar or less, unfortunately you don't see that often in the cereal aisle.
What has been the best part of your startup experience?

I started my company because I wanted to promote healthy eating. As Evoke has grown, I‚Äôve learned I have the opportunity to do so much more. By connecting with farmers to source traceable, nutritious ingredients, I am building a company that creates a better future.

review.user_review:
Upon first bite, I had to reorient my expectations, because my first impression was not "peanut butter cookie". There is an odd flavor here that I was not expecting, that I can't quite put a finger on. Something a little bitter. I have read that Stevia goes a little bitter when combined with chocolate based items, but I wasn't expecting Stevia to mess up a peanut butter item, so I'm not sure if it's the sweetener. After a few cookies, I was able to better wrap my head around the idea of these being a peanut butter based dessert food, but I never developed an enthusiasm about feeling treated while eating them.

Overall the texture is pretty good, the miniature cookie size is nice for reminding yourself that you are having a small treat rather than digging into a giant meal, and the mouth feel is also very good. I think the only thing they need to work on is the flavor. For me, this is an "almost". They did enough right here that I would certainly be interested to try other snacks from this brand to see if the flavor is a little more dialed in.

review.user_review_title: Beautiful set, have loved Sango for years
review.user_review:
I've had a Sango bowl for many years that I like. Their finishes are super slick, nice colors, and the ceramic is fine grained enough to not feel like I'm scuffing everything I put it on. After getting this set, I picked up a few more pieces from it because I liked it so much, and I'm not really a set person. I'd generally rather have a variety.

They look as good or better in person as in the pictures. Like nice shiny marble. None of them have broken yet from getting overheated, though I'm sure there's a limit. I don't usually give the smallest bowls to my kids though, because they've got that narrow ring at the bottom like a lot of Japanese bowls that makes them tippy if bumped.

review.user_review_title: Very attractive set of plates and dishware
review.user_review:
I have a hodgepodge of plates, bowls, and mugs from years of shopping at ethnic stores and just buying one of this are one of that, or fun garage sale signs. However, after purchasing a new home about a year ago and having a beautiful new kitchen, I've been having an unaccustomed longing for an attractive, grown-up matched set. This really fit the bill for me, and as a landscaper I really loved the earthy colors and floral motif. It's attractive and simple, and isn't overbearing in its pattern.

The texture of these dishes is a tiny bit roughened, but very pleasantly so, they don't feel so shiny and slick that every fingerprint shows, rather they just always feel classy and perfect.

These have gone through the dishwasher and microwave without a problem, and I've even put a plate of food in the toaster oven and the plate did just fine.

The patterning on these is even more beautiful in person, and I'm really pleased and delighted with this set.

review.user_review_title: Nice enough to be used in holiday decor, great for giftgiving
review.user_review:
I really love the retro cool styling of these candycane gift boxes, they strike me as being appropriate for teens, college students, or anyone with a little more cool factor. These are thick and nice enough to be used as holiday decor, or even in a pinch as a serving dish for cookies and other baked goods, if you just add a little colored cellophane on the interior. This is great for me, as I don't like to keep holiday dishes around all year just to use in December, so it's nice that I can serve my guests cookies in a festive container without having to store holiday china.

I also really like using matched containers when giving gifts to my larger family, because it gets so crazy on Christmas morning that it is so much easier to find each person's set of gifts if they are all in matched boxes or gift bags. This brand makes some sets of gift bags with the same pattern as these boxes.

Though I received a sample for review, the positive opinion is my own.

review.user_review_title: Works well for CAD, gentle gaming, and general browsing
review.user_review:
As someone who generally builds their own computer, this was somewhat of an experiment for me. It's always been my opinion that pre-built machines focus on the specs of a few key components and then skimp on the rest. I can't say this machine changed my mind on that, but it is nice for most people, who don't want to figure out how to make their own to have something already together that just works.

So far, I've used it for a few months and haven't had any failures. It's handled software installations, Windows updates, and new hardware with a minimum of errors. The card readers work. The ports are easy to reach. it isn't especially noisy, but it's far from silent. I've used it for mild gaming, some CAD design work with a program that often crashes and is a ram-hog, and general browing and have had no lagging or problems. Seems to work great!

In my haste to get rid of pre-installed software, I removed the software that turns the light in the DELL logo on and off on the front. I had turned it off, but as soon as I rebooted, it came on and stayed that way. The wires don't seem to be easily accessible to unplug it. I don't consider a bright blue glowing logo that defaults to on to be an added value to the customer, but I guess I'm not really surprised.

review.user_review_title: Okay, but not outperforming the competitors at similar price points
review.user_review:
These are definitely a quality product. I don't think they outperform some of the competitors. They feel really solid. Range is decent. A bit large and heavy. The noise cancelling is just barely worth turning on.

They come with several options for improving fit. I settled on some of the bigger flappy looking parts as being very comfortable. Unfortunately, after wrestling them onto the earbuds, I found that the lid is no longer even close to closing on the charging case. I'd call it an inexcusable design oversight. Lots of tuning options in the app.

Compared to other earbuds I've tried, they sound better and are much heavier than much less expensive brands, but I'm not sure it's worth it. At similar price points, I've tried two other brands. One was even bigger, but sounded amazing (Bose), and the other I found to be superior in nearly every way.

review.user_review_title: Beautifully designed product with good noise cancellation
review.user_review:
Unboxing: Wouldn't usually make a section of this, but every once in a while a product makes it a pleasure. Especially a weird one like this. It's like unboxing a little UFO. It starts out in something like a hat box with a couple sticky tabs of tape to remove. Wish they could have found a better closure method, but the box is nice. Inside that you're immediately presented with the odd looking earbuds and a starter guide (also round) that has you immediately trying them on and fitting the best sleeve size for in your ear. There are no extra sleeves obviously apparent, so time to dig deeper. Next up is the UFO. A large earbud like this needs a large charging case. This one is round and unzips like some of the nicer headphone cases, but it's also a hard case with lights and buttons. Nothing inside but a charging dock. Under it is a secret compartment (made less secret by the thumb holes for easy removal). At the bottom of the hat box we have our missing sleeves and a charging cord.

Even with a diagram, putting these on was confusing and took four tries. Once they're on though, they are quite comfortable, and I think I'll learn to put them on after a few more tries.

Back to the book, and ugh! now they're telling me to put them in the charging case to pair. But I just finally got them on! &*^@#!

Ok, after getting things paired and back on, I'm able to put them through some testing. I'm not really an audiophile, but I've tried a lot of earbuds. Comfort is good. They don't rely on being stuck in your ear to hold themselves up, so there isn't a high stress point that's going to get sore first. They sound good. Better than most, but not the best I've heard. The control button is on the back of your ear, and I find it awkward and unreliable. Noise cancellation is solid, but like every other one I've tried, it is hard to tell sometimes because it scales with volume. Turning them on in a noisy room doesn't result in a quiet room, but turning up what you are listening to will result in noise other than what you are listening to disappearing quite a lot. There is a passthrough mode if you need to hear what's going on around you, but it doesn't sound very nice.

I like that it's USB-C. No more having to turn the cord over three times to figure out which end is up, and much faster charging. The case has three lights to show you charge progress for the case Each one represents enough charge for one full use of the earbuds. There's also a light on the top to tell you whether the earbuds are charged yet.

It's a solid product. Not my top favorite, but definitely innovative and a competitive offering.

review.user_review_title: Cute pants but material feels a little rough and pocket configuration is odd
review.user_review:
Very similar lounging sweatpants from midrange brands like this. What I really appreciate about this one is that it is made of organic cotton rather than a synthetic or a not organic cotton. The fabric is smooth on the outside and woven on the interior, and is a mid to heavyweight fabric with a sturdy waistband and generously sized pockets.

I wish the fabric was a lot more soft and luxurious, but what I like about these is that the fabric is heavy enough that if I want to go outside in the garden or be working in the garage where I appreciate having a little more protection on me, then these are great.

The pocket configuration is just a little bit odd, the bottom of the pockets seems to tip my cell phone inwards towards the inside of my legs rather than letting the cell phone sit with the corner sticking out the top of the pocket, as all of my other similar pants do. I'm not sure if the company realized that they were messing with a standard convention here on how pockets are shaped, but definitely I have to carefully position my cell phone in my pocket and it does inevitably shift diagonally in a direction that is less comfortable as I move.

The stitching and build quality is excellent and the pants sustained only minor fading in the first few washes. They fit true to size. There's an interesting stitching detail that swoops in from the outside of the lower leg to the middle of the ankle which gives it a little extra style detail if you notice it.

review.user_review_title: True to size, stylish little cotton dresses
review.user_review:
My three-year-old daughter actually gasped in excitement when she saw these cute little tank dresses. She loves stars, and loves hot pink, so the combination was a perfect fit for her. Even though it's winter, she wanted to wear these tank dresses right away, and insisted I wash them and get them into her regular rotation rather than the summer drawer.

From my perspective, they are cut really nicely with a great deal of extra fabric for swish and style in the skirt area, and the tank fits true to size and exactly as expected. The bottom hem has a tendency to flip up, as seems standard with so many cotton dresses, but that sort of thing usually settles down upon wearing and I expect this will too.

They got a little softer upon washing, didn't shrink appreciably, and did sustain a very mild amount of fading, but overall nothing very noticeable. They seem to be a really nice quality cotton, good stitching, and a really nice design for an effortless play dress for girls.

review.user_review_title: My toddler cried when she had to take it off after first wearing. LOVE!
review.user_review:
My daughter wears 2T and was DELIGHTED when she saw this come out of the envelope. I washed and dried it, and she immediately changed into this because she was so so excited. The rainbow, the flared shoulder, and the snuggly fabric were a big draw. Her big brother, 5, was jealous of the fancy fuzzy rainbow.

The rainbow feels like a retro patch of some kind. It sticks out a third of an inch and is large and fuzzy, with tiny loops making up the fuzz. It is not hard or uncomfortable.

My daughter loved color coordinating headbands and choosing clothes to go with it. When you're wearing a rainbow there aren't really any wrong answers to the question, "does this go with my dress?"

I had to sponge it off a few times when it got dirty and my daughter refused to take it off and change. That is a good sign that she found it comfy. No neck tag, thankfully.

This is a great piece for fall. Doubles as a sweatshirt and she didn't need to layer up in chilly fall weather. I would not choose it for a hot day, but fall-winter-spring, yes.

features: SEGA HOT SAUCE: Our Carolina Reaper hot sauce is a tongue-tingling sauce like no other that perfectly balances the heat of the world‚Äôs hottest pepper with maplewood-smoked onion and fresh pineapple. SEGA is a fiery favorite with a tangy twist. If you‚Äôre looking for a real kick, this is it. Contains a 3-pack of 5oz bottles.

A TANGY EXTRA HOT STING: The vinegar-forward SEGA clocks in at a Hot/-Extra Hot heat level of 7 out of 10, making it quite hot but still approachable for the average hot sauce lover. It packs a punch without leaving a mark, the FUEGO way.
GIVE IT A GO: Mind-blowing on pizza, a BLT, or carnitas. Try it in guacamole, margaritas, salad dressing, or even use it wherever you would use apple cider vinegar.

A HEALTHY CONDIMENT: In terms of condiments, it doesn‚Äôt get much healthier. Our zero-calorie hot sauce contains a base of small-farm organic apple cider (with the mother) paired with house-smoked onions, organic Carolina Reapers, and pineapple. SEGA is gluten-free, paleo-friendly, non-GMO, egg-free, dairy-free, fish-free, shellfish-free, soy-free, wheat-free, and fat-free. With no artificial preservatives and no harmful dyes.

description: Genmaicha is a mixture of green tea with roasted rice. It has less caffeine and tastes less astringent. This aromatic blended tea brings together the refreshing lightness, sweetness and the distinctive taste of roasted rice. Kyoto has been holding the reputation as the birthplace of high quality of tea. The plant is flourishing especially in Uji, which is located on the south in Kyoto, for the reasons below."Rich nature and environment suited to the cultivation." There are two rivers running - the Kizu river and the Uji river - through, and morning mist comes up from both rivers gives enough moisture to tea trees. And the property in Uji surrounded by many mountains is suitable for the growing of tea." Tradition rooted on this area" Until the Kamakura Era, Kyoto was the center of everything; culture, academy, art, architecture, economy, and politics. And the way of tea had been formed and sharpened, and refined by many great pioneers like Eisai or Senno-Rikyu(Tea Master), and its style and thought still remain as the part of Japanese tradition. Ujinotsuyuseicha Co., Ltd. is an Uji-based manufacture, having the aim at spreading our tradition through tea to all over the world.

review.user_review_title: pleasant taste, not necessarily better than pure green tea, pricey for small bag of tea, 3.5 stars
review.user_review: I'm used to paying $10 to $15 for 100 grams of medium-quality loose leaf green tea. This tea is $20 for only 50 grams, so it is twice as much as what I usually pay. Adding mint to green tea does add some tang to an otherwise more earthy tasting tea. I see lemon and orange in the ingredients, but I don't taste much of that. I will say this tea is interesting and different from good quality green tea, but not necessarily better and not something I would want to drink every day. If you think straight green tea is too earthy for you, this might be something worth trying. 3.5 stars.

review.user_review_title: works great, but avoid the 3rd party sellers
review.user_review:
This product is getting a lot of negative reviews, but I wonder if everyone is reviewing the exact same product. I bought mine directly from Amazon for $2.79, not one of the 3rd party China vendors that sell these for $1. The product arrived in a Prepworks-labeled plastic blister-pack. I have used it numerous times over the past month and it still looks great, with no stains or rust.

I also bought a similar looking $1 product from a 3rd party seller. It looks somewhat similar, but the construction quality is noticeably worse. The clasp doesn't line up as well or grip as well. The mesh is wider, so you cannot use it with finely ground teas. This one rusted after I first washed it, before using it for any tea.

review.user_review_title: lightweight vacuum with good suction but only 6 minutes of battery life after 5 hours of charging
review.user_review: This is a decent lightweight (1.5 pound) cordless vacuum cleaner. Charging from dead to full takes about 5 hours. Battery life is only about 6 minutes, though, so this is only good for quick cleanup jobs. The lithium battery does hold its charge when not in use, unlike older NiCad batteries. There is no charging stand or cradle, so we just store it in the box when not in use. Suction power is pretty good for such a lightweight vacuum, as long as you keep the filter clean. The fold-out "Quick Flip Crevice Tool" tool is pretty simple and the suction power drops quite a bit when you use it, but it is handy for light-duty jobs like cleaning corners and other places where the main vacuum head won't fit.

review.user_review_title: for brewing tea, not for drinking tea, small capacity
review.user_review: This is really a tea pot for brewing tea, not a mug for drinking tea. It is very pretty to look at. The glass seems thick and sturdy and arrived in perfect shape. Using it is awkward, since you cannot really drink from the bottle. You have to put your tea leaves in the infuser at the top of the bottle, add hot water, then brew for the appropriate amount of time (for your tea leaves), then remove the infuser (place it somewhere else) and pour the tea into a separate cup or cups for drinking. No tea cups are included, nor is any container for holding the infuser after use. Since the capacity of the glass is only 10 ounces (1.25 cups), you don't get much tea from each brew. For most people, a regular tea pot that is not sealed will be more practical. The teas that I drink only take 1-2 minutes to brew, so then I can pour the tea into a travel mug to take on the go. I'm giving this infuser product 4 stars because it is very pretty and maybe it will be more practical for you than for me.

review.user_review_title: pricey but very comfortable and incredible sound detail and stereo separation, not for sports
review.user_review:
These earbuds are pricey, but they are easily the best sounding earbuds that I have ever tried. I listen to mostly acoustic music where detail is more important than boomy bass. The bass on these earbuds is great for me without being boomy. The higher frequency detail is incredible. I can hear things with these that just don't come through with other brands of earbuds. The quiet sections of a song are very quiet through these earbuds, so the soft sections are even clearer. Stereo separation is excellent so I feel like I'm right there in the room with the musicians.

Volume is excellent. With other brands of wireless earbuds, I usually have to turn the volume all the way up and even then the music is often too quiet. WIth these B&O earbuds, I never have the volume at more than 2/3 power.

4 hour battery life is average for premium true-wireless earbuds and somewhat better than the cheaper models. The charging case is compact enough to fit in my pocket (unlike some other brands) and works flawlessly. I love that is uses USB-C, just like my smartphone. It also supports wireless charging, which I don't use with my phone either. USB-C is easier for me to understand.

As with all earbuds, picking the right ear tips is an important part of getting the best sound. I love that they included memory foam ear tips in the box. The memory foam tips are the most comfortable and best sounding tips for me. I can listen to these for hours without any discomfort.

There is an official B&O Android app that connects to the earbuds that has a few interesting features. It shows the earbud battery life, which is nice to have, especially if I don't remember when was the last time I charged them. There are some listening modes, that are somewhat customizable (but not like a traditional equalizer, which would be easier for me to understand). There is also a transparency feature that lets me hear background sound through the earbuds (useful when walking on the street or listening for an airport announcement). The earbuds do work fine without the app if you pair them with your phone using the normal Bluetooth setup.

These earbuds are not designed for sports. When I'm running or working out, I use my Jaybird earbuds that are more secure in my ears and are waterproof. The B&O earbuds are more comfortable and better sounding than my Jaybirds, so I use them more often.

review.user_review_title: much better tablet than my 7 inch Kindle Fire
review.user_review:
We also have a 7 inch Kindle Fire (from 2015). This 8 inch Kindle (from 2017) is way better. It runs much faster and smoother and the screen is brighter and sharper. 1 inch size difference makes a big difference. This is a real bargain for $50. Added a $10 memory card to hold my media and this is all the tablet I need.

A couple of notes. 1) it is possible to install the Google Play app store on this tablet, but the user interface is very clunky. Many of the Google Play apps work much better than what comes with the Amazon appstore, though. 2) you can install some apps to your SD card instead of main memory, but they then load more slowly. I prefer keeping all my apps in memory and just storing data files (like audio and video) on the SD card.

Yes, all the Amazon ad-ware is obnoxious. It is spread over all the screens, not just the lockscreen. I am thinking about installing a 3rd-party Android launcher to remove most of it and give me a sleeker user interface.

Also, the speaker is really terrible. Very weak volume and poor sound quality; much worse than the sound quality of my Samsung phone. Plan on buying an external speaker or headphones for music or even for conference calls.

3.5 stars for user experience + 1.5 stars for cheap price = 5 stars

review.user_review_title: standard New Balance fit, very lightweight, not as supportive as heavier boots
review.user_review: These boots are very lightweight for hiking boots. Compared to heavier boots, they are not as supportive, but they do work surprisingly well for the weight. I've worn them on hilly rocky 10 mile hikes (light backpack only) and my feet were comfortable at the end of the day. I did replace the insoles with after-market insoles that have more cushioning and more arch support (which I do with all my boots and shoes). I wouldn't use these boots carrying camping gear or other heavy loads, but that is what the "light hiking" in the product name implies. Construction seems good, but durability is questionable for the lightweight materials, so I bought an extra pair when the price was $50. I wouldn't pay $100 for these boots just because of the durability issue.

review.user_review_title: very nice general purpose sports socks
review.user_review: These are very nice general purpose sports socks. These socks are contoured and close fitting to avoid bunching up and causing blisters, like cheap socks can do. The socks have some high-density cushioning along the sole and heel, while the upper side is thinner and more breathable. I wear size 9 shoes and the size large socks fit me well (according to the size chart, size large is men's shoe size 9-12). 4 stars because I'm also very happy with cheaper sports socks from other major brands.

review.user_review_title: very comfortable and supportive, but noticeably heavier than swimming trunks with a mesh liner
review.user_review:
These "hydrovolley" shorts are noticeably heavier than Speedo swimming trunks with the traditional mesh liner. However, the inner compression shorts are very comfortable and more supportive than a mesh liner. As the product name implies, these "hydrovolley" shorts are more for all-day use when you're spending more time on the beach than in the water. The compression liner dries reasonably quickly after swimming (if the weather is warm), but not as fast as a mesh liner.

Speedo sizes run a little large. See the attached size chart.

review.user_review:
For people who complain that these are not hiking boots, of course they are not. The title of the product is "walking shoe". Yes, they are kind of styled like hiking boots, but the construction is more like a walking shoe. The outer sole has a grippy rubber and minimal lugs, which is great on pavement, but not on mud. The midsole is kind of flexy, which is great on pavement, but not on rocks. The leather upper is stylish and weather resistant, but lighter weight and less durable than what you usually find on hiking boots. These shoes have EVA midsoles which are comfortable, but break down much more quickly than the polyurethane midsoles found on serious hiking boots. I hope that these boots last more than a year of regular use. For the $70 sale price, these boots are a fine value, but not at the $100 retail price.

Sizing is fine for me. I bought my normal size 9 and it fits great. Length is fine. Width is on the narrow side, which I prefer. If you have extra wide feet, order a wider size, not a longer size. These do come in 3 different widths.

review.user_review_title: Very Happy so far~handles Pom hair great
review.user_review:
Mine came with the attatched dusting tool shown in the pictures above. I had some trouble putting it together as my hands were not strong enough to get the bolts in all the way. My kind young neighbor man came and did that for me and I finished the rest.

It feels like it is self propelled as it pulled me across the carpet. I must admit it is bigger and heaver than I thought it would be. This is what I consider a full size sweeper. I am used to my little Eureka optima that just died and this is more to handle but the pet tool is worth it. That little tool gets Pom hair off the furniture so easy. Twelve amps of suction is great and the tools are all on board. Strong suction with the tools.

It does blow out the front some but I am used to that, it is not as bad as my Optima was at all. I like that it empties form the bottom and not the top. It is worth the seventy-four bucks I paid at the local mart store. It has a 2 year warranty so that is pretty good these days. The other Optima I had 5 years and it was about fifty bucks here at Amazon, I think I got my moneys worth.

And the added bonus is it is purple my favorite color If it were a might smaller it would be a 5 star review.

review.user_review_title: Great Picture Conversion and a Few Things They don't Make clear
review.user_review:
When I purchased this I was not sure it was going to work with my TV. I want to let those with 1080i max HDTV's that it lets you set it for your set. The menus can be a bit tricky until you get familiar. As a quick clue when you hit set up on the remote you need to use the right arrow to access the Video menu. You need to set the 1080i there or your SD DVD's will not upcovert. Once you get that done ENJOY! I couldn't believe my JAG DVD's in HD, WOW. I highly recommend using an HDMI cable. This is a great unit for the money.

I find the remote just fine, others think it doesn't weigh enough. It is straight forward and easy to use what a pleasant surprise.
