review.user_review_title: Wow~Blown away by Crisp pure sounds.
review.user_review:
I am blown away almost literally these speakers rock. I have them hooked to a 40 yr old Pioneer amplifier. My father had built this Heathkit credenza heathkit speakers and trully I have thought it was better than anything out there. I can play through just these 2 and also add my originals but no need these are so crisp. I can hear pings of guitar strings and instruments I never knew were in the songs. This is so at low volume and blasting loud. Some speakers just get loud but distort the crisp sound not these. I can feel the bass at low volume making for a beautiful rich tone.

These speakers are sleek and modern looking. You can use them with or without the speaker cloth snap on covers. The grain in the black ash adds a nice decor note to them. I have them 12 feet apart and the sound is amazing almost surround feeling. I want to hook to my TV but will need an updated amplifier as my aux is taken for CD changer, looking forward to when I can do that.

I have to tell you about this company they are top of the chart in customer service. As a vine member I got these free in exchange for the review. Through a series of events we all just got one speaker not two. Kinda hard to review stereo with one. The company stepped up to the plate and sent out the second speaker to us. I also had some questions on hook up and Michael at Klipsch went so far to download a copy of my 40 yr old amplifier manual so he could help me specifically and emailed me a copy of it. He answered all my questions. That is a company I want to do repeat business with a real person to talk to who was delightful to talk with.

You need to order two as this listing is for one speaker only. You will need speaker wire at least 16 wire to hook them up. There are two sets of hook ups on each speaker.

Hope you enjoy these as much as I am.......quality without breaking the bank. I notice the price fluctuates here so keep your eye on it they are really reasonable at times.

description: It may be mid-size, but there's nothing mediocre about the KF-26 floor standing speaker. Though compact, this speaker is packed with the best in audio technology for room-filling, audiophile-worthy sound. The KF-26 is complete with our proprietary Tractrix Horn technology which produces a unique combination of precision, clarity and effortless power. Finished in a beautiful black ash wood grain vinyl veneer, the KF-26 boasts a modern elegance ideal for any decor. The Klipsch Icon series has always made a distinct statement for the brand. With the introduction of this enhanced series, listeners will discover re-engineered drivers throughout combined with a new crossover system. Improved cosmetics, including a striking finish, new logos and feet, result in the most modern, high-performance Klipsch Icon speakers to date. Beginning in 1946, company founder, Paul W. Klipsch believed four principles to be the foundation for great sound. Together, these four design principles-high efficiency with low distortion, controlled directivity, flat frequency response, and wide dynamic range-have and always will be the foundation for our stunningly powerful and precise sound. Every Klipsch Icon speaker utilizes our Tractrix Horn technology for lifelike sound, more output using less energy, improved reliability, reduced distortion and a large soundstage with well-defined imaging. Aluminum tweeter with linear travel suspension allows the high-frequency driver to move back and forth in a seamless motion, creating less distortion and detailed highs.

review.user_review_title: Works okay...think in newer homes it may work better.
review.user_review:
I got this so I can set up a roku or streaming dvd player in my basement. I have wireless router but it just was not enough for streaming movies in my basement. This kit uses the wiring in your house to increase the signal strength for better streaming. It is easy to set up simply plug one unit at location where router is plugging the cable provided to router and outlet. You can then plug your surge protector into the Netgear extra outlet. You cannot use the outlet in an extension cord. You choose where to place the second outlet by the indicator light on the unit. You want the plug LED to be green or amber for best results. Once located plug your equipment into the Netgear with provided cable. Next you secure the connection by pressing the security button for two seconds. Then within two minutes press the security button on second unit. You are now setup to have a stronger faster connection. Good solution when in a remote part of the house wifi does not stream fast enough.

I take off a star as it does have the flow thru outlet but the remaining one will now only handle a small two prong outlet. You also have to have a 3 prong grounded outlet to start with. I have limited number of those updated in my 59 yr old house. It works in my older home but not as well as I would like. I think in new homes it will be much better.

review.user_review: I got this to replace my Comcast modem mostly because it looked the same--only white instead of black.  It was pretty easy to install because I already had a similar modem hooked up.  There were a few frustrating minutes before I was able to rename the WiFi hotspot and set up a password to get most of my devices working.  A printer and Internet radio I had to hit the button on the top of the unit before they would find the new WiFi.  Overall it works fine and it is good if you want something pretty basic.  And the tower design fits nicely in my TV stand.

review.user_review_title: You mainly pay for the bottles
review.user_review:
Just to be clear: this water should be holy water for how expensive actually is. However, I did purchase one bottle at an airport and I was captivated to find (FINALLY) something, not in plastic which encourages the customer to write their name on the bottle and refill it. The bottle is great and I used it for work. It is light but it keeps the water colder than glass or plastic.
Now let's go to the ALKALINE part: Scientific Evidence to support ALKALINE WATER = ZERO. Everything you hear and read about the benefits of alkaline water is just marketing strategies. Do not believe, not for a single second, that alkaline water is going to help you with diseases and or improve the overall health. I know it might sound silly, but I just wanted the black bottles to handle to guests in my house, or friends to encourage them to refill the water bottle. The Alkaline water bottle is more visually captivating than the white one (regular Path water). Overall, I am happy with the purchase, but I won't regularly buy it because it is WATER and it is very expensive. However, I wanted to support the idea or promoting refilling...

P.S. The package comes with no plastic.

A product‚Äôs ‚Äúuseful life‚Äù means the period during which the product (a) has sufficient memory capacity and other required technical capabilities to utilize current map data and (b) is capable of operating as intended without major repairs. A product will be deemed to be out of service and its useful life to be ended if no updates have been downloaded for such product for a period of 24 months or more. Unless otherwise stated, the updates you receive under the subscription will be updates to the same geographic map data originally included with your Garmin product when originally purchased. In some instances, your Garmin product might not have sufficient memory remaining for you to load an update to the map data, in which case you will need to either (a) select reduced map data coverage for your updates, or (b) purchase separately a microSD‚Ñ¢/SD‚Ñ¢ card (if and as applicable to your Garmin product) and load all or a portion of the map data coverage for your updates to the card and insert the card into the microSD/SD card slot contained in your Garmin product. review.user_review:
For now, I give to these shoes five stars because they look really nice and it seems that they have a good arch support. I ordered the 2E version because I have flat feet and 2E is necessary for me. They fit as expected and they are good enough to be a good office option. This because they are not like sneakers but they look more elegant but casual at the same time.

I stand every day for more than 6 hours, I have a standing desk. I will update this review with how these shoes will hold after a couple of days and in terms of support offered.

After day 1: 10 hours standing on these shoes + my orthotic insoles = feet perfectly rested. I love the fact that the 2E are very good for flat feet with plenty of space so the foot is not constricted in the shoes (reason of pain and discomfort after a prolonged standing).

After 1 Week: Still amazing, a great arch support so my feet are well supported during my standing time. Shoes are soft and they don't bother me at all. I would like to buy another pair in different color to alternate because they really are great.

review.user_review_title: essential oil diffuser that goes with any home decor.
review.user_review:
[[VIDEOID:983da689f05dad6d139bb8af3712a205]] ‚òÄ i received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review. i was not influenced by anyone in any way of my opinion of this product.

This essential diffuser has a unique style to it. Goes with any home decor. It is easy assemble, easy to turn on and off. Has a max fill line so you know how much water to put in it. The water reservoir will hold 100mk. I also suggest using distilled water especially if you are going to be using it more as a humidifier for breathing at night. You will get 4-7 hours of mist, depending really on how much water you put in. If you fill 1/2 way to max line, you will get less time.

When cleaning, I suggest cleaning about once a week. Wipe out with a warm wet cloth. This will help keep bacteria out. Especially if you are using essential oils in your new diffuser. If you don't clean it out, the oils can clog the mist hole, which then it may stop working, so you really should clean it. I personally clean mine out daily or every other day if I use essential oils. And always unplug your diffuser before cleaning.

I absolutely love diffusers. They have become a must in my home, in every room. My husband has to have one on at night while sleeping. He sometimes puts Lavender essential oil scent in. Lavender essential oils, help you to relax for a good nights rest.

Can be nice in a child's room to put child to sleep with it's LED light show. The colors will fade in and out then start all over giving a relaxing mood.

review.user_review_title: fresh outlook and a fashionable way to improve privacy
review.user_review:
i received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review. I was not influenced by anyone in any way.

I'm starting to become a huge fan of window film now. I have discovered the benefits of them, how nice they can look and how easy they are to install.

I personally sometimes do not even use a squeegee and water to apply. Some, and it depends on the quality I guess, not sure, but I can simply apply with my hands. My issue is getting it cut to the right width and length. I can never get that part 100% perfect. But then again, I'm no professional, so I make due with how I apply it. I do though, love the look after I'm done. I got my attic windows done and now I'm working on my garage windows. I think this frosted look window film will be the best for me. It will keep people from being lookie lue's as they are called, from looking in our windows when they walk or drive by. I really hate that. It will keep some of the sun out, yet just enough light.

You will need to wipe down your windows to get the dirt off before you begin, or the film will not be as effective to stick and stay on. And getting the air bubbles out can be a little challenging, but the end results are well worth it. Using this window frosted film, is a fashionable way to improve privacy or block unwanted views. Providing you with the privacy you want and need. I love the way it allows natural light to enter the room while preventing anyone from seeing in.

Another awesome thing about this is that this window privacy film is also removable, reusable and UV-protected. For best results, use on a flat, smooth surface. Wet window to apply film (shiny side goes against the window). Decorative window film is for indoor use only.

--------
I will always be honest in my reviews. I know that being a consumer myself, I want to see honest reviews, not a 4-5 star just to make a seller happy. My husband and I rely on reviews for our buying decisions as well.

review.user_review_title: do away with cable and use an antenna
review.user_review:
[[VIDEOID:7cd66335e07fde710b2ca4839869f847]] ‚òÖ i received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review. I was not influenced by anyone in any way.

When this first arrived, I was not sure about it. My husband told me he would check it out and install it and see what happens. He's the expert on this kind of stuff. So, up in the attack he went. We already have a HUGE antenna in the attic and it works good. But this one works a lot better. We don't have cable anymore. We refuse to give our money to that when we can have free over the air free channels with just an antenna. Yes, it works from the attic down into the house living room and master bedroom.

He hooked it up real quick with the included velcro and told me he will organize it better when he has more time. But so far it's been like a week and this antenna works awesome. We in fact have better reception. We get the double channels. Meaning there are usually 2 of the same channels and before only one came in. The bigger antenna would take longer to, as I put it, focus. But not with this one. The channel of choice comes up faster. So, we are getting rid of the bigger one and from now on using this antenna. I was surprised that it worked from up in the attic and I think my husband was too. It's up and out of the way and works great.

The antenna is simple to hook up, it comes with velcro so you can easily install it in your attic too or by a window. But keeping it up in the attic, would be out of the way. Our house is almost 2400 sq ft. and it's a one story, just in case you are wondering how big our house is for it to be working.

‚ù§Ô∏è PROS:
‚Ä¢compact
‚Ä¢light weight
‚Ä¢works from the attic

‚ù§Ô∏è CONS:
‚Ä¢none

review.user_review_title: I Either Feel Young Again or Forgot How Fantastic Weiss's is
review.user_review:
I'm certainly not young nor did I forget how much I like this soup. Chicken noodle soup provided me with almost the only nourishment I fixed as a youngster and those memories do not leave. Nor does the taste. I stopped fixing chicken soup for quite some time and only returned lately and when I found Mrs. Weiss's I re-found chicken soup at its best.

Unlike some chicken soups in a bag, this one has noodle sized noodles and not those little things that can get lost in a gap in two teeth. Nor is the flavor overpowering in any specific taste other than just plain good. It is simple to make. If I can make it, it is simple to make. Even though the pouch is larger than some other brands, it goes down the hatch so well I hardly notice the difference in quantity. I gave the dogs a sample and they think is is a new brand of food for them. Where's the chicken. A taste was sufficient. I guess that makes us greedy and so be it. I heartily recommend Mrs. Weiss and expect to be in line for the next order.

I had asked what each box contained and several of the kind Amazon family responded that it has 2 containers for what turned out to be 2 different meals. Thanks for the replies. Please excuse me, soup's on.

review.user_review_title: My Taste Glands Received the Best Tastes Ever
review.user_review:
I have been testing as many aspects of this fantastic product as I can and not one time did I find a fail. Each application worked perfectly and I am a convert to Viva Labs Organic Cacao Powder (VIVA). I readily admit to being a closet chocoholic and constantly seek chocolate/cacao related items that satisfy my sweet tooth.

The best aspect of VIVA is its flexibility in flavoring. It has no sugar, so if I am whipping up a platter of brownies, I have to adjust the additives with care. Take a tablespoon of VIVA and add, incrementally, a fixed amount of sugar, say ¬º teaspoon until the desired amount of sweetness has been established. A little time consuming? Yep, but well worth the little extra time. The next time you have a beginning point for extrapolation. The flavor difference is similar to a firecracker exploding and a stick of dynamite blasting a flavor hole in your tongue.

When I want a quick pick me up, I sprinkle a light covering of VIVA on scoops of vanilla ice cream and get a shock to my taste glands. All of these goodies and a nutrition fact set that makes folks on restricted diets (diabetes) jump for joy.

review.user_review_title: May I propose a Toaster of the First Order
review.user_review:
We wanted a simple, 4 slice toaster that did not take up the whole counter and actually toasted bread and bagels without fuss. We bought the T-Fal for that solution and only wish we had bought it a few years ago. I decided on a simple approach and set the timer to the mid range instead of going from the bottom to the top and trying to remember which one was the best. The middle range worked perfectly for me the first time and it is now the default setting. I sure wish everything could be that simple. While doing other chores the countdown timer is working within sight and the dinger goes off when complete. The crumb tray is easy to take out and clean. The push up handle elevates the bread to a satisfactory height for removal. The black color is unobtrusive and few finger prints show even though they are present.

It is wonderful to have products that have advanced the art of cooking. This is one of those. I recall as a child we would put two pieces of white bread on either side of the toaster and plug it in so the coils would start cooking. We would keep an eye on it and when you either smelled it burning or were lucky and caught it in time you could open the doors and the bread would slide down so you could return the bread to the coils in an effort to cook the other side. What a pain compared to this product. Hoorah for technology and all it has done for us.

description: Enjoy 2 long slices of bread browned to your preference thanks to the T-fal TL6802002 4-Slice Digital Toaster. Its 8 different browning settings enable a precise and adjustable browning control. The T-fal Digital Toaster features a Bagel function that toasts the outside and gently warms the inside - the way a bagel should be toasted. review.user_review_title: OXO is Number ONE with me
review.user_review: What a delightful spinner.  My old plastic OXO spinner literally wore out and this is a welcome addition.  It spins liquids from vegetables quite properly and leaves only a glimmer of moisture.  Sometimes I will clean the salad or greens with water and then run it through the spinner with some vinegar and olive oil.  Everything cleans well and quickly.  This model keeps the plunger out of sight when not in use and therefore making it a little handier to work with.  The braking button works fine and does not take away from the overall design.  In fact the overall design is perfect for me and my uses.  Additionally, I like the steel better than the plastic even though the plastic usually is cheaper.  The steel just looks better and holds up well especially in the dishwasher.

description: Product Description

The most important step of making any salad? Washing the greens. Which is where the OXO Steel Salad Spinner comes in. It includes a basket that can be used as a colander and a stainless steel bowl (complete with a non-slip base), which doubles as a serving vessel. To use, just rinse your leaves and drop the basket into place. Put the lid on and use the non-slip pump to get things spinning. Give it a few pumps and then hit the brake to stop the motion. The lid comes apart for thorough cleaning and the pump locks into place for storage. Dishwasher safe.
Brand Story
By OXO

review.user_review: Now I feel safe when taking my pies to an event because I know the Pie Container will not fail me regardless of what I put inside.  Hot, cold:  it does not matter; it works well.  I was hesitant at first when seeing the circa 2 inch hinge; however, that is of no concern to me now.  In years it may fail but by then it probably will not matter.  Even if it did fail the integrity of the container is sufficiently well made so as not to have alarm.  I appreciate a well thought out product and this is just that.  The thickness permits seeing the pie or whatever inside and I can be assured that nothing has spilled and even if it did because of a tight fast turn it just means that I can be prepared to clean it when I arrive.  The seal is tight enough to keep the contents fresh and cut down on air exchange.  Bottom Line:  Well worth the price and I will get at least one or two more soon.

review.user_review_title: Slick, Light, Powerful and Just Handy as can BE
review.user_review:
For many years I sought a cordless upright vacuum cleaner and broke bad with one that is similar to this one. Regardless, it does not compare favorably to this Shark Ultralight Upright.

This is our 3rd Shark and while this is not the Rocket it has similar qualities. It is light and easy to move around plus it has a big bag of accessories similar to the Rocket. The 30' cord makes our entire home available (almost) with one hook up. So I have divided the home into two zones and that way I know where to begin the next time it is cleaning time.

Expect a full complement of tools to assist with the job. Expect emptying the cannister frequently if the home has not been cleaned in a while. It takes me at least two empties to do the job but that is just the floor. When I do the furniture and other 'up' items it is 3 to 4 empties. The cannister is light and has the on/off switch in a practical location. If the long tube is unneeded it switches out easily to accomadate other tools. It may have a tendency to heat up a little but for me that is good. It forces me to take a break so that I do not fibrulate too much.

Even though we are fully delighted to use this vacuum we yearn for the day that someone makes a true cordless and effective vacuum that lasts more than 10 to 15 minutes without having a 3 hours or more charging time.

review.user_review_title: The Speed is Blinding or Just Plain Fast
review.user_review:
What a delightful letdown. I cleared my calendar, desk and whatever else interrupts most normal humans to set my new TP-LINK up. Having attended similar dances before, I knew that it would take more than just plugging it in and even following skimpy instructions. The instructions were as clear as any instructions I have read in recent years. Each element made sense and the A to Z setup went exactly as told. Instruction pictures matched the product and each part went together and made me feel almost smart. Anyone can slide a plug into a hole or an antenna into the back and I proved that the AC2600 is a terrific router.

In less than an hour I had full access to my little world thanks in part to a speedy and working wireless router. It works well with just a few screens open and just as well with 10 screens open. I experienced no lags and keep in mind I am using DLS and not broadband at a treble cost factor. I have yet to encounter any facet of drag or interruptions even during what has been called the busiest time of the year as far as the internet is concerned. Before installing AC2600, I would have to slow down for my previous connection to catch up and I am not a fast typist. Now, I cannot be caught by the setup. I have not had to clean cookies once today while I had to clean every hour or so under the other setup.

MU-MIMO serves more devices at once for faster Wi-Fi and less wait time. Enjoy non-stop entertainment on your smartphones, smart TVs, and game consoles and experience high-speed connections during heavy network traffic thanks to a powerful 1.4GHz dual-core CPU. review.user_review:
Allocating 5 out of 5 stars for this PonoMusic Player (Pono) is insufficient for what I consider to be the best player of its kind that I have ever experienced. That includes from the alleged best of the best and down to the many of less quality. For what it can do, it does better than any of the remainder. It fits in my hand with ease. A small screen is easily visible and easy to navigate from one entry to another.

First impressions were unbelievable and astonishing. I expected a larger footprint. It arrived in a neatly wrapped package of some of the best engineering I have seen. The bamboo box told me I was holding a quality package and when I opened the contents and found that it was packaged with the same intensity as the bamboo box. I hated to even open such fine craftsmanship, but I also wanted to see the player and use it. I made several connectors to be used with historical 8 Ohms speakers ranging in size from 15" mega speakers to several different sized bookshelf speakers. Those old speakers relayed sounds that I have only heard from professional players found in audio visual stores manufactured by top of the line A/V equipment. Pono out performed any receiver and player I have at home and it is portable.

I normally do not disturb the relic speakers and spend considerable time listening to music or words originating from wireless speakers. Pono accepted the sounds and reproduced them with accuracy I did not expect; however, I certainly can expect more of the same from them as long as Pono is working. With a 64Gb of memory, there is less chance of maximizing its storage. I took a 32Gb and several smaller thumb drives and sent their sounds through Pono without a hint of problems.

I have visited most items in the instructions available from Pono and while I have a few more to check out there is nothing missing from the Pono's ability bank that I need now. My ultimate objective is to figure out the recipe for making my 'smart TV' play sounds from it through Pono to several external wireless of non-wireless speakers. If anyone knows the answer to that conundrum, please do not be bashful. Tell me.

the PonoPlayer is designed for sharing the music‚Äîyou can plug two pairs of headphones in at the same time for simultaneous listening

review.user_review:
As a disclaimer, my computer keyboard (KB) needs are modest and certainly undemanding unlike many sophisticated users. I need a KB that can keep up with my slug speed: This 5000 fully exceeds my needs. I want a comfortable place to rest my palms when typing long documents: Thanks, 5000. You, again, excel.

In fact, I have almost nothing but positives for this device and its companion mouse with a few exceptions. The keyboard does not light up. That could be altered with one that makes for a cost that would more than double the cost. I supplement my KB with a small 14 LED desk lamp and my problem is solved.

The KB's internal LED that lights up when it is battery changing time could be better in terms of notification; however, when the key is struck and nothing happens, there is a 98% chance that it is due to insufficient power coming out of the batteries. I keep 4 AA batteries on the desk, behind the KB just for that purpose - 2 for the KB and the other 2 for the mouse. Finally, the white characters have a propensity to disappear due to repeated striking. My E and D left several months ago and the A is on its way. The characters are just stamped on and not even indented. That too is O.K. Shucks I learned where those letters were in 1956 and have not forgotten them yet.

I try to clean the mouse and KB with a small headed vacuum attachment, a stiff bristle brush and an old toothbrush. The first one I bought bit the dust when I was not paying attention to its placement on the floor and stepped on it with my clunkers and 250# of 'gotta go.'

review.user_review_title: Quality:  A Word NOT Missing from Wigwam's Vocabulary
review.user_review:
These are like my Sunday Go To Church socks, but we country folks seldom wear socks to church. They fit my 13DDs perfectly and even after washing. They do not fall regardless of my activity. When one of my docs told me that I had to wear white socks, he did not tell me what kind, just white. So I bought some of those and then some of the other seller's and so forth until I stumbled across these. The price point per pair is somewhat higher than the other guy's but well worth it. As a kid and living alone, I always bought Wigwam. That was when activity meant something considerably different from today's use.

No shrinkage. No piled knots all over the socks. No internal strings that get hung up on toe-nails. I bought a three pack of quality and excellence while expecting them to last longer than a few times wear.

review.user_review:
This rod that I have is the white one and it has a nice appearance. There is an instructions sheet wrapped around the rod. The instructions say very simply to turn the rod in opposite directions to lengthen or shorten the rod. After the two ends touch the walls you are to continue turning to increase the tension until the rod is solidly in place.

I followed the instructions to install the rod for my shower which is lined with ceramic tile. The ends of the rod are quite slippery as is the ceramic tile. I was unable to secure the rod firmly enough to support a shower curtain. The rod would fall on its own even when no shower curtain was attached.

This is a failure as a shower curtain rod but I was able to install it in my workshop where I used fasteners to hold it in place. I use it to hang shop cloths to dry that I have washed. I also hang chamois cloths to dry after being used to wash my vehicles. The curtain rod rings come in handy anytime I need to hang something for temporary storage.

I would not recommend this for hanging a shower curtain. However, if you just need an adjustable rod for hanging something very light weight or if you can find a different use by installing it with fasteners then this may work for you. I should point out that this is made in China so don't expect too much.

review.user_review: My preference is to use bags rather than rolls. That is not to say that bags are better then rolls but just that they are more convenient IMHO. Most of the time I use the quart size for storing leftovers from meals. But, there are times when a larger bag is needed and these fit the bill to perfection. They are easy to use with my FoodSaver and they maintain a tight vacuum. These are quality bags at a reasonable price. It is difficult to wax eloquent over something as simple as a bag but if you need a gallon size bag and don't feel like cutting from a roll then get yourself a box of these and you will be satisfied with their performance.

review.user_review:
The router that I have been using to stream movies was erratic. Mostly it was very slow and sometimes it would not connect at all. My TV is about 35 feet from the router. I was hopeful that this Linksys would be an improvement. Inside the Linksys box was a CD, Quick Start Guide, Power Cable, Internet Cable and 3 butt-ugly antennas. I followed the instructions in the Quick Start Guide with the first step being installation of the antennas. My hobby is doing handy man work so I do not have slim, delicate fingers. There is a ledge on the back of the router that extends right over the antenna connections which makes it difficult for a set sturdy fingers to negotiate the antenna installations. However, after having completed that step and the remaining ones in the Quick Start Guide I proceeded to stream a movie from my subscription to Amazon Prime. The router seemed to work OK but I did not notice any speed improvement during the streaming setup and during the movie loading. So, other than being as ugly as home made sin this router seems to perform as any average run of the mill router.

This is what the cnet editors had to say about this router:

The good: The Linksys EA6900 Smart WiFi Wireless AC Router AC1900 sports powerful hardware to offer superfast Wi-Fi speed at close range. The router boasts a compact and practical design.

The bad: The Linksys EA6900 has a long list of issues, including an unstable 5GHz band, a nonworking USB 3.0 port, a glitchy Linksys Smart Wi-Fi cloud-based feature, and overheating. Its performance over longer range is also not as good as similarly configured routers, and there are no new features.

The bottom line: Plagued by issues, the Linksys EA6900 Smart WiFi Wireless AC Router AC1900 is only as good as a single-band router and hence not worth its premium price.

description: Perfect for HD video streaming, this dual band router delivers speeds of up to N600 + AC1300 Mbps. Four Gigabit Ethernet ports make it easy to share data quickly across your network and to external devices. You can use the high performance USB 3.0 port to attach a storage device and quickly transfer large files or share devices across your Wi Fi network. Plus, the USB 2.0 port is perfect for smaller file transfers or a dedicated printer. Beamforming focuses the Wi Fi signal directly to your smartphones, tablets and laptops instead of sending out a general transmission for a more efficient network with a wider range. Smart Wi Fi lets you access your network anytime, anywhere. Using your browser or the Smart Wi Fi mobile app, you can prioritize devices or websites, control content, monitor network activity and more. Advanced WPA2 encryption and SPI firewall help keep your network and personal information safe and secure.

description: Product Description
A DVD Recorder/VCR Combo that allows you to easily preserve your memories or record favorite terrestrial HD programming.
From the Manufacturer

Intuitive graphical interface makes programming your recording easy. Seven VHS recording speeds let you record up to 8 hours per tape. Plus, enjoy the convenience of one-touch recording from disc to tape or the reverse. The DVD deck lets you experience high picture-quality playback from a wide variety of formats, including DVD, VCD, VCR, VHS, SVHS, music CD and more. Progressive scan playback, HDMI output and 720p/1080i upscaling from DVD/VCR deliver optimal picture quality. You can even control your DV and Digital8 camcorder for editing via the i.LINK interface.

review.user_review: This switch has been a pleasant surprise. I have a cable that runs from a router in my house to my office which is located in a separate building behind the house. The switch is in my office and performs flawlessly. I have a desktop connected to the switch and am able to transfer large files with ease. I have a phone system connected to it that works better than my landline. I have a wireless access point connected to it for the use of my netbook which is located on the opposite side of my office. This has been a unexpectedly useful investment.

description: Product Description
The NETGEAR FS105NA Unmanaged Desktop Switch features 5-Ports with 10/100 Mbps Fast Ethernet, ProSAFE Lifetime Protection and more.
Amazon.com

The NETGEAR FS105 ProSafe 5-Port 10/100 Desktop Switch offers:
Five 10/100 Mbps auto-sensing UTP ports.
Five 10/100 Mbps auto-sensing UTP ports.
Simple installation with no software to install.
Simple installation with no software to install.

Fanless design for silent operation. The NETGEAR FS105 ProSafe 5-Port 10/100 Desktop Switch provides your local area network (LAN) with a reliable 10/100 Mbps auto-sensing connectivity for five users. LEDs let you check the status of connections at a glance. View larger. Sturdy and Reliable Design NETGEAR's FS100 series desktop switches are housed in a compact sturdy metal case designed without the need for internal fans, keeping operation both silent and more reliable. It can be placed on a flat surface or you can use the included wall mount kit. Simple Setup and Stellar Performance Plug in your Ethernet cables and connect a power cord, and you're ready to go. There is no software to install or settings to configure. The switch features auto negotiation, which automatically obtains the fastest possible connection, and Auto Uplink takes care of the MDI/MDI-X connection. There are no toggle switches or special crossover cables. If your network has existing 10BASE-T devices, they will work seamlessly within a higher bandwidth environment with each port achieving its full speed.  Every port supports up to 200 Mbps in dedicated bandwidth. Automatic flow control ensures smooth traffic. The FS105 has 64 KB of buffer memory and an address database size of 1,000. The switch has status LEDs for power, and link, speed, and activity for each port.  The NETGEAR FS105 ProSafe 5-Port 10/100 Desktop Switch has a Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF) of 390,000 hours and is backed by a lifetime warranty. The power adapter is backed by a 2-year warranty. What's in the Box FS105 Desktop Switch, wall-mount kit, power adapter, quick installation guide, warranty/support information card.

Plug in your Ethernet cables and connect a power cord, and you're ready to go. There is no software to install or settings to configure. The switch features auto negotiation, which automatically obtains the fastest possible connection, and Auto Uplink takes care of the MDI/MDI-X connection. There are no toggle switches or special crossover cables. If your network has existing 10BASE-T devices, they will work seamlessly within a higher bandwidth environment with each port achieving its full speed.

Every port supports up to 200 Mbps in dedicated bandwidth. Automatic flow control ensures smooth traffic. The FS105 has 64 KB of buffer memory and an address database size of 1,000. The switch has status LEDs for power, and link, speed, and activity for each port.
The NETGEAR FS105 ProSafe 5-Port 10/100 Desktop Switch has a Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF) of 390,000 hours and is backed by a lifetime warranty. The power adapter is backed by a 2-year warranty.
What's in the Box
FS105 Desktop Switch, wall-mount kit, power adapter, quick installation guide, warranty/support information card.
From the Manufacturer

NETGEAR's popular FS105 series desktop switch, known for reliability and performance, provides your LAN with high-speed, 10/100 Mbps auto-sensing connectivity for as many as 5 users. Just plug in your Ethernet cables, connect a power cord, and you're ready to go--there's no software to configure. It negotiates to the fastest possible connection and with Auto Uplink technology, this switch automatically figures out if the link needs a straight-through or cross-over connection, and makes the right choice. Existing 10BASE-T devices are easily integrated within higher bandwidth environments, with full wire speeds on all ports of either 10 Mbps or 100 Mbps. Engineered without the need for internal fans, it operates silently. And this very compact switch is housed in a sturdy metal case for years of dependable use.

When you want solid network performance for your growing business, plus the added benefit of quiet operation, NETGEAR's ProSafe¬ô FS105 is your best choices for quality, convenience, and smooth - running usability - all at a very affordable price.
At Your Service
Five ports provide LAN access for many users. Every port supports up to 200 Mbps in dedicated bandwidth and traffic is forwarded flawlessly with automatic flow control.
Compact

Solidly built in small sizes that are easy to position when space is at a premium. Ideal for conference rooms, class rooms, study groups or small offices. Place it on any flat surface or use the included wall mount kit to tuck it out of the way.
Simple To Use

Once you connect the hardware, your switch is operating! Auto negotiation takes care of the speed and duplex, while Auto Uplink takes care of the MDI/MDI-X connection. Eliminate the need for toggle switches or special crossover cables.
Quiet
No fan means no noise, which helps maintain a peaceful atmosphere in your busy office.

description: Personalized style meets high-tech functionality with the Diesel On Full Guard touchscreen smartwatch. A black IP case is paired with a brown leather strap and a customizable touchscreen dial. Full Guard stands out with the Diesel On Interactive Effects. You can choose from three modes to keep up to date with animated notifications from weather, activity, and do not disturb mode. Powered with Wear OS by Google, this smartwatch connects with your favorite apps and is compatible with Apple and Android smartphones. With built-in fitness tracking through Google Fit, you can view calories burned, steps and distance traveled. Receive notifications, such as calls and alerts, at a glance as well. Fully personalize your watch by selecting or customizing the watch face of your choice and changing out the straps to match your activity or look. Wear OS by Google works with phones running Android 4.4+ (excluding Go edition) or iOS 9.3+. Supported features may vary between platforms and countries. Wear OS by Google is a trademark of Google LLC. To avoid damage to your watch, only use with included charger. Do not use a USB hub, USB splitter, USB y-cable, battery pack or other peripheral device to charge.

review.user_review:
PROS

1. The beans are vacuum packed in plastic to maintain their freshness. On opening the seal, I found the beans to be fresh and aromatic.
2. These are Planifolia beans, which are the most common type.
3. These are Grade B vanilla beans (about 20% moisture; Grade A is about 30% moisture). They are suitable for making vanilla extract, which is perfect for my purposes, because that‚Äôs what I use vanilla beans for.
4. The price is quite reasonable.

CONS

1. I cannot find any information at all about this company on the Web, which makes it impossible to discover the source of its vanilla beans.

GENERAL INFORMATION ON VANILLA BEANS

Grades of Vanilla Beans. There are two grades of vanilla beans: (1) Grade A Prime Gourmet (‚ÄúGrade A‚Äù), which is about 30% moisture. Grade A is used for cooking, but it can also be used for making vanilla extract. (2) Grade B Extract (‚ÄúGrade B‚Äù), which is about 20% moisture. Grade B is only useful for making extract because it is typically too dry to use for cooking. (Note that if a recipe calls for vanilla beans, you use the whole bean, not just the inner, tiny seeds.)

Species of Vanilla Beans. There are only two species of vanilla beans: Tahitensis (commonly referred to as Tahitian vanilla beans) and Planifolia (commonly referred to as Madagascar beans, Madagascar Bourbon beans, or Bourbon beans). Tahitian vanilla beans, naturally enough, originated in Tahiti. But since Tahiti is so small, it doesn‚Äôt product much vanilla beans. Papua New Guinea produces far more Tahitensis beans.

Planifolia is the flavor that people are most familiar with. It is what supermarket vanilla extract is made from. Though Planifolia originally comes from Madagascar (hence the name), it is grown in tropical and subtropical climates around the world. The biggest producers of vanilla are: Madagascar (2,926 metric tons), Indonesia (2304 MT), China (885 MT), Mexico (513 MT), and Papua New Guinea (200 MT).

World Market. The US is by far the largest consumer of vanilla, at 44% of the world market. France is next at 17.8%, Germany at 10.6%, Canada at 5.57%, and downward from there.

Cultivation and Curing of Vanilla Beans. This is the step-by-step process: (1) Planting: Vanilla beans grow on a type of orchid vine which is planted next to a host tree which supports the vanilla vine as it grows. Large cuttings (24 to 36 inches) take up to 3 years to root and flower. Smaller cuttings take up to 4 years. (2) Pollination: Each vanilla flower must be hand pollinated by highly skilled workers. (3) Harvesting: Vanilla beans are not ripe enough to be harvested until 6-9 months after pollination. The beans are hand-picked, one at a time, at the most desirable moment of ripeness in order to ensure the maximum flavor possible before the bean becomes overripe and the pod begins to split. (4) Sorting: The newly picked beans are sorted and graded. Grade A beans are 6 inches (16 cm) and above, blemish-free, uniform in size, dark-chocolate-brown, and visibly oily, plump and pliable due to a moisture level of around 30%. Grade B beans can be as small as 3 inches long (8 cm), have imperfections such as split ends, are a reddish-brown color, are dry and skinny and may split or crack if bent. (5) Washing: The beans are carefully washed in clean water. (6) Dipping: Within no longer than three days following harvest, the beans are submerged in water, that is a precise temperature between 150-170 degrees F., for between 10 seconds and 3 minutes, depending on the experienced determination of a master curer. This step initiates the release of an enzyme that causes glycovanillin to convert into vanillin, which gives the bean its rich flavor. (7) Sweating: The beans are stored inside a lined wooden box for 48 hours. They turn brown and enzymes enable the production of more vanillin. After that, the beans are spread on racks in the hot afternoon sun daily and returned to the sweat box at all other times, including when it is raining. This process lasts for about 2 weeks. (8) Drying: The beans are set out to dry on racks in the open air. Throughout the day they are moved between the sun and the shade because too much sun will dry them too much and destroy the vanillin. Workers periodically massage each individual bean by hand to monitor the moisture content. This lasts for 3-4 weeks. (9) Conditioning: The beans are placed in tightly sealed boxes which are lined with wax paper and held in these boxes at least 1 month. Typically they are shipped during this phase since these boxes are their final stage of storage. (10) Completion: The boxes are opened. The beans are fully cured and appear black and shiny, with a light coating of natural oil. They may in some cases have a delicate coat of white vanillin crystals. The beans can now be counted out into bunches of various numbers, and vacuum packed in preparation for selling them to customers.

review.user_review:
If you like to eat bran cereal and would prefer a more nutritious version of [[ASIN:B000CS9ZY2 Raisin Bran]], this cereal might be for you. A serving is 3/4 cup and has 100 calories, which is similar to the 110 calories for a cup of Raisin Bran.

The ingredients are listed as follows on the box: Wheat Bran, Sugar, Oat Bran, Flaxseed, Honey, Salt, Barley Malt Extract, Natural Flavors, Mixed Tocopherols (Vitamin E) Added For Freshness.

This cereal has a great taste, a terrific, crunchy texture, and using Vitamin E as a preservative is a big plus. However, I do have a couple of complaints about it from a health perspective:

The box simply lists "sugar" and does not tell what kind. There are many different kinds it could be, from white sugar, to evaporated cane sugar, to turbinado, but the fact that the company doesn't spell it out makes me suspect they have used plain, old white sugar.

There are also "natural flavors" in this cereal. A natural flavor is a chemically derived substance which is cheaper to use to create flavor than actual, real food with a real flavor of its own. The definition of natural flavor under the Code of Federal Regulations is: "The essential oil, oleoresin, essence or extractive, protein hydrolysate, distillate, or any product of roasting, heating or enzymolysis, which contains the flavoring constituents derived from a spice, fruit or fruit juice, vegetable or vegetable juice, edible yeast, herb, bark, bud, root, leaf or similar plant material, meat, seafood, poultry, eggs, dairy products, or fermentation products thereof, whose significant function in food is flavoring rather than nutritional" (21CFR101.22). That essentially means that natural flavor is chemically derived from a real food, but the process by which it is derived is anything but "natural," and shrouded in purposeful mystery so that the consumer is lulled into believing a product containing it is far more healthy than it actually is.

I am personally very surprised that this company, so famed for healthy products, has not specified in utter clarity on its label what kind of sugar it has used and how its natural flavors are derived.

review.user_review_title: Works very well for making vegan deli slices and bean burgers
review.user_review:
I checked out a number of brands of vital wheat gluten on Amazon and, unfortunately, I have not found any so far, including this brand, that is organic. That‚Äôs disappointing, given that I like to avoid GMO wheat.

I have made vegan, seitan deli slices using only tofu, and they turn out well, but the texture is so much more authentic when using vital wheat gluten. The goal with vegan deli slices is to achieve a texture very similar to bologna, which has a kind of rubbery texture. When solely using tofu, my recipe only partially achieves that texture. But when I add this VWG, my recipe achieves it 100%. (See below for my recipe.) Note that, by ‚Äúrubbery,‚Äù I don‚Äôt mean to imply that the recipe produces a texture that is hard to chew. On the contrary, it creates a delightfully chewy texture that has a terrific mouth feel.

I had a ball working with dough made from this VWG. It has a texture somewhat similar to modeling clay and feels really good in my hands‚Äîalmost therapeutically so. I highly recommend inviting any children in your life to join in with you if you decide to try out my recipe. Children of all ages will get a kick out of the process of forming seitan dough into individual deli slices.

Note that there are three typical methods of making VWG, vegan, seitan meat substitute: (1) Bake individual slices, (2) Bake a large, cylindrical loaf and saw it into individual, thin, round slices after it cools, (3) Simmer pieces of seitan dough, in the shapes you prefer, in seasoned, vegetable broth. I use method #1 because it involves far less inconvenience compared to method #2, and method #3 doesn‚Äôt create deli slices.

I have included below the recipe I developed, after studying about 10 different seitan, deli-slice recipes. I am happy to report this recipe turned out wonderfully well. Note that the one spice, above all others, that makes seitan taste similar to meat is smoked paprika. Nutritional yeast is also useful for adding a flavor similar to meat or cheese.

I have also successfully made veggie burgers using this VWG. I would include my recipe, as well, but this review is getting too long.

VEGAN SEITAN DELI SLICES WITH TOFU & VITAL WHEAT GLUTEN

Yield: Approximately 40 slices @ 46 calories each

Ingredients

6 cloves garlic
2 tablespoons chia seeds
2 tablespoons flax seeds
2 tablespoons pepitas
2 tablespoons sunflower seeds
1 cup vital wheat gluten (VWG)
2 tablespoons tapioca starch
1/4 cup nutritional yeast
1/4 teaspoon stevia
2 tablespoons tomato powder (or ketchup)
1/4 teaspoon marjoram
1 teaspoon mustard powder
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
2 teaspoons onion powder
2 teaspoons smoked paprika
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon rosemary
1/2 teaspoon sage
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon thyme
1/2 teaspoon turmeric
16 ounces extra firm tofu
1-1/2 tablespoons Bragg‚Äôs aminos OR soy sauce
3 tablespoons agave
1/4 cup tahini (OR 1/4 cup sesame seeds)
2 teaspoons veggie bouillon
3 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
1/2 cup water
1/4 cup coconut oil (OR vegetable oil)

Instructions

1. Place the garlic cloves, chia seeds, flax seeds, pepitas, sunflower seeds, and sesame seeds (if you use them instead of tahini) in a blender and grind them to a coarse powder. Dump the powder into a large bowl. Add all of the dry ingredients to the mixture, whisk them together, and set aside.
2. Drain the tofu, cut it into big chunks and puree it with all of the wet ingredients except the water in a blender.
3. Dump the tofu mixture on top of the dry ingredients. Place the water in the blender and run it on high speed to rinse out the residue of the wet ingredients. Dump this liquid on top of the dry ingredients. Blend all the ingredients using a large, strong spoon or your fingers. It will form a thick, stretchy, somewhat sticky dough.
4. Grease a large silicone baking sheet (or just use your kitchen counter if you don‚Äôt have one) as a working surface. Pour 1/4 cup of coconut oil in a small dish to use for shaping the dough into deli slices.
5. Use 2 tablespoons of dough per deli slice. Form it into a ball, then press it flat, 1/4-inch-thick, shaping it into either a rectangle or a circle. Keep the silicone mat well oiled to prevent the dough from sticking.
6. Place the deli slice on a baking tray that is heavily greased with lots of coconut oil (OR you can also use parchment paper if you have it on hand).
7. Repeat Steps 5 & 6 until all the dough has been used.
8. Bake the slices at 350 degrees for exactly 12 minutes. The goal is to achieve a pliable, somewhat rubbery texture‚ÄîNOT hard or crispy! Place the deli slices on a separate silicone mat to cool down.
9. The deli slices can be served on sandwich bread or diced and sprinkled over a salad. Freeze the leftovers. They thaw quickly.

It arrives fully assembled, which is a blessing, and it is light enough that someone who can't lift much can carry it from room to room.

This ottoman would also make an excellent stool to keep by the front or back door to sit on and put on shoes, and shoes could be stored inside it as well.

review.user_review:
This wireless mouse connects via 2.4G and utilizes a single AA battery.

PROS

1. Attractive design and lovely blue color.
2. Quite lightweight, feels good in my hand.
3. Relatively inexpensive for what you get.
4. Connection is quick and painless. The USB dongle is stored in the battery compartment. You simply remove the dongle, plug it into a USB port, and the mouse is instantly connected
5. This mouse allows for a connection of up to 33 feet. However, I personally cannot imagine a situation in which I would want my mouse to be that far away from my computer.
6. Adjustable DPI of 1600, 1200, or 800.
7. It has an on/off switch and auto-sleep, power-saving mode. This feature is supposed to allow a single AA battery to last up to 12 months.

CONS

1. The auto-sleep, power-saving mode may be good for saving batteries, but if you are using a laptop that has gone to sleep, you will not be able to wake it up with a move of this mouse once it has gone to sleep as well. To get around this issue, you have to wake up the laptop with a key press before the mouse will wake up. It is good to know about this, but it is not a big issue for me personally.
2. This is advertised to be a "silent click noiseless mouse," but I cannot tell much if any difference from other mouses I have owned. This is a minor issue for me.

review.user_review_title: Delightful little fan with many practical uses.
review.user_review:
I got this fan in the pink-and-white color. I personally don't have any complaints about this fan, but there are a lot of features I really like, including:

--This is a very cute, attractive fan. It is a nice, bright pink in the center with white trim.
--This fan is small enough to carry around in a day pack or large purse, which makes it handy to use when going on a hike, walking around an amusement park in the summer, or lifting it to bring it closer to your face just sitting at your desk. It measures about 5 inches in diameter, and weighs only a few ounces.
--It is rechargeable using a white USB cable that comes with the fan. I have recharged it using both my computer or an adapter attached to a wall outlet. It charges quickly either way, and it seems to hold a charge well. The other big plus of it being rechargeable is that I can plug it into a USB hub on my desk and run the fan all day long without worrying about it losing its charge.
--It has a foldaway piece that acts as a stand, similar to what you find on some picture frames. This allows it to stand erect quite sturdily, on a desk or tabletop. This makes it really convenient to use at my desk where the heat from my computer often makes even the combined air flow from air conditioning, a ceiling fan and a small floor fan not enough to keep me cooled off.
--This would make a great emergency fan for a power outage in the summer.
--It has three options for air-flow speed, low, medium and high, which are accessed through the pink, round, toggle switch at the top of the fan. This same switch is the on/off button. This is an extremely convenient feature in such an inexpensive fan.
--This fan is not silent, but I personally consider it very quiet for a portable fan in general. In particular, it is much quieter than either of the small, 9-inch, portable fans I own. One of them, in fact, is so loud, I realized recently that if I sit such that it is within four feet of my head, it actually gives me tinnitus in the ear nearest that fan. Not so with this fan, thank goodness. I currently have it on high speed just 18 inches from my ear, sitting on my desk, and I can barely hear it.

review.user_review:
This 3M, black, privacy filter exists to create "black out" privacy from people passing by your desk from the right or left side, if they approach your computer outside of a 60-degree viewing angle. Be aware that this privacy filter won't protect you from people coming up directly behind you because, of course, if it could, you wouldn't be able to read your screen either. For that situation, you have no choice but the old-fashioned trick of switching to an innocuous window or turning off the monitor in order to preserve your privacy.

As advertised, I can still see my monitor clearly with this filter attached to it, and it even helps to reduce glare.

This privacy filter attaches with either clear adhesive strips or removable slide-mount tabs.

Overall, this filter works well, but the price is hugely inflated.

review.user_review_title: Boxy fit, stiff fabric, and you can‚Äôt return it if you don‚Äôt like it
review.user_review:
The product description says both that the ‚ÄúComfortSoft‚Äù fabric of this T-shirt is 100% cotton and that it is 90% cotton plus 10% polyester. In my perception, the fabric, whichever it might be, is thick, stiff, and doesn't feel like the fabric of any other 100% cotton T-shirt that I own.

On receiving this product, I found out, to my dismay, that the term ‚Äúrelaxed fit‚Äù is apparently a euphemism for a boxy shape. It basically looks like a men's T-shirt, except that it isn‚Äôt as long as a men‚Äôs T-shirt. See the photo I‚Äôve attached of this T-shirt compared to a regular women‚Äôs T-shirt, so you can get an idea of how boxy it is.

I wanted to return this T-shirt, but I found out, to my shock, that you have to pay to return it, and the cost of shipping is almost as much as the price of the T-shirt. I did not realize until this happened that items not purchased from Amazon and shipped by them‚Äîwhich this product is not‚Äîare not eligible for free Kohl's returns.

I found an alternative to this T-shirt that is a much better product, with an actual waistline‚Äîbut it is sized small, so you need to go a size up from what is typical:

Next Level Women's Crew Neck Tee NL6610
ASIN ‚ÄèB07D92L9N7

It has a good price and free shipping but, be aware, it is also not purchased from Amazon and shipped by them, so it would not be cost effective to return it either.

If you want the possibility of trying on either of these two brands of T-shirts and potentially returning them if they do not meet your expectations, I would suggest searching for these brands through the website of a big box store which has a brick-and-mortar store near you that accepts returns.

This is a high-quality T-shirt in an attractive gray/blue color which could be worn either very casually or dressed up with a sport coat. The fabric is smooth and soft and very comfortable. It is 55% polyester, 34% Cotton, and 11% viscose, a type of rayon. It is machine washable, but I personally washed it on cold water and delicate cycle, and I did not feel comfortable about putting it in the dryer. I hung it up to dry. I think any T-shirt, no matter how expensive or high-quality, lasts a lot longer it it is washed cold/delicate and not put in the dryer.

Two issues keep me from giving this T-shirt 5 stars:

It runs small to size, and it has a rather uncomfortable label at the back of the neck that cannot be removed.

review.user_review:
This polo shirt is advertised as "breathable" and "quick dry." Its fabric is 100% polyester and quite thin and flimsy, having what I would call a "sleazy" texture. It resembles a cheap version of the mesh fabric that sportswear is frequently made of.

It confuses me that the manufacturer chose to utilize polyester-mesh, sportswear fabric to create this shirt because polo shirts are not usually worn to work out in, except maybe the light exercise provided by playing golf. It's uncomfortable having a the collar of a polo shirt rubbing against one's sweaty neck when working out hard. It can cause chafing.

Unfortunately, if one wants to use this polo shirt for less casual wear than workouts, I do not personally consider it to be of a high enough quality to be suitable for casual business attire. Aside from the low quality fabric, the shirt is too short for any but the most informal settings. My husband wears it for gardening and low-key errands such as going to the hardware store or grocery shopping.

This shirt supposedly can be machine washed on regular cycle and put in the dryer on low heat, but I personally only wash it in cold water, delicate cycle, and hang it to dry. Cared for in that manner, it has so far survived multiple washings unscathed.

Note that this product is made in China, which might matter to some consumers.

review.user_review_title: A good-looking, casual, lightweight jacket, but a bit short if you are tall
review.user_review:
This is a black jacket made of water-resistant fabric (not waterproof). Fabric like that is useful for being wind-resistant as well. For a supposedly flexible material, this fabric is somewhat stiff and does not feel nearly as soft and comfortable as my husband's lightweight, Lands' End fleece jacket.

There are two patch pockets that are on the outside of the jacket, which I personally don't find as attractive as internal pockets set in a seam. The back tail of the coat is a bit longer than the front, which is a nice feature to give extra coverage. The jacket comes with a tight-fitting inner cuff, created to prevent rain or wind from getting inside the coat. These cuffs fit fairly well if you don't have a thick wrist. If you do, they may be a bit tight.

Vine provided this jacket in Medium, and it fit my husband well. He is 5'9" and 145 lbs. If you are over 6-foot, or you like a jacket long enough to entirely cover your buttocks, this jacket may be too short for you.

review.user_review: I enjoyed the taste of this rice. It's mainly flavored by the parmesan, but it's a nice mellow flavor. Between the brown rice and the beans, the mouthfeel of the product is very fibrous. It gives you something to bite into, and the texture keeps it from being boring.

description: In a tribute to our Italian heritage, we‚Äôve mixed rich, nutty Parmesan, garlic and ground black pepper with whole grain brown rice, white beans and kale. review.user_review:
I really enjoy having the natural scents to fragrant my house. Visitors to my house will often be met with smells stemming from sachets, flowers, and such to lighten up the atmosphere. And I do enjoy the natural fragrance of wood, so I chose these cedar blocks and sachet bags in similar light.
Unfortunately, while I found that they held the wonderful cedar smell, I found them to be too overwhelming for my senses.
Rather than being a more muted and light in tone, the entire room seemed to be saturated with the wood scent to the point that it started to give me a headache. Unless you have a large area to perfume or you prefer the heavy undertones in your fragrance surroundings, you may want to think twice.
Otherwise, these are true to your nose in giving you the ambience either outside of the woods or in the lumbar yard of your local home improvement stores.

review.user_review:
This pair of headphones is hard to beat visually. Love the size and look of the crystals. The crystals do pick up scratches fairly easily, though, and you notice them as you might notice scratches in a clear plastic container. I don't roughly store or handle these and they already look pretty beaten up - a few months old. Most people don't notice it standing a distance away, but it is a bummer how easily these get dinged considering the price you pay to "look nice". The underside of the white leather headband also picks up the dirt and gunk in your hair over time, so it starts turning brown. Luckily, it cleans easily with paper towels and simple cleaning spray.

I listen to plenty of live albums/shows with these, and when there is crowd cheering/laughing, the sound tends to get muddy. If you're using these for music only, the sound is great.

review.user_review_title: Perfect Size for the Little Ones
review.user_review:
This is one of the best backpacks I've come across, especially if you are searching for one that's smaller size.
I originally picked this bag for myself to use in my daily commute, but the little kiddo ended up hijacking this pack instead. Unlike some of the other bags that are too big for the little bodies, this one fit well over the kiddo & was just perfect to take to his elementary school.
The blue/white color design is nice, and appeals to both boys and girls.
The canvas/fabric material of this backpack is sturdy, and the compartments/bag stays upright (instead of folding in on itself) which helps the kiddo put things away more easily.
The zippers on this bag glide smooth and has yet to get stuck, and the zipper tabs provide a good grip for little fingers.
Cleaning is easy (especially if you have a messy and disorganized child like I do); I just wipe up any mess inside. And since the exterior is water resistant, things have stayed much cleaner on this bag than any others.
The straps are easy to adjust and comfortable, and the fitting stayed as is (without loosening over time).
There is a feel of good quality to this bag, and I do consider this backpack one of my favorite finds.

review.user_review_title: Thin and soft material, a bit boxy
review.user_review: This front tie top is very soft and flows nicely over the body, though fits a bit boxier than I imagined it would. The material is very light and soft, though again, slicker than I expected. It is thin fabric, and in red is slightly see through but not so much that I would feel the need to wear a cami underneath. The red appears like a cherry tomato red in person.  The sleeves can be rolled down and be worn at full length, though I think the look is better with it rolled up and buttoned, as pictured. Fairly basic cut overall. I have a longer torso and knew I might be taking a risk of exposing some belly with this type of front tie shirt, but I think that it hits at a pretty decent spot on my body, and would be fine as long as I'm careful with what it is paired with. Overall fits as expected. Pretty decent top that'll make a nice addition to my wardrobe.

review.user_review: Beautiful, simple classic bag. The PU leather feels so soft and supple, and looks very nice quality. The zippers and buckles for the straps look sleek and adds a nice touch of class. Fabric lining on the inside with a couple pockets good for your eyeglasses or whatnot, and a zippered inner and outer pocket. Also love the length of the crossbody strap. I like to wear my purses crossbody hanging low, and some purses come with shorter straps that technically cross but hits pretty high on my hip. Checked the dimensions with a ruler before I got this to make sure that it would fit my needs, and although I did misjudge the height - my error as I forgot to account for the scooped shape of the top - it still works and fits everything I need. Very happy that I got this bag.

review.user_review_title: Mikasa Reflections LED Candle with Realistic Flame
review.user_review:
This gives a fairly realistic flickering candle flame with a seemingly real wax candle. It looks very nice when turned on but is obviously fake when not in use. Still, I like it. It really warms up a room (not in a heated sort of way but ambiance) and is very attractive. I like candles but rarely use them because I have kids and really don't want to take any chances with fire sources in the house. And also because candles are messy - the Mikasa LED candle is very neat and clean with no melting wax.

My candle came with a black push button attached to two wires. If I pushed the button the candle would light up as long as the button was pushed. I removed it from the candle because there was no use for it. I think it was accidentally left on from testing in the factory. The candle takes two C-size batteries but I have adapters that will let me use AA batteries. I'll use these after the included C batteries are dead. It supposedly can be turned on and off remotely but you have to buy the remote control separately. I already have too many remote controls cluttering up the place so I'm happy just using the switch on the bottom of the candle. I think this is a very safe and beautiful way to get the look of a burning candle without the fire hazard.

UPDATE 10.7.17 - I really like this candle a LOT. We've been using it nearly every evening and it has really grown on us. I love the soft candle-like light it emits and am putting this on my wish list for more.

The dual beam allows the "flame" to dance more realistically than traditional LED candles. Made from real wax, this flameless candle can be used without having to worry of an open flame. Absolutely no fire hazards or burning risks, safe for families with pet(s) or young child(ren). This LED candle will create realistic burning illumination. review.user_review_title: Installed and Operating in Our Single Residential Home!
review.user_review:
As of this time, 6.20.12, I have done some research on the Levitron 32120-1, surge panel. I took it with me to our local Power Board last weekend while attending the annual meeting, and spoke with some electricians there. I was told this product should work well with my home since it also has a 120 volt single phase line. I was also told that this surge panel is like the Cadillac of surge panels. My house is pretty typical, 3 bdrm, 2 bath, etc... and it's not attached to any other buildings. I made an appointment with a licensed, certified electrician to come over this afternoon to install it. I was given an estimated cost of around $125.00, depending on how many circuits in the breaker box need to be moved around to make room for the Leviton surge panel. He also says it will work fine for residential, however the acid test will be when he gets here, sees it, and tries to install it.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

INSTALLATION: The electrician left about 15 minutes ago and it took him approximately 30 minutes to install the Leviton 32120 Surge Protector. It cost me $125.00 to have it installed. He only had good things to say about it, to the extent that he didn't think the one he installed on his own home was quite this good. He continued to say that "Leviton" is about the best in surge protection.

It looks very nice where he attached it to the wall in our garage underneath the circuit breaker box. It is large enough that it won't fit inside the breaker box and must be mounted on the wall beside/underneath it and has it's own circuit breaker dedicated to it. I will try to upload a video of it so you can see what it looks like after it's installed.

He explained to me that this device will take a surge of electrical energy, assuming it is of enough voltage to trigger the capacitors to absorb the electricity and stop the flow from going beyond it into your house. If the surge is not high enough to trigger a stop, it will let it pass on through unobstructed. For instance, when the refrigerator turns off, there is a momentary back flow of electrons (electricity) and this is below the amount required for the Leviton to react. But once it has taken a hit, it can no longer be used again and must be replaced with another surge protector. If it does take a hit, then one or more of the two green LED lights (both on during normal function), will be OFF, the red LED will flash and the audible tone will be activated. If that should occur, I am to flip the breaker switch to the OFF position. So, not only does it give a visible indicator, but also an audible one.

He stressed that this was a very good product and is excellent insurance against an electrical overload, whether it be from a lightning strike or a surge through the lines.

I will update this review as I recall other things he mentioned about it, but I think I got the jist of it and hopefully it will be of use to anyone considering buying one of these. Personally, I feel better knowing that our house and it's electronics are much better protected than they had been. We have always been very good about running through the house and unplugging all the electronics and appliances when a electrical/thunderstorm was passing through. He said if you are out of town, or away from home you won't have to worry nearly so much about the electronics because the Leviton should catch just about anything unless it's beyond it's specs. He added that having additional surge suppressors on your sensitive electronics - computer, TV, stereo, etc... will give an added layer of protection.

I will be glad to be able to watch the weather radar on TV when a heavy storm is passing through to see where it's going and not have to unplug the TV for fear of it getting fried when the bright, white light flashes outside. I know that the Leviton can't stop 100% of all electrical surges, but it does give a layer of comfort that we didn't have before. If you want total protection, then those surge protectors can cost thousands of dollars.

description: Product Description

4.25 INCH W X 3.25 INCH D X 7.5 INCH H SIZE; BRANCH PANEL USED ON; 50/60 HZ FREQUENCY RATING; 12 AWG LEAD WIRE CONNECTION TYPE; UL (CANADA AND US) APPROVAL; COMMERCIAL, INDUSTRIAL APPLICATION; 120/240 VAC VOLTAGE RATING; PANEL MOUNTING; NEMA 3R ENCLOSURE
From the Manufacturer

Leviton's Surge Protection Devices can be used individually or as part of a coordinated application strategy, to protect sensitive electronic equipment, in industrial, commercial and residential locations, from the stress and degradation inflicted by voltage transients. review.user_review:
I can't get this system loud enough to please me. I often like my music loud and raucousy! It says 40 watts but if you want some volume to fill up your room I don't think you'll be happy with this system. Right now I'm listening to, "Boogaloo Chevere" (tropical) and I have it cranked up to full volume and it's just not coming through like I expected. I have the sub-woofer bass turned full volume but I hear little bass and the horns and voices sound squeezed and strained. I'm thinking that the cheesy-thin auxiliary 3.5 mm input cable that comes with this system might be the reason. It's very thin and weak. Definitely needs to be more robust. Granted, I'm listening to music on my PC downloaded from I-tunes, but I think the set of 25 watt Logitech speakers (Logitech Z313 Speaker System) I had on before sounded better and at 1/3 the price of these. Where's my 40 watts of power here?!

I have this system set up straight from the box using what was included. The speakers are supposedly wall-mountable but no hardware was included so they're sitting on my desk, one on each side of monitor. The sub-woofer tower is underneath my desk and even with the bass turned up full I can only detect minimal bass output from it aurally and when I put my hand over the top of it I can barely feel any vibrations coming from it. I'm really kind of disappointed......why did they include such a cheap audio cable???

The satellite speakers look basically like a pair of binoculars turned up on their side. They look alright and are steady enough on their stands. I don't think I would mount these things on the wall anyway. I haven't tried connecting 3 different inputs yet, just my PC, but you can hook up to 3 external devices. The control knob is easy to use. You have to turn the big black knob to control the volume and to turn it completely off. The sub-woofer control knob is also on the main control knob. I have my control knob lying on floor beside my CPU. I have to reach down and pick it up to use it or else deal with having more cables on my desk.

My biggest disappointment is the way the classical guitar comes across on this system. I have to have the volume turned on nearly full blast to try to hear all the tones and colors of the instrument. My own home classical guitar recordings come across very weak and muted out as compared to the sounds on the Z313 system. Believe me, I am not hard of hearing and can hear a fly pooter, so I know what sounds clear and loud and what does not. But again, I think it's due to the cheap cable. I'm going to find a much better cable, try it out and report back. So for now, the 3 star stays.

UPDATE 9.28.12
I bought a Monster cable for twenty dollars and it only helps improve the sound minimally. I'm really surprised that this is the most volume I can get for 40 watts. It still gets loud for most types of music, but the classical guitar just doesn't carry as well on these speakers as it does on the cheaper set of speakers I had before.

review.user_review_title: Leather Architect Men's 100% Leather Card Holder with RFID Blocking
review.user_review:
When I got this leather card holder in the mail yesterday I immediately took all the stuff out of my old wallet and put it into this. My driver's license fit perfectly in the window compartment in the front flap (there's a window compartment in the back flap too) and there was enough room to fit another card underneath it. I used the 12 inner plastic pockets to hold my various other cards. I don't know if these plastic card pockets will disintegrate over time like other similar card holders have, so we'll see later on about that. The paper money compartment won't hold bills full length so they have to folded in half, but it will still hold a lot, so this card holder can be used as a wallet too.

Although this card holder (wallet to me) is advertised as a men's accessory, I like it because it's smaller and takes up less room in my purse/backpack, holds all my stuff just fine, is cute and well-constructed out of leather and is supposed to block RFID scanners. If it holds up well after a few months of use I will probably up the star level from 4 to 5.
